Original: الفصل اللول جدود يسوع المسيح
Original Translation: The Family Line of Jesus
Translated Sentence: Chapter One The ancestors of Jesus Christ

Original: هادو هم سميات جدود يسوع المسيح بن داود بن إبراهيم:
Original Translation: This is a record of the family line of Jesus Christ. He is the son of David. He is also the son of Abraham.
Translated Sentence: This is the genealogy of Jesus Christ, the son of David, the son of Abraham:

Original: إبراهيم ولد إسحاق، وإسحاق ولد يعقوب، ويعقوب ولد يهودا وخوته،
Original Translation: Abraham was the father of Isaac.  Isaac was the father of Jacob.  Jacob was the father of Judah and his brothers.
Translated Sentence: Abraham was the father of Isaac, Isaac the father of Jacob, Jacob the father of Judah and his brothers,

Original: ويهودا ولد فارص وزارح من تامار، وفارص ولد حصرون، وحصرون ولد أرام،
Original Translation: Judah was the father of Perez and Zerah. Tamar was their mother.  Perez was the father of Hezron.  Hezron was the father of Ram.
Translated Sentence: Judah the father of Pherez and Zara, whose mother was Tamar, Pherez the father of Hezron, Hezron the father of Aram,

Original: وأرام ولد عميناداب، وعميناداب ولد نحشون، ونحشون ولد سلمون،
Original Translation: Ram was the father of Amminadab.  Amminadab was the father of Nahshon.  Nahshon was the father of Salmon.
Translated Sentence: Aram the son of Amminadab, Amminadab the son of Nahshon, Nahshon the son of Salmon,

Original: وسلمون ولد بوعز من راحاب، وبوعز ولد عوبيد من راعوت، وعوبيد ولد يسى.
Original Translation: Salmon was the father of Boaz. Rahab was Boaz's mother.  Boaz was the father of Obed. Ruth was Obed's mother.  Obed was the father of Jesse.
Translated Sentence: and Simeon the father of Boaz, from Rahab; Boaz the father of Obed, from Ravoth; Obed the father of Jesse.

Original: ويسى ولد داود الملك.  وداود ولد سليمان من المراة اللي كان مزوج بيها أوريا،
Original Translation: And Jesse was the father of King David. David was the father of Solomon. Solomon's mother had been Uriah's wife.
Translated Sentence: and Jesse the father of King David. David the father of Solomon (the father was Uriah's wife),

Original: وسليمان ولد رحبعام، ورحبعام ولد أبيا، وأبيا ولد آساف،
Original Translation: Solomon was the father of Rehoboam.  Rehoboam was the father of Abijah.  Abijah was the father of Asa.
Translated Sentence: Solomon the father of Rehoboam, Rehoboam the father of Abijah, Abijah the father of Asaph,

Original: وآساف ولد يهوشافاط، ويهوشافاط ولد يورام، ويورام ولد عزيا،
Original Translation: Asa was the father of Jehoshaphat.  Jehoshaphat was the father of Jehoram.  Jehoram was the father of Uzziah.
Translated Sentence: and Asaph the son of Jehoshaphat, and Jehoshaphat the son of Joram, and Joram the son of Uzziah,

Original: وعزيا ولد يوتام، ويوتام ولد أحاز، وأحاز ولد حزقيا،
Original Translation: Uzziah was the father of Jotham.  Jotham was the father of Ahaz.  Ahaz was the father of Hezekiah.
Translated Sentence: Uzziah the father of Jotham, Jotham the father of Ahaz, Ahaz the father of Hezekiah,

Original: وحزقيا ولد منسى، ومنسى ولد عاموس، وعاموس ولد يوشيا،
Original Translation: Hezekiah was the father of Manasseh.  Manasseh was the father of Amon.  Amon was the father of Josiah.
Translated Sentence: Hezekiah the son of Manasseh, Manasseh the son of Amoz, Amoz the son of Josiah,

Original: ويوشيا ولد يكنيا وخوته فالوقت اللي كانو فيه ليهود منفيين فبلاد بابل.
Original Translation: And Josiah was the father of Jeconiah and his brothers. At that time, the Jewish people were forced to go away to Babylon.
Translated Sentence: Josiah was born to his brothers during the time of the Jewish exile in Babylon.

Original: ومن بعدما رجعو ليهود من بابل، يكنيا ولد شألتيئيل، وشألتيئيل ولد زربابل،
Original Translation: After this, the family line continued.  Jeconiah was the father of Shealtiel.  Shealtiel was the father of Zerubbabel.
Translated Sentence: After the exile from Babylon, Bechan was the son of Shealtiel, Shealtiel the son of Zerubbabel,

Original: وزربابل ولد أبيهود، وأبيهود ولد ألياقيم، وألياقيم ولد عازور،
Original Translation: Zerubbabel was the father of Abiud.  Abiud was the father of Eliakim.  Eliakim was the father of Azor.
Translated Sentence: Zerubbabel the father of Ebed, Ebed the father of Eliakim, Eliakim the father of Azariah,

Original: وعازور ولد صادوق، وصادوق ولد أخيم، وأخيم ولد أليود،
Original Translation: Azor was the father of Zadok.  Zadok was the father of Akim.  Akim was the father of Eliud.
Translated Sentence: the son of Zadok, the son of Achim, the son of Eliud,

Original: وأليود ولد أليعازر، وأليعازر ولد متان، ومتان ولد يعقوب،
Original Translation: Eliud was the father of Eleazar.  Eleazar was the father of Matthan.  Matthan was the father of Jacob.
Translated Sentence: Eliud the father of Eleazar, Eleazar the father of Methan, Methan the father of Jacob,

Original: ويعقوب ولد يوسف راجل مريم اللي ولدات يسوع اللي تسمى المسيح.
Original Translation: Jacob was the father of Joseph. Joseph was the husband of Mary. And Mary gave birth to Jesus, who is called Christ.
Translated Sentence: and Jacob the father of Joseph, the husband of Mary, of whom was born Jesus, who is called Christ.

Original: الجيال كلهم من إبراهيم حتى لداود ربعطاشر جيل، ومن داود حتى للوقت اللي تنفاو فيه ليهود لبابل ربعطاشر جيل. ومن الوقت اللي تنفاو فيه لبابل حتى للولادة د المسيح ربعطاشر جيل. الولادة ديال يسوع المسيح
Original Translation: So there were 14 generations from Abraham to David. There were 14 from David until the Jewish people were forced to go away to Babylon. And there were 14 from that time to the Christ. Jesus Christ Is Born
Translated Sentence: Thus there were fourteen generations in all from Abraham to David, fourteen from David to the exile to Babylon, and fourteen from the exile to the birth of the Christ.

Original: وهكا كانت الولادة د يسوع المسيح: ملي كانت مريم مه مخطوبة ليوسف، وقبل ما تزوج بيه، تصابت حاملة بقدرة الروح القدس. لوقا
Original Translation: This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about. His mother Mary and Joseph had promised to get married. But before they started to live together, it became clear that she was going to have a baby. She became pregnant by the power of the Holy Spirit.
Translated Sentence: This is how the birth of Jesus Christ came about: Mary, Mary's fiancée, was found to be with child through the Holy Spirit, before they were married.

Original: وكان يوسف خطيبها راجل متاقي الله وما بغاش يفضحها، وقرر باش يتفرق معاها فالسر.
Original Translation: Her husband Joseph was a godly man. He did not want to put her to shame in public. So he planned to divorce her quietly.
Translated Sentence: Because Joseph, her fiancé, was a righteous man and did not want to expose her to public disgrace, he decided to divorce her quietly.

Original: وملي كان كيفكر فهادشي، بان ليه فالمنام واحد الملاك ديال الرب وݣال ليه: «آ يوسف بن داود، ما تخافش تتزوج بمريم، حيت هاداك اللي حاملة بيه، راه هو بقدرة الروح القدس،
Original Translation: But as Joseph was thinking about this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream. The angel said, "Joseph, son of David, don't be afraid to take Mary home as your wife. The baby inside her is from the Holy Spirit.
Translated Sentence: But while he was thinking on this, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream and said, "Joseph son of David, do not be afraid to take Mary home as your wife, because what is conceived in her is from the Holy Spirit.

Original: وراها غتولد ولد ونت غتسميه يسوع، حيت هو اللي غينجي الشعب دياله من دنوبهم». لوقا
Original Translation: She is going to have a son. You must give him the name Jesus. That is because he will save his people from their sins."
Translated Sentence: She will give birth to a son, and you are to give him the name Jesus, because he will save his people from their sins".

Original: وهادشي كله جرا باش يتحقق كلام الرب بلسان النبي اللي ݣال:
Original Translation: All of this took place to bring about what the Lord had said would happen. He had said through the prophet,
Translated Sentence: All this took place to fulfill what the Lord had said through the prophet:

Original: «ها العزبة غتحمل، وتولد ولد، ويتسمى عمانوئيل»، اللي المعنى دياله: الله معانا.
Original Translation: "The virgin is going to have a baby. She will give birth to a son. And he will be called Immanuel." (Isaiah 7:14) The name Immanuel means "God with us."
Translated Sentence: "The virgin will be with child and will give birth to a son, and they will call him Immanuel " (which means", God with us ").

Original: وملي فاق يوسف من النعاس، دار كما وصاه ملاك الرب وتزوج بمريم،
Original Translation: Joseph woke up. He did what the angel of the Lord commanded him to do. He took Mary home as his wife.
Translated Sentence: When Joseph woke up, he did what the angel of the Lord had commanded him and took Mary home as his wife.

Original: ولكن ما دخلش بيها حتى ولدات ولد، وسماه يسوع. لوقا 2‏:21
Original Translation: But he did not make love to her until after she gave birth to a son. And Joseph gave him the name Jesus.
Translated Sentence: But he had no union with her until she gave birth to a son. And he gave him the name Jesus.

Original: الفصل التاني العلما د النجوم جاو يشوفو يسوع
Original Translation: The Wise Men Visit Jesus
Translated Sentence: Chapter Two: The Magi Came to See Jesus

Original: وملي تزاد يسوع فبيت لحم اللي فبلاد اليهودية، فعهد الملك هيرودس، جاو من الشرق لأورشليم شي علما د النجوم
Original Translation: Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea. This happened while Herod was king of Judea.  After Jesus' birth, Wise Men from the east came to Jerusalem.
Translated Sentence: After Jesus was born in Bethlehem in Judea, during the time of King Herod, Magi from the east came to Jerusalem

Original: كيسولو: «فين هو ملك ليهود اللي تزاد؟ حيت شفنا النجمة دياله طالعة فالشرق وجينا باش نسجدو ليه».
Original Translation: They asked, "Where is the child who has been born to be king of the Jews? When we were in the east, we saw his star. Now we have come to worship him."
Translated Sentence: and asked, "Where is the one who has been born king of the Jews? We saw his star in the east and have come to worship him".

Original: وملي سمع الملك هيرودس هادشي، خاف هو وݣاع الناس اللي فأورشليم.
Original Translation: When King Herod heard about it, he was very upset. Everyone in Jerusalem was troubled too.
Translated Sentence: When King Herod heard this, he was disturbed, and all Jerusalem with him.

Original: وناض جمع الرؤسا د رجال الدين والعلما د الشرع كلهم، وسولهم: «فين غيتولد المسيح؟».
Original Translation: So Herod called together all the chief priests of the people. He also called the teachers of the law. He asked them where the Christ was going to be born.
Translated Sentence: So he called together all the chief priests and teachers of the law and asked them where the Christ was to be born.

Original: وجاوبوه: «فبيت لحم اللي فبلاد اليهودية، حيت هادشي اللي كتب عليه النبي ملي ݣال:
Original Translation: "In Bethlehem in Judea," they replied. "This is what the prophet has written. He said,
Translated Sentence: "In Bethlehem in the land of Judea, " they replied". This is what the prophet has written:

Original: ونت آ بيت لحم، اللي فبلاد يهودا،  راك ماشي نت هي الصغيرة فمدون يهودا،  حيت منك غادي يخرج رئيس  غيحكم الشعب ديالي إسرائيل».
Original Translation: " 'But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judah,  are certainly not the least important among the towns of Judah.  A ruler will come out of you.  He will be the shepherd of my people Israel.' " (Micah 5:2)
Translated Sentence: "' But you, Bethlehem, in the land of Judea, are by no means the smallest of the rulers of Judea; for out of you will come a ruler who will be the shepherd of my people Israel. '"

Original: ومن بعد صيفط هيرودس على العلما د النجوم فالسر، وتحقق منهم على الوقت اللي بانت فيه النجمة.
Original Translation: Then Herod called for the Wise Men secretly. He found out from them exactly when the star had appeared.
Translated Sentence: Then Herod called the Magi secretly and found out from them the exact time the star had appeared.

Original: ومن بعد صيفطهم لبيت لحم وݣال ليهم: «سيرو قلبو مزيان على الولد. وملي تلقاوه، أجيو خبروني باش حتى أنا نمشي ونسجد ليه».
Original Translation: He sent them to Bethlehem. He said, "Go! Make a careful search for the child. As soon as you find him, bring me a report. Then I can go and worship him too."
Translated Sentence: He sent them to Bethlehem and said, "Go and see how the child is. When you have found him, report to me, so that I too may go and worship him".

Original: وملي سمعو كلام الملك، مشاو. وهي تبان ليهم النجمة اللي كانو شافوها فالشرق، وبقات غادية قدامهم حتى وصلات للموضع فين كان الولد ووقفات.
Original Translation: After the Wise Men had listened to the king, they went on their way. The star they had seen when they were in the east went ahead of them. It finally stopped over the place where the child was.
Translated Sentence: After they heard the king, they went on their way. And look! the star they had seen in the east was going ahead of them until it stopped where the child was.

Original: وغير شافو النجمة، فرحو بزاف.
Original Translation: When they saw the star, they were filled with joy.
Translated Sentence: When they saw the star, they were overjoyed.

Original: وملي دخلو للدار، شافو الولد ومه مريم، وهم يركعو وسجدو ليه، وحلو صنادقهم وهداو ليه الدهب واللبان والمسك الحر.
Original Translation: The Wise Men went to the house. There they saw the child with his mother Mary. They bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures. They gave him gold, incense and myrrh.
Translated Sentence: On coming to the house, they saw the child with Mary his mother, and they bowed down and worshiped him. Then they opened their treasures and presented him with gifts of gold and of incense and of myrrh.

Original: وملي نبهم الرب فالمنام باش ما يرجعوش لعند هيرودس، شدو طريق خرى ورجعو لبلادهم. العائلة ديال يسوع كتهرب لمصر
Original Translation: But God warned them in a dream not to go back to Herod. So they returned to their country on a different road. Jesus' Family Escapes to Egypt
Translated Sentence: And having been warned in a dream not to return to Herod, they returned to their country by another way.

Original: ومن بعدما مشاو العلما، بان ملاك الرب ليوسف فالمنام وݣال ليه: «نوض وخد الولد ومه وهرب لمصر، وبقى تم حتى نݣول ليك وقتاش خاصك ترجع، حيت هيرودس غادي يقلب على الولد باش يقتله».
Original Translation: When the Wise Men had left, Joseph had a dream. In the dream an angel of the Lord appeared to him. "Get up!" the angel said. "Take the child and his mother and escape to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you to come back. Herod is going to search for the child. He wants to kill him."
Translated Sentence: After the wise men left, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream. "Get up, " he said", take the child and his mother and flee to Egypt. Stay there until I tell you, for Herod is going to search for the child to kill him".

Original: وناض يوسف وخدا الولد ومه بالليل ومشاو لمصر.
Original Translation: Joseph got up. During the night, he left for Egypt with the child and his mother Mary.
Translated Sentence: So he got up, took the child and his mother during the night and left for Egypt,

Original: وبقى تم حتى مات هيرودس باش يتحقق كلام الرب على لسان النبي اللي ݣال: «من مصر عيطت على ولدي». هيرودس كيقتل الدراري الصغار
Original Translation: They stayed there until King Herod died. So the words the Lord had spoken through the prophet came true. He had said, "I chose to bring my son out of Egypt." (Hosea 11:1)
Translated Sentence: where he stayed until the death of Herod. And so was fulfilled what the Lord had said through the prophet: "Out of Egypt I called my son".

Original: وملي شاف هيرودس بلي العلما د النجوم لعبو بيه، تقلق بزاف وآمر باش يتقتلو ݣاع الدراري اللي فبيت لحم والنواحي ديالها من ولد عامين للتحت، حيت هادي هي المدة اللي دازت على الوقت اللي عرفه من العلما د النجوم،
Original Translation: Herod realized that the Wise Men had tricked him. So he became very angry. He gave orders concerning Bethlehem and the area around it. All the boys two years old and under were to be killed. This agreed with the time when the Wise Men had seen the star.
Translated Sentence: When Herod realized that he had been outwitted by the Magi, he was furious, and he gave orders to kill all the boys in Bethlehem and its vicinity who were two years old and under, in accordance with the time he had learned from the Magi.

Original: وهكا تحقق كلام الرب على لسان النبي إرميا اللي ݣال:
Original Translation: In this way, the words the prophet Jeremiah spoke came true. He had said,
Translated Sentence: Then what was spoken through the prophet Jeremiah was fulfilled:

Original: «من الرامة تسمع غوات،  بكا ونواح كتير،  راحيل كتبكي على ولادها  وما بغاتش اللي يعزيها،  حيت ولادها ماتو». العائلة ديال يسوع كترجع من مصر
Original Translation: "A voice is heard in Ramah.  It's the sound of crying and deep sadness.  Rachel is crying over her children.  She refuses to be comforted,  because they are gone." (Jeremiah 31:15) Jesus' Family Returns to Nazareth
Translated Sentence: "A voice was heard in Ramah, weeping and great mourning, Rachel weeping for her children and refusing to be comforted, because they are no more.

Original: وملي مات هيرودس بان ملاك الرب ليوسف فالمنام وهو فمصر،
Original Translation: After Herod died, Joseph had a dream while he was still in Egypt. In the dream an angel of the Lord appeared to him.
Translated Sentence: After Herod died, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in sleep in Egypt.

Original: وݣال ليه: «نوض خد الولد ومه ورجع لبلاد إسرائيل، حيت هادوك اللي كانو باغيين يقتلو الولد ماتو».
Original Translation: The angel said, "Get up! Take the child and his mother. Go to the land of Israel. Those who were trying to kill the child are dead."
Translated Sentence: "Get up, " he said", take the child and go to the land of Israel, for those who were trying to take the child's life are dead".

Original: وناض يوسف وخدا الولد ومه ورجع لبلاد إسرائيل.
Original Translation: So Joseph got up. He took the child and his mother Mary back to the land of Israel.
Translated Sentence: So he got up, took the child and his mother and went to the land of Israel.

Original: ولكن ملي سمع بلي أرخيلاوس ولى كيحكم فبلاد اليهودية فبلاصة هيرودس باه، خاف يرجع لتم. وحيت نبهه الله فالمنام مشى لجوايه الجليل.
Original Translation: But then he heard that Archelaus was king of Judea. Archelaus was ruling in place of his father Herod. This made Joseph afraid to go there.  Warned in a dream, Joseph went back to the land of Galilee instead.
Translated Sentence: But when he heard that Archelaus was reigning in Judea in place of Herod, he was afraid to go there. Having been warned in a dream, he withdrew to Galilee,

Original: وجا لواحد المدينة سميتها الناصرة وسكن فيها، باش يتحقق كلام الله على لسان الأنبيا اللي ݣالو: «غادي يتسمى ناصري». مرقس 1‏:24؛ لوقا 2‏:39؛ يوحنا 1‏:45
Original Translation: There he lived in a town called Nazareth. So what the prophets had said about Jesus came true. They had said, "He will be called a Nazarene."
Translated Sentence: and he went and lived in a town called Nazareth. So was fulfilled what was said through the prophets: "He will be called a Nazarene".

Original: الفصل التالت يوحنا المعمدان كيوجد الطريق ليسوع
Original Translation: John the Baptist Prepares the Way
Translated Sentence: Chapter Three John the Baptist prepares the way for Jesus

Original: وفديك ليام، جا يوحنا المعمدان للصحرا ديال بلاد اليهودية كيخبر الناس،
Original Translation: In those days John the Baptist came and preached in the Desert of Judea.
Translated Sentence: In those days John the Baptist came, preaching in the desert of Judea

Original: وكيݣول ليهم: «توبو، راه الوقت ديال مملكة السماوات قرب». متى
Original Translation: He said, "Turn away from your sins! The kingdom of heaven is near."
Translated Sentence: "Repent, " he said". The kingdom of heaven is near".

Original: وهادا هو الراجل اللي تكلم عليه النبي إشعيا ملي ݣال:  «صوت كيبرح فالصحرا وكيݣول:  وجدو طريق الرب  وقادو طرقانه».
Original Translation: John is the one the prophet Isaiah had spoken about. He had said, "A messenger is calling out in the desert,  'Prepare the way for the Lord.  Make straight paths for him.' " (Isaiah 40:3)
Translated Sentence: This is he who was spoken of through Isaiah the prophet: "A voice of one calling in the desert,' Make straight the way for the Lord, make his paths straight. '"

Original: وكان لباس يوحنا من شعر الجمال، والحزام باش كيتحزم من الجلد، وكيعيش بالجراد والعسل الحر.
Original Translation: John's clothes were made out of camel's hair. He had a leather belt around his waist. His food was locusts and wild honey.
Translated Sentence: John wore clothing made of camel's hair, with a leather belt around his waist, and he ate locusts and wild honey.

Original: وكانو الناس كيجيو لعنده من أورشليم ومن بلاد اليهودية كلها، وݣاع النواحي ديال واد الأردن،
Original Translation: People went out to him from Jerusalem and all of Judea. They also came from the whole area around the Jordan River.
Translated Sentence: People came to him from Jerusalem, all Judea and the whole region of the Jordan.

Original: وتعمدو فواد الأردن على يده، وهم كيعترفو بدنوبهم.
Original Translation: When they admitted they had sinned, John baptized them in the Jordan.
Translated Sentence: They are baptized in the Jordan River by his hand, confessing their sins.

Original: وملي شاف يوحنا بزاف د الناس من الفريسيين والصدوقيين كيجيو لعنده باش يعمدهم، ݣال ليهم: «آ تريكة اللفاعي، شكون اللي نبهكم باش تهربو من غضب الله اللي جاي؟ متى
Original Translation: John saw many Pharisees and Sadducees coming to where he was baptizing. He said to them, "You are like a nest of poisonous snakes! Who warned you to escape the coming of God's anger?
Translated Sentence: But when he saw many of the Pharisees and Sadducees coming to where he was baptizing, he said to them: "You brood of vipers! Who warned you to flee from the coming wrath?

Original: إيوا بينو التوبة ديالكم بأعمالكم المزيانة،
Original Translation: Produce fruit that shows you have turned away from your sins.
Translated Sentence: Show your repentance by your good deeds.

Original: وما تبداوش تݣولو مع راسكم: بانا هو إبراهيم. نݣول ليكم: راه الله قادر باش يدير من هاد الحجر ولاد لإبراهيم. يوحنا
Original Translation: Don't think you can say to yourselves, 'Abraham is our father.' I tell you, God can raise up children for Abraham even from these stones.
Translated Sentence: And do not think you can say to yourselves, 'We have Abraham.' For I tell you that out of these stones God can raise up children for Abraham.

Original: ودابا ها الفاس محطوط على جدر الشجر، وكل شجرة ما كتعطيش غلة مزيانة تقطع وترمى فالعافية. متى
Original Translation: The ax is already lying at the roots of the trees. All the trees that don't produce good fruit will be cut down. They will be thrown into the fire.
Translated Sentence: This tree is always on the tree walls, and every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and thrown into the trash.

Original: أنا غادي نعمدكم بالما باش توبو، ولكن اللي غادي يجي من بعد مني هو قوى مني، وما نستاهلش نحيد حتى صباطه. هو غادي يعمدكم بالروح القدس والعافية،
Original Translation: "I baptize you with water, calling you to turn away from your sins. But after me, one will come who is more powerful than I am. And I'm not fit to carry his sandals. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with fire.
Translated Sentence: I indeed baptize you with water for repentance. But he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose sandals I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you with the Holy Spirit and with water.

Original: وفيده المدرة غيدري بيها دراسه وغيجمع الݣمح فخزاينه، أما التبن راه غيحرقه بالعافية اللي عمرها ما غتطفا». يوحنا كيعمد يسوع
Original Translation: His pitchfork is in his hand to clear the straw from his threshing floor. He will gather his wheat into the storeroom. But he will burn up the husks with fire that can't be put out." Jesus Is Baptized
Translated Sentence: The wheat is collected in the barn, but the tares are burned in the unquenchable fire. John the Baptist baptizes Jesus.

Original: ومن بعد، جا يسوع من الجليل حتى لواد الأردن لعند يوحنا باش يعمده.
Original Translation: Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan River. He wanted to be baptized by John.
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus came from Galilee to the Jordan to be baptized by John.

Original: ولكن يوحنا ما خلاهش وݣال ليه: «أنا اللي محتاج ليك تعمدني، ونت جاي لعندي نعمدك؟».
Original Translation: But John tried to stop him. He told Jesus, "I need to be baptized by you. So why do you come to me?"
Translated Sentence: But John tried to stop him, saying, "I need to be baptized by you, and do you come to me?"

Original: وجاوبه يسوع وݣال ليه: «غير سمح بهادشي دابا، راه واجب علينا نكملو مراد الله». وهو يسمح ليه يوحنا باش يتعمد.
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Let it be this way for now. It is right for us to do this. It carries out God's holy plan." Then John agreed.
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Let it be so now; it is proper for us to do everything God requires".

Original: وغير تعمد يسوع، طلع من الما، وهم يتحلو السماوات وشاف روح الله نازل بحال الحمامة وتحط عليه.
Original Translation: As soon as Jesus was baptized, he came up out of the water. At that moment heaven was opened. Jesus saw the Spirit of God coming down on him like a dove.
Translated Sentence: As soon as Jesus was baptized, he went up out of the water. At once the heavens were opened, and he saw the Spirit of God descending like a dove and lighting on him.

Original: وتسمع صوت من السماوات كيݣول: «هادا هو ولدي العزيز اللي بيه فرحت بزاف». متى 12‏:18؛ 17‏:5؛ مرقس 1‏:11؛ لوقا 9‏:35
Original Translation: A voice from heaven said, "This is my Son, and I love him. I am very pleased with him."
Translated Sentence: And a voice from heaven said, "This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased".

Original: الفصل الرابع إبليس كيجرب يسوع
Original Translation: Jesus Is Tempted
Translated Sentence: Chapter 4: Satan Tempts Jesus

Original: ومن بعد دا روح الله يسوع للصحرا باش يجربه إبليس. العبرانيين
Original Translation: The Holy Spirit led Jesus into the desert. There the devil tempted him.
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus was taken by the Spirit into the desert to be tempted by the devil.

Original: وصام ربعين يوم وربعين ليلة، ومن بعد جاه الجوع.
Original Translation: After 40 days and 40 nights of going without eating, Jesus was hungry.
Translated Sentence: I fasted for forty days and forty nights, and then I was hungry.

Original: وجا عنده إبليس اللي كيجرب وݣال ليه: «إلا كنت ولد الله، ݣول لهاد الحجر يولي خبز».
Original Translation: The tempter came to him. He said, "If you are the Son of God, tell these stones to become bread."
Translated Sentence: The tempter came to him and said, "If you are the Son of God, tell this stone to become bread".

Original: وهو يرد عليه يسوع: «مكتوب فكتاب الله: ماشي غير بالخبز بوحده كيعيش بنادم، ولكن كيعيش بكل كلمة كيݣولها الله».
Original Translation: Jesus answered, "It is written, 'Man doesn't live only on bread. He also lives on every word that comes from the mouth of God.' " (Deuteronomy 8:3)
Translated Sentence: Jesus answered, "It is written:' Man does not live on bread alone, but on every word that comes from the mouth of God. '"

Original: ومن بعد، داه إبليس لمدينة أورشليم المقدسة، ووقفه على بلاصة عالية فوق بيت الله،
Original Translation: Then the devil took Jesus to the holy city. He had him stand on the highest point of the temple.
Translated Sentence: Then the devil took him to the holy city and had him stand on the highest point of the temple.

Original: وݣال ليه: «إلا كنت ولد الله، رمي راسك للتحت، علاحقاش مكتوب فكتاب الله: الله غادي يوصي الملايكة دياله عليك، وعلى يديهم غيهزوك باش رجلك ما تضربش مع الحجر».
Original Translation: "If you are the Son of God," he said, "throw yourself down. It is written, " 'The Lord will command his angels to take good care of you.  They will lift you up in their hands.  Then you won't trip over a stone.' " (Psalm 91:11,12)
Translated Sentence: "If you are the Son of God, " he said", throw yourself down. For it is written: "' He will command his angels concerning you, and they will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone. '"

Original: وجاوبه يسوع: «مكتوب فكتاب الله تاني: ما تجربش الرب إلاهك».
Original Translation: Jesus answered him, "It is also written, 'Do not put the Lord your God to the test.' " (Deuteronomy 6:16)
Translated Sentence: Jesus answered, "It says:' Do not put the Lord your God to the test. '"

Original: ومن بعد طلعه إبليس لواحد الجبل عالي بزاف، ووراه ݣاع المملكات ديال الدنيا والعز ديالهم.
Original Translation: Finally, the devil took Jesus to a very high mountain. He showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their glory.
Translated Sentence: Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor.

Original: وݣال ليه: «ݣاع هادشي غادي نعطيه ليك إلا سجدتي لي وعبدتيني».
Original Translation: "If you bow down and worship me," he said, "I will give you all of this."
Translated Sentence: "All this I will give you, " he said", if you will just fall down and worship me".

Original: وهو يرد عليه يسوع: «سير بحالك آ الشيطان! علاحقاش مكتوب فكتاب الله: للرب إلاهك تسجد وهو بوحده اللي تعبد».
Original Translation: Jesus said to him, "Get away from me, Satan! It is written, 'Worship the Lord your God. He is the only one you should serve.' " (Deuteronomy 6:13)
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to him, "Away from me, Satan! For it is written:' Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only. '"

Original: ومن بعد هادشي، خلاه إبليس، وجاو شي ملايكة كيتسخرو عليه. يسوع كيبشر فالجليل
Original Translation: Then the devil left Jesus. Angels came and took care of him. Jesus Begins to Preach
Translated Sentence: Then the devil was left, and angels came and served him.

Original: وملي سمع يسوع بلي يوحنا المعمدان تشد فالحبس، رجع بحاله للجليل. متى
Original Translation: John had been put in prison. When Jesus heard about this, he returned to Galilee.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus heard that John had been put in prison, he returned to Galilee.

Original: وخلا الناصرة ومشى سكن فكفرناحوم اللي حدا بحر الجليل فبلاد زبولون ونفتالي. يوحنا
Original Translation: Jesus left Nazareth. He went to live in the city of Capernaum. It was by the lake in the area of Zebulun and Naphtali.
Translated Sentence: Leaving Nazareth, he went and lived in Capernaum, which is by the Sea of Galilee in the region of Zebulun and Naphtali.

Original: وهكا تحقق داكشي اللي ݣال النبي إشعيا:
Original Translation: In that way, what the prophet Isaiah had said came true. He had said,
Translated Sentence: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

Original: «آ بلاد زبولون وبلاد نفتالي،  اللي فطريق البحر من الجهة لخرى ديال واد الأردن،  بلاد الجليل ديال الشعوب اللي ماشي يهود!
Original Translation: "Land of Zebulun! Land of Naphtali!  Galilee, where non-Jewish people live!  Land along the Mediterranean Sea! Territory east of the Jordan River!
Translated Sentence: "The land of Zebulun and the land of Naphtali, on the road to the sea across the Jordan, Galilee of the Gentiles-

Original: الشعب اللي ݣالس فالضلام  شاف نور عظيم،  واللي كيعيشو فبلاد الموت وفوسط منها،  شرق عليهم واحد النور».
Original Translation: The people who are now living in darkness  will see a great light.  They are now living in a very dark land.  But a light will shine on them." (Isaiah 9:1,2)
Translated Sentence: The people who sat in darkness saw a great light; on those who lived in the region and country of death a light has dawned.

Original: ومن داك الوقت بدا يسوع كيخبر الناس وكيݣول: «توبو! راه الوقت ديال مملكة السماوات قرب». متى 3‏:2 يسوع كيختار تلامده اللولين
Original Translation: From that time on Jesus began to preach. "Turn away from your sins!" he said. "The kingdom of heaven is near." Jesus Chooses the First Disciples
Translated Sentence: From that time on Jesus began to preach, "Repent, for the kingdom of heaven is near".

Original: وملي كان يسوع غادي على جنب بحر الجليل، شاف جوج د الخوت، سمعان اللي مكني بطرس وخوه أندراوس كيرميو الشبكة فالبحر، علاحقاش كانو صيادا د الحوت.
Original Translation: One day Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee. There he saw two brothers. They were Simon Peter and his brother Andrew. They were throwing a net into the lake. They were fishermen.
Translated Sentence: As Jesus was walking beside the Sea of Galilee, he saw two fishermen, Simon Peter and his brother Andrew, casting a net into the lake, for they were fishermen.

Original: وݣال ليهم يسوع: «تبعوني، وأنا نردكم صيادا ديال الناس».
Original Translation: "Come. Follow me," Jesus said. "I will make you fishers of people."
Translated Sentence: "Come, follow me, " Jesus said", and I will make you fishers of men".

Original: وديك الساعة خلاو الشباك ديالهم وتبعوه.
Original Translation: At once they left their nets and followed him.
Translated Sentence: And that watch left their window open and followed him.

Original: ومن بعد، مشى من تم وشاف جوج د الخوت خرين، هم يعقوب بن زبدي وخوه يوحنا، مع باهم زبدي فواحد الفلوكة كيصلحو الشباك ديالهم. وغير عيط عليهم،
Original Translation: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers. They were James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John. They were in a boat with their father Zebedee. As they were preparing their nets, Jesus called out to them.
Translated Sentence: Going on from there, he saw two other brothers, James son of Zebedee and his brother John. They were in a boat, preparing their nets, and he called them.

Original: وهم يخليو الفلوكة وباهم وتبعو يسوع. يسوع كيعلم وكيشافي
Original Translation: Right away they left the boat and their father and followed Jesus. Jesus Heals Sick People
Translated Sentence: So they left the boats and followed him.

Original: ومشى يسوع لكل موضع فبلاد الجليل، كيعلم فديور الصلاة اللي تم وكيخبر بالبشارة ديال مملكة الله، وكيشافي الناس من كل مرض وكل ضعف. متى
Original Translation: Jesus went all over Galilee. There he taught in the synagogues. He preached the good news of God's kingdom. He healed every illness and sickness the people had.
Translated Sentence: Jesus went throughout Galilee, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness among the people.

Original: وداعت خباره فسوريا كلها، وجابو ليه ݣاع المرضى اللي كيتوجعو بسباب المرض: المسكونين، واللي فيهم لرياح، والزحافا، وهو يشافيهم.
Original Translation: News about him spread all over Syria. People brought to him all who were ill with different kinds of sicknesses. Some were suffering great pain. Others were controlled by demons. Some were shaking wildly. Others couldn't move at all. And Jesus healed all of them.
Translated Sentence: News about him spread all over Syria, and people brought to him all who were ill with diseases, those suffering severe pain, the demon - possessed and paralyzed, and he healed them.

Original: وتبعوه بزاف د الجماعات من الجليل، والمدون العشرة، وأورشليم، وبلاد اليهودية، ومن الجهة لخرى ديال واد الأردن.
Original Translation: Large crowds followed him. Some people came from Galilee, from the area known as the Ten Cities, and from Jerusalem and Judea. Others came from the area across the Jordan River.
Translated Sentence: Large crowds from Galilee, the Decapolis, Jerusalem, Judea and the region across the Jordan followed him.

Original: الفصل الخامس الخطبة ديال يسوع فوق الجبل
Original Translation: Jesus Gives Blessings
Translated Sentence: Chapter V: Sermon on the Mount

Original: وملي شاف يسوع الجماعات د الناس طلع للجبل، وملي ݣلس جاو لعنده التلامد دياله،
Original Translation: Jesus saw the crowds. So he went up on a mountainside and sat down. His disciples came to him.
Translated Sentence: When he saw the crowds, he went up on a mountainside and sat down. His disciples came to him,

Original: وبدا كيعلمهم وݣال:
Original Translation: Then he began to teach them.  He said,
Translated Sentence: He began to teach them and said:

Original: «سعدات الفقرا فالروح،  حيت ليهم مملكة السماوات.
Original Translation: "Blessed are those who are spiritually needy.  The kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
Translated Sentence: "Blessed are the poor in spirit, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

Original: سعدات اللي كيبكيو، حيت الله غادي يواسيهم.
Original Translation: Blessed are those who are sad.  They will be comforted.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are those who mourn, for they will be comforted.

Original: سعدات المتواضعين، حيت غادي يورتو الأرض.
Original Translation: Blessed are those who are free of pride.  They will be given the earth.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are the meek, for they shall inherit the earth.

Original: سعدات هادوك اللي جيعانين وعطشانين لطاعة الله، حيت غادي يشبعو.
Original Translation: Blessed are those who are hungry and thirsty for what is right.  They will be filled.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are those who hunger and thirst for righteousness, for they will be filled.

Original: سعدات هادوك اللي كيرحمو، حيت الله غادي يرحمهم.
Original Translation: Blessed are those who show mercy.  They will be shown mercy.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are the merciful, for they will receive mercy.

Original: سعدات هادوك اللي قلبهم نقي، حيت غادي يشوفو الله.
Original Translation: Blessed are those whose hearts are pure.  They will see God.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are the pure in heart, for they will see God.

Original: سعدات هادوك اللي كيعاونو الناس يعيشو فالهنا، حيت غادي يتسماو ولاد الله.
Original Translation: Blessed are those who make peace.  They will be called sons of God.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are the peaceable, for they will be called sons of God.

Original: سعدات هادوك اللي كيتعداو عليهم علاحقاش تابعين طريق الحق، حيت ليهم مملكة السماوات. 1بطرس 3‏:14
Original Translation: Blessed are those who suffer for doing what is right.  The kingdom of heaven belongs to them.
Translated Sentence: Blessed are those who are persecuted because of righteousness, for theirs is the kingdom of heaven.

Original: وسعداتكم إلا عايروكم الناس وتعداو عليكم وݣالو فيكم ݣاع الهضرة الخايبة بالكدوب، على ودي. 1بطرس 4‏:14
Original Translation: "Blessed are you when people make fun of you and hurt you because of me. You are also blessed when they tell all kinds of evil lies about you because of me.
Translated Sentence: "Blessed are you when people insult you, persecute you and falsely say all kinds of evil against you because of me.

Original: فرحو وطيرو بالفرحة علاحقاش أجركم عظيم فالسماوات، حيت راه بحال هكا تعداو على الأنبيا اللي قبل منكم». الاعمال 7‏:52 الملحة د الأرض ونور الدنيا
Original Translation: Be joyful and glad. Your reward in heaven is great. In the same way, people hurt the prophets who lived long ago. Salt and Light
Translated Sentence: Rejoice and be glad, because great is your reward in heaven, for in the same way they persecuted the prophets who were before you.

Original: «نتم الملحة ديال الأرض، وإلا مساست الملحة أشنو اللي غيرجع ليها الملوحية ديالها؟ راها ما بقات صالحة لوالو، من غير تلاح على برا ويعفسو عليها الناس. مرقس 9‏:50؛ لوقا 14‏:34‏،35
Original Translation: "You are the salt of the earth. But suppose the salt loses its saltiness. How can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything. It will be thrown out. People will walk all over it.
Translated Sentence: "You are the salt of the earth. But if the salt loses its saltiness, how can it be made salty again? It is no longer good for anything, except to be thrown out and trampled by men.

Original: نتم نور الدنيا، ما يمكنش لمدينة فوق جبل تضرݣ. يوحنا
Original Translation: "You are the light of the world. A city on a hill can't be hidden.
Translated Sentence: You are the light of the world. A city on a hill cannot be hidden.

Original: وما كاينش شي واحد كيشعل القنديل وكيحطه تحت السطل د العبار، ولكن كيتحط فبلاصته باش يضوي على كل من كاين فالدار. مرقس
Original Translation: Also, people do not light a lamp and put it under a bowl. Instead, they put it on its stand. Then it gives light to everyone in the house.
Translated Sentence: No one lights a candle and puts it under a basket, but it is kept in its place so that it shines on everyone in the house.

Original: وهكا، خليو النور ديالكم يضوي قدام الناس، باش يشوفو الأعمال ديالكم المزيانة ويعطيو العز لباكم اللي فالسماوات». 1بطرس 2‏:12 الشرع
Original Translation: "In the same way, let your light shine in front of others. Then they will see the good things you do. And they will praise your Father who is in heaven. Jesus Gives Full Meaning to the Law
Translated Sentence: In the same way, let your light shine before men, that they may see your good deeds and praise your Father in heaven".

Original: «ما يحسابش ليكم بلي جيت باش نحيد الشرع ديال موسى ولا كتب الأنبيا، ما جيتش باش نحيدهم ولكن جيت باش نكملهم.
Original Translation: "Do not think I have come to get rid of what is written in the Law or in the Prophets. I have not come to do that. Instead, I have come to give full meaning to what is written.
Translated Sentence: "Do not think that I have come to abolish the Law or the Prophets; I did not come to abolish them but to fulfill them.

Original: ونݣول ليكم الحق: راه تحيد السما والأرض وما يتحيدش حرف واحد ولا نقطة وحدة من الشرع حتى يتحقق كلشي اللي فيه. لوقا
Original Translation: What I'm about to tell you is true. Heaven and earth will disappear before the smallest letter disappears from the Law. Not even the smallest stroke of a pen will disappear from the Law until everything is completed.
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, more easily can heaven and earth disappear than one leaf, or one dot, from the Law disappear until everything is accomplished.

Original: راه اللي ما دارش بشي وحدة من هاد الوصيات الصغار وعلم الناس يديرو بحاله، غادي يكون هو الصغير فمملكة السماوات. واللي دار بيها وعلمها للناس، غادي يكون كبير فمملكة السماوات.
Original Translation: "Do not break even one of the least important commandments. And do not teach others to break them. If you do, you will be called the least important person in the kingdom of heaven. Instead, practice and teach these commands. Then you will be called important in the kingdom of heaven.
Translated Sentence: Therefore, whoever breaks one of the least of these commandments and teaches others to do the same will be called least in the kingdom of heaven, but whoever obeys them and teaches them will be called great in the kingdom of heaven.

Original: وكنݣول ليكم: إلا ما كانتش الطاعة ديالكم كتر من ديال العلما د الشرع والفريسيين، راه عمركم ما غادي تدخلو لمملكة السماوات». التقليقة
Original Translation: "Here is what I tell you. You must be more godly than the Pharisees and the teachers of the law. If you are not, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven. Murder
Translated Sentence: For I tell you that unless your righteousness surpasses that of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law, you will certainly not enter the kingdom of heaven.

Original: «راكم سمعتو بلي تݣال للناس اللولين: ما تقتلش، واللي قتل خاص يتحكم عليه.
Original Translation: "You have heard what was said to people who lived long ago. They were told, 'Do not commit murder. (Exodus 20:13) Anyone who murders will be judged for it.'
Translated Sentence: "You have heard that it was said to the people long ago,' Do not murder, and anyone who murders will be subject to judgment. '

Original: ولكن أنا كنݣول ليكم: ݣاع اللي تقلق على خوه خاص يتحكم عليه، واللي ݣال لخوه: آ اللي ما فيك فايدة، خاص يتحكم عليه فالمحكمة الكبيرة. واللي ݣال لخوه: آ الحمق، يستاهل نار جهنم.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Do not be angry with your brother. Anyone who is angry with his brother will be judged. Again, anyone who says to his brother, 'Raca,' must stand trial in the Sanhedrin. But anyone who says, 'You fool!' will be in danger of the fire in hell.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother will be subject to judgment. He who says to his brother, 'Raca,' will be subject to the Sanhedrin. But whoever says, 'You fool,' will be in danger of the fire of hell.

Original: وإلا جبتي هديتك وحطيتها على المدبح وتم تفكرتي بلي فيك الحق من جهة خوك.
Original Translation: "Suppose you are offering your gift at the altar. And you remember that your brother has something against you.
Translated Sentence: Otherwise you would have taken your gift and put it on the altar and thought you were right on your side.

Original: خلي هديتك قدام المدبح وسير حتى تتصالح مع خوك فاللول، عاد أجي عطي هديتك.
Original Translation: Leave your gift in front of the altar. First go and make peace with your brother. Then come back and offer your gift.
Translated Sentence: Leave your gift at the altar and go make up with your brother first. I'll be back with your gift.

Original: تصالح مع اللي مداعي معاك ماحدكم باقيين فالطريق للمحكمة، قبل ما يديك للقاضي، والقاضي يحطك فيد المخزني، والمخزني يدخلك للحبس.
Original Translation: "Suppose someone has a claim against you and is taking you to court. Settle the matter quickly. Do it while you are still with him on your way. If you don't, he may hand you over to the judge. The judge may hand you over to the officer. And you may be thrown into prison.
Translated Sentence: Make peace with your attorney while you are on the way to court, before you are handed over to the judge, the judge hands you over to the custodian, and the custodian throws you in jail.

Original: نݣول ليك الحق: راك ما غتخرج من تم حتى تخلص الريال اللخر اللي عليك». الفساد
Original Translation: What I'm about to tell you is true. You will not get out until you have paid the very last penny! Adultery
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, you will not get out until you have paid the last penny.

Original: «وسمعتو بلي تݣال: ما تفسدش.
Original Translation: "You have heard that it was said, 'Do not commit adultery.' (Exodus 20:14)
Translated Sentence: You have heard it said: Don't spoil it.

Original: ولكن أنا كنݣول ليكم: ݣاع اللي شاف شي مراة باش يتشهاها، راه هو فسد معاها فقلبه.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Do not even look at a woman in the wrong way. Anyone who does has already committed adultery with her in his heart.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you that anyone who looks at a woman lustfully has already committed adultery with her in his heart.

Original: وإلا كانت عينك ليمنى كتطيحك فالدنب، حيدها ورميها عليك، علاحقاش اللهم تخسر طرف من داتك ولا ترمى داتك كلها فجهنم. متى
Original Translation: "If your right eye causes you to sin, poke it out and throw it away. Your eye is only one part of your body. It is better to lose it than for your whole body to be thrown into hell.
Translated Sentence: If your right eye causes you to sin, gouge it out and throw it away. It is better that you lose one part of your body than that your whole body be thrown into hell.

Original: وإلا كانت يدك ليمنى كتطيحك فالدنب، قطعها ورميها عليك، حيت اللهم تخسر طرف من داتك ولا ترمى داتك كلها فجهنم». متى 18‏:8؛ مرقس 9‏:43 الطلاق
Original Translation: "If your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. Your hand is only one part of your body. It is better to lose it than for your whole body to go into hell. Divorce
Translated Sentence: If your right hand causes you to sin, cut it off and throw it away. It is better for you to lose one part of your body than for your whole body to go into hell.

Original: «وتݣال تاني: ݣاع اللي طلق مراته، خاصه يعطيها براتها. متى
Original Translation: "It has been said, 'Suppose a man divorces his wife. If he does, he must give her a letter of divorce.' (Deuteronomy 24:1)
Translated Sentence: It is also said: "Whoever divorces his wife must give her back her sister".

Original: ولكن أنا كنݣول ليكم: اللي طلق مراته على سباب آخر من غير سباب الفساد، راه كيردها كتفسد. واللي تزوج بالمطلقة راه هو كيفسد». متى 19‏:9؛ مرقس 10‏:11‏،12؛ لوقا 16‏:18؛ 1كورنتوس 7‏:10‏،11 الحلوف
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Anyone who divorces his wife causes her to commit adultery. And anyone who gets married to the divorced woman commits adultery. A man may divorce his wife only if she has not been faithful to him. Oaths
Translated Sentence: But I tell you that anyone who divorces his wife, except for marital unfaithfulness, causes her to become an adulteress, and anyone who marries the divorced woman commits adultery.

Original: «وسمعتو تاني بلي تݣال لجدودكم: إلا حلفتي ما تحنتش، ولكن توفي للرب بالحلوف ديالك.
Original Translation: "Again, you have heard what was said to your people long ago. They were told, 'Do not break the promises you make to the Lord. Keep the oaths you have made to him.'
Translated Sentence: "Again, you have heard that it was said to the people long ago,' Do not break your oath, but keep the oaths you have made to the Lord. '

Original: أما أنا كنݣول ليكم: عمركم ما تحلفو، لا بالسما حيت هي عرش الله، يعقوب
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Do not make any promises like that at all. Do not make them in the name of heaven. That is God's throne.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, do not swear at all: either by heaven, for it is God's throne;

Original: ولا بالأرض حيت هي موضع رجليه، ولا بأورشليم حيت هي مدينة الملك العظيم.
Original Translation: Do not make them in the name of the earth. That is the stool for God's feet. Do not make them in the name of Jerusalem. That is the city of the Great King.
Translated Sentence: nor by the earth, for it is his footstool; nor by Jerusalem, for it is the city of the great King.

Original: وما تحلفش براسك حتى هو، حيت ما تقدرش ترد شعرة وحدة منه كحلا ولا بيضا.
Original Translation: And do not take an oath in the name of your head. You can't make even one hair white or black.
Translated Sentence: Don't swear at him, because you can't get a single hair from him that is black or white.

Original: ولكن إلا كان كلامكم إيه، ݣولو: إيه. وإلا كان لا، ݣولو: لا. والكلام اللي زايد على هادشي راه هو من الشيطان». الإنتقام
Original Translation: "Just let your 'Yes' mean 'Yes.' Let your 'No' mean 'No.' Anything more than this comes from the evil one. Be Kind to Others
Translated Sentence: Simply let your 'Yes' be 'Yes,' and your 'No,' 'No'; anything beyond this comes from the evil one.

Original: «وسمعتو بلي تݣال: العين بالعين والسن بالسن.
Original Translation: "You have heard that it was said, 'An eye must be put out for an eye. A tooth must be knocked out for a tooth.' (Exodus 21:24; Leviticus 24:20; Deuteronomy 19:21)
Translated Sentence: "You have heard that it was said,' Eye for eye, and tooth for tooth. '

Original: ولكن أنا كنݣول ليكم: ما تردوش الشر بخوه، ولكن اللي صرفقك على حنكك ليمن، ضور ليه لاخر حتى هو.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Do not fight against an evil person.  "Suppose someone hits you on your right cheek. Turn your other cheek to him also.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, Do not resist an evil person. If someone strikes you on the right cheek, turn to him the other also.

Original: واللي بغا يدعيك للمحكمة باش ياخد ليك جلابتك، خلي ليه حتى التشامير ديالك.
Original Translation: Suppose someone takes you to court to get your shirt. Let him have your coat also.
Translated Sentence: If he wants to call you to the courthouse to pick up your bag, leave him your coat too.

Original: وإلا شي واحد بزز عليك باش تمشي معاه ألف خطوة، سير معاه ألفين.
Original Translation: Suppose someone forces you to go one mile. Go two miles with him.
Translated Sentence: If someone pushes you to go a thousand steps, go two thousand.

Original: واللي طلب منك شي حاجة عطيها ليه، واللي بغا يتسلف منك ما تردوش خاوي». بغيو عديانكم
Original Translation: "Give to the one who asks you for something. Don't turn away from the one who wants to borrow something from you. Love Your Enemies
Translated Sentence: If anyone asks you for anything, give it to him; and if anyone wants to borrow from you, do not give him nothing. They want your money.

Original: «وسمعتو بلي تݣال: تبغي اللي قريب ليك وتكره عدوك.
Original Translation: "You have heard that it was said, 'Love your neighbor. (Leviticus 19:18) Hate your enemy.'
Translated Sentence: "You have heard that it was said, 'Love your neighbor and hate your enemy.'

Original: ولكن أنا كنݣول ليكم: بغيو عديانكم، ودعيو مع هادوك اللي كيتعداو عليكم.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Love your enemies. Pray for those who hurt you.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you: Love those who love you; bless those who persecute you.

Original: باش تكونو ولاد باكم اللي فالسماوات. حيت هو اللي كيشرق بشمسه على القباح والملاح، وكينزل الشتا على اللي كيديرو الخير واللي كيديرو الشر.
Original Translation: Then you will be sons of your Father who is in heaven.  "He causes his sun to shine on evil people and good people. He sends rain on those who do right and those who don't.
Translated Sentence: that you may be sons of your Father in heaven. He causes his sun to rise on the right and on the wrong, and sends rain on the righteous and on the unrighteous.

Original: حيت إلا كنتو كتبغيو غير اللي كيبغيوكم، آش من أجر عندكم؟ واش ماشي حتى مالين الضريبة كيديرو بهادشي؟
Original Translation: "If you love those who love you, what reward will you get? Even the tax collectors do that.
Translated Sentence: For if you love those who love you, what reward do you have? Do not even the tax collectors do that?

Original: وإلا كتسلمو غير على خوتكم بوحدهم. بآش نتم حسن من لخرين؟ واش ماشي حتى اللي كيعبدو الأصنام كيديرو بحال هكا؟
Original Translation: If you greet only your own people, what more are you doing than others? Even people who are ungodly do that.
Translated Sentence: If you greet only your own brother, what are you more than others? Do not even pagans do that?

Original: إيوا كونو كاملين، كما باكم اللي فالسما كامل».
Original Translation: So be perfect, just as your Father in heaven is perfect.
Translated Sentence: They should be perfect, as perfect as the ones above.

Original: الفصل السادس الصدقة
Original Translation: Giving to Needy People
Translated Sentence: Chapter 6 Charity

Original: «ردو بالكم لا تديرو الخير قدام الناس باش يشوفوكم، ولا ما غيكونش عندكم أجر عند باكم اللي فالسماوات. متى
Original Translation: "Be careful not to do 'good works' in front of others. Don't do them to be seen by others. If you do, your Father in heaven will not reward you.
Translated Sentence: "Be careful not to do your' acts of righteousness 'before men, to be seen by them. If you do, you will have no reward from your Father in heaven.

Original: وإلا بغيتي تعطي شي صدقة، ما تبرحش بيها فالبوق قدام الناس بحال اللي كيديرو المنافقين فديور الصلاة والزناقي باش يشكروهم الناس. راني نݣول ليكم الحق: هادوك راهم خداو الأجر ديالهم من عند الناس.
Original Translation: "When you give to needy people, do not announce it by having trumpets blown. Do not be like those who only pretend to be holy. They announce what they do in the synagogues and on the streets. They want to be honored by others. What I'm about to tell you is true. They have received their complete reward.
Translated Sentence: "So when you give to the needy, do not announce it with trumpets, as the hypocrites do in the synagogue and at the corners of the streets, to be honored by men. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.

Original: ولكن نت إلا عطيتي شي صدقة، خاص يدك ليسرى ما تعرفش آش كتدير يدك ليمنى،
Original Translation: "When you give to the needy, don't let your left hand know what your right hand is doing.
Translated Sentence: But if you give me a favor, your left hand should be turned to the left, and your right hand should be turned to the right.

Original: باش تبقى الصدقة ديالك فالسر، وباك اللي فالسما اللي ما كتخفى عليه خافية هو اللي غادي يجازيك». الصلاة
Original Translation: Then your giving will be done secretly. Your Father will reward you. He sees what you do secretly. Prayer
Translated Sentence: Let your charity be kept secret, and your Father in heaven will reward you.

Original: «وملي تصليو، ما تديروش بحال المنافقين، اللي عزيز عليهم يصليو واقفين فديور الصلاة وفين كيتلاقاو الطرقان باش يشوفوهم الناس. راني نݣول ليكم الحق: هادوك راهم خداو الأجر ديالهم من عند الناس. لوقا
Original Translation: "When you pray, do not be like those who only pretend to be holy. They love to stand and pray in the synagogues and on the street corners. They want to be seen by others. What I'm about to tell you is true. They have received their complete reward.
Translated Sentence: "And when you pray, do not show off your countenance like the hypocrites. They love to stand in the synagogues and on the street corners to be seen by men. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.

Original: أما نت ملي تصلي، دخل لبيتك وسد عليك الباب وصلي لباك اللي فالسر، وباك اللي ما كتخفى عليه خافية هو اللي غيجازيك.
Original Translation: "When you pray, go into your room. Close the door and pray to your Father, who can't be seen. He will reward you. Your Father sees what is done secretly.
Translated Sentence: But when you pray, go to your room and lock the door and get your secret, and what you hide is what will be revealed to you.

Original: وملي تصليو ما تبداوش تعاودو كلام كتير وخاوي بحال هادوك اللي كيعبدو الأصنام، اللي كيحساب ليهم بلي إلا كترو من الكلام راه غادي يستاجب ليهم الله.
Original Translation: "When you pray, do not keep talking on and on the way ungodly people do. They think they will be heard because they talk a lot.
Translated Sentence: "When you pray, do not keep on babbling like pagans, for they think they will be heard because of their many words.

Original: إيوا ما تكونوش بحالهم، علاحقاش باكم اللي فالسما كيعرف داكشي اللي كتحتاجو قبل ما تطلبوه».
Original Translation: Do not be like them. Your Father knows what you need even before you ask him.
Translated Sentence: Do not be like them, for your Father knows what you need before you ask him.

Original: «وهاكدا صليو نتم هاد الصلاة:  بانا اللي فالسما،  بغينا إسمك يتقدس،
Original Translation: "This is how you should pray. " 'Our Father in heaven,  may your name be honored.
Translated Sentence: "This is how you should pray:" 'Father, hallowed be your name,

Original: ومملكتك تجي،  ومرادك يكون  كما فالسما هكا على الأرض.
Original Translation: May your kingdom come.  May what you want to happen be done  on earth as it is done in heaven.
Translated Sentence: let your kingdom come. Let your will take place, as in heaven, also upon earth.

Original: الخبز اللي يكفينا رزقنا اليوم،
Original Translation: Give us today our daily bread.
Translated Sentence: We have enough bread for today.

Original: وغفر لينا دنوبنا  كما كنغفرو لهادوك اللي كيدنبو فحقنا،
Original Translation: Forgive us our sins,  just as we also have forgiven those who sin against us.
Translated Sentence: Forgive us our debts, as we also have forgiven our debtors.

Original: وحفضنا باش ما نطيحوش فالتجربة،  ونجينا من الشيطان.
Original Translation: Keep us from falling into sin when we are tempted.  Save us from the evil one.'
Translated Sentence: And save us from the evil one.

Original: حيت إلا غفرتو للناس الغلطات ديالهم، غيغفر ليكم باكم اللي فالسما الغلطات ديالكم.
Original Translation: "Forgive people when they sin against you. If you do, your Father who is in heaven will also forgive you.
Translated Sentence: For if you forgive men their trespasses, your heavenly Father will also forgive you your trespasses.

Original: ولكن إلا ما غفرتوش للناس الغلطات ديالهم، حتى نتم ما غيغفرش ليكم باكم اللي فالسما الغلطات ديالكم». الصيام
Original Translation: But if you do not forgive people their sins, your Father will not forgive your sins. Fasting
Translated Sentence: But if you do not forgive others their sins, neither will the Father in heaven forgive you your sins.

Original: «إلا صمتو، ما تكونوش معبسين بحال المنافقين اللي كيعبسو وجوههم باش يبينو للناس بلي هم صايمين. نݣول ليكم الحق: هادوك راهم خداو الأجر ديالهم من عند الناس.
Original Translation: "When you go without eating, do not look gloomy like those who only pretend to be holy. They make their faces very sad. They want to show people they are fasting. What I'm about to tell you is true. They have received their complete reward.
Translated Sentence: "When you fast, do not look somber as the hypocrites do, for they disfigure their faces to show men they are fasting. I tell you the truth, they have received their reward in full.

Original: ولكن نت ملي تصوم، دهن شعرك وغسل وجهك،
Original Translation: "But when you go without eating, put olive oil on your head. Wash your face.
Translated Sentence: But when you fast, grease your hair and wash your face.

Original: حيت ماشي للناس لمن خاصك تبان صايم، ولكن لباك اللي فالسر، وباك اللي ما كتخفى عليه خافية هو يجازيك». كنوز فالسما
Original Translation: Then others will not know that you are fasting. Only your Father, who can't be seen, will know it. He will reward you. Your Father sees what is done secretly. Put Away Riches in Heaven
Translated Sentence: For you will not go fasting in public, but in secret. Then you will be rewarded for your good deeds in secret.

Original: «ما تجمعوش ليكم كنوز فالأرض، فين كتكال بالسوسة والصدا، وفين كيحفرو عليها الشفارا وكيسرقوها. يعقوب
Original Translation: "Do not put away riches for yourselves on earth. Moths and rust can destroy them. Thieves can break in and steal them.
Translated Sentence: "Do not store up for yourselves treasures on earth, where moth and rust destroy, and where thieves break in and steal.

Original: ولكن جمعو ليكم كنوز فالسما، فين ما كتكالش بالسوسة والصدا، وفين ما كيحفروش عليها الشفارا وما كيسرقوهاش.
Original Translation: Instead, put away riches for yourselves in heaven. There, moths and rust do not destroy them. There, thieves do not break in and steal them.
Translated Sentence: But store up for yourselves treasures in heaven, where moth and rust do not destroy, and where thieves do not break in and steal.

Original: حيت فين ما كان كنزك، تم غادي يكون قلبك». نور الدات
Original Translation: Your heart will be where your riches are.
Translated Sentence: For where your treasure is, there will your heart be also.

Original: «العين هي قنديل الدات. إلا كانت عينك مزيانة، داتك كلها غادي تكون مضوية.
Original Translation: "The eye is like a lamp for the body. Suppose your eyes are good. Then your whole body will be full of light.
Translated Sentence: The eye is the eye of the beholder. If your eye is good, your whole beholder will be bright.

Original: ولكن إلا كانت عينك قبيحة، داتك كلها غادي تكون مضلمة. وإلا كان النور اللي فيك ضلام، شحال صعيب هاد الضلام!» الله والمال
Original Translation: But suppose your eyes are bad. Then your whole body will be full of darkness. If the light inside you is darkness, then it is very dark!
Translated Sentence: But if your eye is bad, your whole body will be full of darkness. If then the light within you is darkness, how great is that darkness!

Original: «حتى واحد ما يقدر يكون عبد لجوج سياد، علاحقاش إما غيكره واحد فيهم وغيبغي لاخر، ولا غيكون مخلص لواحد فيهم وغيطيح من شان لاخر. وهكا حتى نتم ما تقدروش تكونو عبيد ديال الله والفلوس. ما ترفدوش الهم
Original Translation: "No one can serve two masters at the same time. He will hate one of them and love the other. Or he will be faithful to one and dislike the other. You can't serve God and Money at the same time. Do Not Worry
Translated Sentence: "No one can serve two masters. Either he will hate the one and love the other, or he will be devoted to the one and despise the other. You cannot serve both God and Money. Do not be misled".

Original: وعلى هادشي كنݣول ليكم: ما ترفدوش الهم من جهة معيشتكم أشنو تاكلو ولا أشنو تشربو، ولا من جهة داتكم أشنو تلبسو. واش ماشي الحياة مهمة كتر من الماكلة، والدات مهمة كتر من اللباس؟
Original Translation: "I tell you, do not worry. Don't worry about your life and what you will eat or drink. And don't worry about your body and what you will wear. Isn't there more to life than eating? Aren't there more important things for the body than clothes?
Translated Sentence: "Therefore I tell you, do not worry about your life, what you will eat or drink; or about your body, what you will wear. Is not life more important than food, and the body more important than clothes?

Original: شوفو طيور السما، راها ما كتزرع ما كتحصد ما كتجمع فبيوت الخزين، وباكم اللي فالسما كيرزقها ماكلتها. إيوا، واش ماشي نتم حسن منها بزاف؟
Original Translation: "Look at the birds of the air. They don't plant or gather crops. They don't put away crops in storerooms. But your Father who is in heaven feeds them. Aren't you worth much more than they are?
Translated Sentence: Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store in barns, and the birds of the air feed them. Are you not much better than they?

Original: شكون هادا فيكم اللي إلا رفد الهم يقدر يزيد واخا غير ساعة فعمره؟
Original Translation: "Can you add even one hour to your life by worrying?
Translated Sentence: Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?

Original: وعلاش كترفدو الهم للباس؟ شوفو مزيان الورد اللي فالفدان كيفاش كيكبر، راه ما كيتعدب ما كيغزل.
Original Translation: "And why do you worry about clothes? See how the wild flowers grow. They don't work or make clothing.
Translated Sentence: And why do you wear them? Look at the beautiful flowers in the trees growing, they don't shrink when they fall.

Original: ولكن نݣول ليكم الحق: حتى سليمان براسه فالعز دياله كله، عمره ما لبس بحال شي وردة فيهم.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. Not even Solomon in all of his glory was dressed like one of those flowers.
Translated Sentence: Yet I tell you that not even Solomon in all his splendor was dressed like one of these.

Original: إيوا آ قلالين الإيمان! إلا كان الربيع اللي فالفدان، اللي اليوم كنشوفوه والغد ليه كيترمى فالفران كيلبسه الله هكا، كيفاش ما يلبسكمش نتم ما حسن؟
Original Translation: "If that is how God dresses the wild grass, won't he dress you even better? After all, the grass is here only today. Tomorrow it is thrown into the fire. Your faith is so small!
Translated Sentence: If that is how God clothes the grass of the field, which is here today, and tomorrow is thrown into the fire, will he not much more clothe you, O you of little faith?

Original: وعلى هادشي، ݣاع ما ترفدو الهم وتݣولو: آش غادي ناكلو؟ ولا آش غادي نشربو؟ ولا آش غادي نلبسو؟
Original Translation: "So don't worry. Don't say, 'What will we eat?' Or, 'What will we drink?' Or, 'What will we wear?'
Translated Sentence: So do not worry, saying, 'What shall we eat?' or 'What shall we drink?' or 'What shall we wear?'

Original: راه حتى اللي ما كيعرفوش الله كيطلبو ݣاع هادشي، وباكم اللي فالسما كيعرف بلي نتم محتاجين لهادشي كله.
Original Translation: People who are ungodly run after all of those things. Your Father who is in heaven knows that you need them.
Translated Sentence: For the pagans run after all these things, and your Father knows that you need them.

Original: ولكن قلبو فاللول على مملكة الله والمراد دياله، وهادشي كله غيتزاد ليكم.
Original Translation: "But put God's kingdom first. Do what he wants you to do. Then all of those things will also be given to you.
Translated Sentence: But seek first his kingdom and his righteousness, and all these things will be given to you as well.

Original: وما ترفدوش الهم للنهار اللي جاي، خلي هم غدا لغدا. وكل نهار بركا عليه غير همه».
Original Translation: "So don't worry about tomorrow. Tomorrow will worry about itself. Each day has enough trouble of its own.
Translated Sentence: If you don't pay them back for the next day, keep them until tomorrow. Every day is a different day.

Original: الفصل السابع ما تحكمو على حد
Original Translation: Be Fair When You Judge Others
Translated Sentence: Chapter Seven: Judging by the Person

Original: «ما تحكمو على حد، باش ما يتحكمش عليكم.
Original Translation: "Do not judge others. Then you will not be judged.
Translated Sentence: Do not judge others, and you will not be judged.

Original: حيت الحكام باش كتحكمو، بيه غيتحكم عليكم، والعبار باش كتعبرو، بيه غيتعبر ليكم. مرقس
Original Translation: You will be judged in the same way you judge others. You will be measured in the same way you measure others.
Translated Sentence: For in the same way you judge others, you will be judged, and with the measure you use, it will be measured to you.

Original: علاش كتشوف الخشة ديال التبن اللي فعين خوك، وما كتردش البال للعود اللي فعينك؟
Original Translation: "You look at the bit of sawdust in your friend's eye. But you pay no attention to the piece of wood in your own eye.
Translated Sentence: Why do you see the scratch on your eye so much that you don't notice it?

Original: ولا كيفاش غادي تݣول لخوك خليني نحيد الخشة ديال التبن من عينك، وعينك نت فيها عود؟
Original Translation: How can you say to your friend, 'Let me take the bit of sawdust out of your eye'? How can you say this while there is a piece of wood in your own eye?
Translated Sentence: Or how will you tell your brother to let me take the speck out of your eye, and your eye will be in it again?

Original: آ هاد المنافق، حيد بعد فاللول العود من عينك، ديك الساعة غتشوف مزيان باش تحيد الخشة ديال التبن من عين خوك.
Original Translation: "You pretender! First take the piece of wood out of your own eye. Then you will be able to see clearly to take the bit of sawdust out of your friend's eye.
Translated Sentence: You hypocrite, after the first stick out of your eye, you will see better to remove the scratch from your brother's eye.

Original: ما تعطيوش الحاجة المقدسة للكلاب لا يضورو فيكم ويقطعوكم، وما ترميوش الجوهر ديالكم للحلالف لا يعفسو عليه برجليهم». طلبو، قلبو ودقو
Original Translation: "Do not give holy things to dogs. Do not throw your pearls to pigs. If you do, they might walk all over them. Then they might turn around and tear you to pieces. Ask, Search, Knock
Translated Sentence: "Do not give dogs what is holy, or they will trample on you and rip you to pieces. Do not throw your pearls before swine or they will trample them under their feet.

Original: «طلبو وغتاخدو. قلبو وغتلقاو. دقو الباب وغيتحل ليكم.
Original Translation: "Ask, and it will be given to you. Search, and you will find. Knock, and the door will be opened to you.
Translated Sentence: Ask and you will receive; seek and you will find; knock and the door will be opened to you.

Original: راه ݣاع اللي طلب غيتعطى ليه، واللي قلب غيلقا، واللي دق الباب غيتحل ليه.
Original Translation: Everyone who asks will receive. He who searches will find. The door will be opened to the one who knocks.
Translated Sentence: He who asks is given, and he whose heart is shut is opened, and he who knocks is opened.

Original: شكون فيكم اللي إلا طلب منه ولده الخبز غيعطيه حجرة،
Original Translation: "Suppose your son asks for bread. Which of you will give him a stone?
Translated Sentence: "Which of you, if his son asks for bread, will give him a fish?

Original: ولا إلا طلب منه حوتة غيعطيه لفعى؟
Original Translation: Or suppose he asks for a fish. Which of you will give him a snake?
Translated Sentence: Or just ask him for a whale to give to me?

Original: إيوا، إلا كنتو نتم اللي ما مزيانينش كتعرفو تعطيو لولادكم الحوايج المزيانين، كيفاش باكم اللي فالسما ما يعطيش الحوايج المزيانين لهادوك اللي كيطلبوه؟
Original Translation: Even though you are evil, you know how to give good gifts to your children. How much more will your Father who is in heaven give good gifts to those who ask him!
Translated Sentence: If you, then, though you are evil, know how to give good gifts to your children, how much more will the Father in heaven give good things to those who ask him!

Original: كما كتبغيو الناس يديرو معاكم، هكا خاصكم حتى نتم تديرو معاهم، حيت على هادشي كيضور تعليم الشرع والأنبيا». لوقا 6‏:31 الباب الضيق
Original Translation: "In everything, do to others what you would want them to do to you. This is what is written in the Law and in the Prophets. The Large and Small Gates
Translated Sentence: So in everything, do to others what you would have them do to you, for this sums up the Law and the Prophets".

Original: «دخلو من الباب الضيق، حيت الباب اللي كيدي للهلاك واسع وطريقه ساهلة، وكتار اللي كيدخلو منه.
Original Translation: "Enter God's kingdom through the narrow gate. The gate is large and the road is wide that lead to death and hell. Many people go that way.
Translated Sentence: "Enter through the narrow gate. For wide is the gate and broad is the road that leads to destruction, and many enter through it.

Original: شحال مضيق الباب وشحال واعرة الطريق اللي كتدي للحياة، وقلال اللي كيلقاوها». الشجرة كتعرف من غلتها
Original Translation: But the gate is small and the road is narrow that lead to life. Only a few people find it. A Tree and Its Fruit
Translated Sentence: How narrow is the door and how narrow the road that leads to life, and how few find it. A tree is known by its fruit.

Original: «ردو بالكم من الأنبيا الكدابين، اللي كيجيو عندكم لابسين لباس الخرفان ولكن هم من لداخل دياب خطافا.
Original Translation: "Watch out for false prophets. They come to you pretending to be sheep. But on the inside they are hungry wolves.
Translated Sentence: Beware of false prophets, who come to you dressed as sheep but with hooks on their backs.

Original: راه من غلتهم تعرفوهم. واش تقدرو تجنيو العنب من الشوك، ولا الكرموس من السدرة؟
Original Translation: You can tell what they really are by what they do.  "Do people pick grapes from bushes? Do they pick figs from thorns?
Translated Sentence: You can tell by their fruits. Can you pick grapes from thorns or cider from cedar?

Original: وهكا كل شجرة مزيانة كتعطي غلة مزيانة، وكل شجرة خايبة كتعطي غلة خايبة.
Original Translation: In the same way, every good tree bears good fruit. But a bad tree bears bad fruit.
Translated Sentence: Likewise every good tree bears good fruit, but every rotten tree bears rotten fruit.

Original: والشجرة المزيانة ما يمكنش تعطي غلة خايبة، والشجرة الخايبة ما يمكنش تعطي غلة مزيانة.
Original Translation: A good tree can't bear bad fruit. And a bad tree can't bear good fruit.
Translated Sentence: A good tree cannot bear bad fruit, and a bad tree cannot bear good fruit.

Original: كل شجرة ما كتعطيش غلة مزيانة كتقطع وكترمى فالعافية. متى
Original Translation: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down. It is thrown into the fire.
Translated Sentence: Every tree that does not bear good fruit is cut down and replanted.

Original: وهكا من غلتهم تعرفوهم». متى 12‏:33 خاصنا نديرو مراد الله
Original Translation: You can tell each tree by its fruit.
Translated Sentence: So then, by their fruits you will recognize them".

Original: «ماشي ݣاع اللي كيݣول لي: آ سيدي، آ سيدي! غادي يدخل لمملكة السماوات، ولكن اللي كيدخل ليها هو اللي كيدير مراد با اللي فالسماوات.
Original Translation: "Not everyone who says to me, 'Lord, Lord,' will enter the kingdom of heaven. Only those who do what my Father in heaven wants will enter.
Translated Sentence: "Not everyone who says to me,' Lord, Lord, 'will enter the kingdom of heaven, but only he who does the will of my Father who is in heaven.

Original: فداك النهار، بزاف اللي غادي يݣولو لي: آ سيدي، آ سيدي! واش ماشي بإسمك تنبأنا؟ وبإسمك خرجنا الجنون؟ وبإسمك درنا معجزات كتار؟
Original Translation: "Many will say to me on that day, 'Lord! Lord! Didn't we prophesy in your name? Didn't we drive out demons in your name? Didn't we do many miracles in your name?'
Translated Sentence: Many will say to me on that day, 'Lord, Lord, did we not prophesy in your name, and in your name drive out demons and perform many miracles?'

Original: فديك الساعة غادي نݣول ليهم: عمرني ما عرفتكم! بعدو مني آ المدنبين!. المتال ديال جوج ديور
Original Translation: Then I will tell them clearly, 'I never knew you. Get away from me, you who do evil!' The Wise and Foolish Builders
Translated Sentence: Then I will tell them plainly, "I never knew you. Away from me, you evildoers! "

Original: راه ݣاع اللي كيسمع كلامي وكيدير بيه، كيشبه لواحد الراجل بعقله بنى داره على الصخر.
Original Translation: "So then, everyone who hears my words and puts them into practice is like a wise man. He builds his house on the rock.
Translated Sentence: "Everyone who hears my words and puts them into practice is like a wise man who built his house on the rock.

Original: ومنين طاحت الشتا وفاضو الويدان، وجات ريح قوية وضربات ديك الدار، ما رابتش، حيت الساس ديالها كان مبني على الصخر.
Original Translation: The rain comes down. The water rises. The winds blow and beat against that house. But it does not fall. It is built on the rock.
Translated Sentence: When the rain came and the fields were clear, a strong wind blew and hit that house, but it did not fall, because its foundation was built on rock.

Original: وݣاع اللي كيسمع هاد الكلام ديالي وما كيديرش بيه، راه كيشبه لواحد الراجل حمق بنى داره على الرملة.
Original Translation: "But everyone who hears my words and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man. He builds his house on sand.
Translated Sentence: But everyone who hears these words of mine and does not put them into practice is like a foolish man who built his house on sand.

Original: ومنين طاحت الشتا وفاضو الويدان، وجات ريح قوية وضربات ديك الدار، رابت وكان الترياب ديالها قوي».
Original Translation: The rain comes down. The water rises. The winds blow and beat against that house. And it falls with a loud crash."
Translated Sentence: When the winter rains and the snow falls, a strong wind blows and hits the house, it collapses and the roof collapses.

Original: وملي كمل يسوع هاد الكلام، تعجبو جماعات الناس من التعليم دياله، مرقس
Original Translation: Jesus finished saying all these things. The crowds were amazed at his teaching.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus had finished speaking, the crowds were amazed at his teaching,

Original: حيت كان كيعلمهم بحال شي واحد عنده السلطة، ماشي بحال العلما د الشرع ديالهم.
Original Translation: He taught like one who had authority. He did not speak like their teachers of the law.
Translated Sentence: Because he taught them as someone with authority, not as their law professor.

Original: الفصل التامن يسوع كيشافي راجل مجدام
Original Translation: Jesus Heals a Man Who Had a Skin Disease
Translated Sentence: Chapter Eight Jesus Heals a Man of Magdala

Original: وملي نزل يسوع من الجبل، تبعوه بزاف د الجماعات ديال الناس.
Original Translation: Jesus came down from the mountainside. Large crowds followed him.
Translated Sentence: When he came down from the mountain, large crowds followed him.

Original: وقرب لعنده واحد المجدام، وسجد ليه وݣال: «آ سيدي، إلا بغيتي، راك تقدر تردني طاهر».
Original Translation: A man who had a skin disease came and got down on his knees in front of Jesus. He said, "Lord, if you are willing to make me 'clean,' you can do it."
Translated Sentence: A man with leprosy came and knelt before him and said, "Lord, if you are willing, you can make me clean".

Original: وهو يمد يسوع يده ومسه وݣال: «أنا بغيت إيوا كون طاهر!». وفديك الساعة تحيد منه الجدام وولى طاهر.
Original Translation: Jesus reached out his hand and touched the man. "I am willing to do it," he said. "Be 'clean'!"  Right away the man was healed of his skin disease.
Translated Sentence: Jesus reached out his hand and touched him. "I am willing, " he said". Be clean! " Immediately his leprosy left him, and he was cured.

Original: وݣال ليه يسوع: «رد بالك باش ما تݣولها لحتى شي حد، ولكن سير ووري داتك لراجل الدين، وعطي الهدية اللي وصى بيها موسى، باش يكون هادشي شهادة ليهم». الخدام ديال القايد د العسكر كيتشافى
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to him, "Don't tell anyone. Go and show yourself to the priest. Offer the gift Moses commanded. It will be a witness to them." A Roman Commander Has Faith
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to him, "See that you don't tell anyone. But go, show yourself to the priest and offer the gift Moses commanded, as a testimony to them".

Original: وملي دخل يسوع لكفرناحوم، جا لعنده واحد القايد د العسكر كيرغبه،
Original Translation: When Jesus entered Capernaum, a Roman commander came to him. He asked Jesus for help.
Translated Sentence: As Jesus was entering Capernaum, a centurion came to him, begging him,

Original: وݣال ليه: «آ سيدي، الخدام ديالي فالدار طايح فالفراش مشلول وكيتعدب بزاف».
