Original Translation: "Lord," he said, "my servant lies at home and can't move. He is suffering terribly."
Translated Sentence: "Lord, " he said", my servant lies at home paralyzed and in terrible suffering".

Original: وهو يݣول ليه يسوع: «هاني غادي نمشي باش نشافيه».
Original Translation: Jesus said, "I will go and heal him."
Translated Sentence: Jesus said to him, "I will come and heal him".

Original: وجاوبه القايد د العسكر: «أنا ما نستاهلش آ سيدي تدخل تحت سقف داري، ولكن ݣول غير كلمة وحدة والخدام ديالي غيتشافى.
Original Translation: The commander replied, "Lord, I am not good enough to have you come into my house. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
Translated Sentence: "Lord, " the centurion replied", I am not worthy for you to come under my roof. But just say the word, and my servant will be healed".

Original: حيت حتى أنا كاين اللي كيحكم في وعندي عسكر كنحكم فيه، كنݣول لهادا: سير! وكيمشي، وكنݣول للاخر: أجي! وكيجي، وكنݣول للعبد ديالي: دير هادي! وكيديرها».
Original Translation: I myself am a man under authority. And I have soldiers who obey my orders. I tell this one, 'Go,' and he goes. I tell that one, 'Come,' and he comes. I say to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it."
Translated Sentence: For I myself am a man under authority, with soldiers under me. I say to this one, 'Go,' and he goes; and to another, 'Come,' and he comes. I say to my servant, 'Do this,' and he does it".

Original: وملي سمعه يسوع تعجب وݣال لهادوك اللي تابعينه: «نݣول ليكم الحق: ما لقيت حتى شي واحد فإسرائيل عنده إيمان قوي بحال هادا.
Original Translation: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed. He said to those following him, "What I'm about to tell you is true. In Israel I have not found anyone whose faith is so strong.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus heard this, he was amazed and said to those following him, "I tell you the truth, I have not found anyone in Israel with such great faith.

Original: وراني نݣول ليكم بلي بزاف د الناس غادي يجيو من الشرق والغرب ويݣلسو ياكلو مع إبراهيم وإسحاق ويعقوب فمملكة السماوات. لوقا
Original Translation: "I say to you that many will come from the east and the west. They will take their places at the feast in the kingdom of heaven. They will sit with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob.
Translated Sentence: I tell you that many will come from the east and the west, and will take their places at the feast with Abraham, Isaac and Jacob in the kingdom of heaven.

Original: أما هادوك اللي كان خاصهم يكونو فالمملكة، غيترماو على برا فالضلمة، تم فين غيكون البكا وتغزاز السنان». متى
Original Translation: But those who think they belong to the kingdom will be thrown outside, into the darkness. There they will sob and grind their teeth."
Translated Sentence: But those who belong to the kingdom will be cast out into the darkness, where there will be weeping and gnashing of teeth.

Original: ومن بعد، ݣال يسوع للقايد د العسكر: «سير! على قد الإيمان ديالك، غادي يكون ليك داكشي اللي بغيتي». وفديك الساعة نيت تشافى الخدام دياله. يسوع كيشافي نسيبة بطرس وبزاف د الناس
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to the Roman commander, "Go! It will be done just as you believed it would."  And his servant was healed at that very hour. Jesus Heals Many People
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to the centurion, "Go! It will be done just as you believed it would. " And at that very moment his servant was healed.

Original: وملي دخل يسوع لدار بطرس، لقا نسيبة بطرس طايحة فالفراش حيت فيها السخانة.
Original Translation: When Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw Peter's mother-in-law. She was lying in bed. She had a fever.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came into Peter's house, he saw Peter's mother - in - law lying in bed with a fever.

Original: ومس يسوع يدها، وهي تمشي منها السخانة، وناضت وضايفته.
Original Translation: Jesus touched her hand, and the fever left her. She got up and began to wait on him.
Translated Sentence: He touched her hand and the fever left her, and she was immediately healed.

Original: وملي وصلات العشية، جابو ليه بزاف د الناس مسكونين بالجنون، وخرج الجنون بكلمة منه، وشفى ݣاع المرضى.
Original Translation: When evening came, many people controlled by demons were brought to Jesus. He drove out the spirits with a word. He healed all who were sick.
Translated Sentence: When evening came, many who were demon - possessed were brought to him, and the demon went out at his word and healed all who were sick.

Original: وهكا تحقق الكلام اللي ݣال النبي إشعيا: «هو اللي خدا وجعنا وهز مرضنا». كيفاش خاص يكونو هادوك اللي كيتبعو يسوع
Original Translation: He did it to make what the prophet Isaiah had said come true. He had said, "He suffered the things we should have suffered.  He took on himself the sicknesses that should have been ours." (Isaiah 53:4) It Costs to Follow Jesus
Translated Sentence: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah: "He took up our infirmities and carried our diseases".

Original: وملي شاف يسوع الجماعة د الناس ضايرين بيه، آمر التلامد دياله باش يقطعو للجهة لخرى ديال البحر.
Original Translation: Jesus saw the crowd around him. So he gave his disciples orders to go to the other side of the Sea of Galilee.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus saw the crowd around him, he gave orders to cross to the other side of the lake.

Original: وهو يقرب لعنده واحد من العلما د الشرع وݣال ليه: «آ سيدي، غادي نتبعك فين ما مشيتي».
Original Translation: Then a teacher of the law came to him. He said, "Teacher, I will follow you no matter where you go."
Translated Sentence: Then a teacher of the law came to him and said, "Teacher, I will follow you wherever you go".

Original: وجاوبه يسوع وݣال: «التعالب عندها غيرانها، وطيور السما عندها عشاشها، ولكن ولد الإنسان راه ما عنده حتى فين يسند راسه».
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes. Birds of the air have nests. But the Son of Man has no place to lay his head."
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Foxes have holes and birds of the air have nests, but the Son of Man has nowhere to lay his head".

Original: وݣال ليه واحد آخر من تلامده: «آ سيدي، خليني بعد نمشي ندفن با».
Original Translation: Another follower said to him, "Lord, first let me go and bury my father."
Translated Sentence: Another of his disciples said to him, "Lord, let me go first and bury my brother".

Original: ولكن يسوع جاوبه: «غير تبعني نت وخلي الموتى يدفنو الموتى ديالهم!». يسوع كيهدن واحد الرعدة
Original Translation: But Jesus told him, "Follow me. Let the dead bury their own dead." Jesus Calms the Storm
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Follow me, Lord, and let the dead bury their own dead".

Original: وملي ركب يسوع فالفلوكة، تبعوه تلامده.
Original Translation: Jesus got into a boat. His disciples followed him.
Translated Sentence: When he got into the boat, his disciples followed him.

Original: وجات واحد الريح قوية بزاف فالبحر حتى عمرو الماج الفلوكة، وكان يسوع ناعس.
Original Translation: Suddenly a terrible storm came up on the lake. The waves crashed over the boat. But Jesus was sleeping.
Translated Sentence: Without warning, a furious storm came up on the lake, so that the boat was being swamped by the waves. But Jesus was sleeping.

Original: وقربو لعنده تلامده وفيقوه وݣالو ليه: «عتقنا آ سيدي، راه حنا كنموتو!»،
Original Translation: The disciples went and woke him up. They said, "Lord! Save us! We're going to drown!"
Translated Sentence: The disciples went and woke him, saying, "Lord, save us! We're going to drown!"

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «مالكم خايفين آ هاد قلال الإيمان؟». ومن بعد، ناض ونهض فالريح والبحر، وهي تهدن الدنيا.
Original Translation: He replied, "Your faith is so small! Why are you so afraid?"  Then Jesus got up and ordered the winds and the waves to stop. It became completely calm.
Translated Sentence: He replied, "You of little faith, why are you so afraid? " Immediately he got up, and the winds and the waves subsided, and it was completely calm.

Original: وتعجبو الرجال وݣالو: «شكون هو هادا اللي حتى الريح والبحر كيطيعوه؟». يسوع كيخرج الجنون من جوج د الرجال من الجدريين
Original Translation: The disciples were amazed. They asked, "What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!" Jesus Heals Two Men Controlled by Demons
Translated Sentence: The men were amazed and asked, "What kind of man is this? Even the winds and the waves obey him!"

Original: وملي وصل يسوع للجهة لخرى من البحر حدا بلاد الجدريين، تلاقاو بيه جوج د الرجال مسكونين بالجنون خارجين من الروضة، وكانو خطر بزاف، حتى ما بقى حد قادر يدوز فديك الطريق.
Original Translation: Jesus arrived at the other side of the lake in the area of the Gadarenes. Two men controlled by demons met him. They came from the tombs. The men were so wild that no one could pass that way.
Translated Sentence: When he reached the other side in the region of the Gadarenes, two demon - possessed men came out of the villages to meet him. They were so violent that no one could pass that way.

Original: وغير شافوه بداو كيغوتو وكيݣولو: «آش بينا وبينك آ ولد الله؟ واش جيتي لهنا باش تعدبنا قبل من الوقت؟».
Original Translation: "Son of God, what do you want with us?" they shouted. "Have you come here to punish us before the time for us to be judged?"
Translated Sentence: When they saw him, they shouted, "What do you want with us, Son of God? Have you come to torture us before the appointed time?"

Original: وكانت واحد القطعة ديال الحلالف كبيرة سارحة فواحد الموضع قريب لتم،
Original Translation: Not very far away, a large herd of pigs was feeding.
Translated Sentence: There was a large piece of wood that was lying in a field nearby.

Original: ورغبو الجنون يسوع وݣالو ليه: «إلا خرجتينا، صيفطنا ندخلو فالقطعة ديال الحلالف».
Original Translation: The demons begged Jesus, "If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs."
Translated Sentence: The demons begged him, "If you drive us out, send us into the herd of pigs".

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «سيرو!» ومشاو دخلو فيها، وجرات القطعة كلها وطاحت من الحافة ديال الجبل للبحر وغرقات فالما.
Original Translation: Jesus said to them, "Go!"  So the demons came out of the men and went into the pigs. The whole herd rushed down the steep bank. They ran into the lake and drowned in the water.
Translated Sentence: "Go, " he told them". So they went, and the whole boat fell from the shore into the sea and sank.

Original: وهربو السراحا ومشاو للمدينة وخبرو بݣاع داكشي اللي جرا، وبداكشي اللي وقع للرجال اللي مسكونين بالجنون.
Original Translation: Those who were tending the pigs ran off. They went into the town and reported all this. They told the people what had happened to the men who had been controlled by demons.
Translated Sentence: The herdsmen fled and went into the town, telling all about this and what had happened to the demon - possessed men.

Original: وخرجو سكان المدينة كلهم باش يتلقاو ليسوع. وملي شافوه رغبوه يخرج من بلادهم.
Original Translation: Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they begged him to leave their area.
Translated Sentence: Then the whole town went out to meet Jesus. When they saw him, they pleaded with him to leave their region.

Original: الفصل التاسع يسوع كيشافي مشلول
Original Translation: Jesus Heals a Man Who Could Not Walk
Translated Sentence: Chapter 9 Jesus Cures a Paralytic

Original: وركب يسوع فالفلوكة وقطع البحر ورجع لمدينته.
Original Translation: Jesus stepped into a boat. He went over to the other side of the lake and came to his own town.
Translated Sentence: Jesus got into the boat, crossed over and came to his own town.

Original: وجابو ليه شي ناس واحد الراجل مشلول ناعس فوق الفراش. وملي شاف يسوع إيمانهم ݣال للمشلول: «تيق آ ولدي، راه تغفرو ليك دنوبك».
Original Translation: Some men brought to him a man who could not walk. He was lying on a mat. Jesus saw that they had faith. So he said to the man, "Don't lose hope, son. Your sins are forgiven."
Translated Sentence: Some men brought to him a paralytic, lying on a mat. When Jesus saw their faith, he said to the paralytic, "Take courage, son; your sins are forgiven".

Original: وݣالو شي وحدين من العلما د الشرع فخاطرهم: «هاد الراجل كينطق بكلام الكفر!».
Original Translation: Then some teachers of the law said to themselves, "This fellow is saying a very evil thing!"
Translated Sentence: At this, some of the teachers of the law said to themselves, "This fellow is blaspheming!"

Original: وعرف يسوع فاش كيفكرو وݣال: «مالكم كتفكرو فحوايج خايبين فخاطركم؟
Original Translation: Jesus knew what they were thinking. So he said, "Why do you have evil thoughts in your hearts?
Translated Sentence: Jesus knew what they were thinking and said, "Why are you thinking evil thoughts in your hearts?

Original: أما سهل، يتݣال: مغفورين ليك دنوبك، ولا يتݣال: نوض وسير؟
Original Translation: Is it easier to say, 'Your sins are forgiven'? Or to say, 'Get up and walk'?
Translated Sentence: Which is easier: to say, 'Your sins are forgiven,' or to say, 'Get up and walk'?

Original: ولكن غادي نوريكم بلي ولد الإنسان عنده السلطة على الأرض باش يغفر الدنوب». وݣال للمشلول: «نوض هز فراشك وسير لدارك».
Original Translation: I want you to know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins."  Then he spoke to the man who could not walk. "Get up," he said. "Take your mat and go home."
Translated Sentence: But that you may know that the Son of Man has authority on earth to forgive sins.... " He said to the paralytic, "Get up, take your mat and go home".

Original: وناض الراجل ومشى لداره.
Original Translation: The man got up and went home.
Translated Sentence: The man got up and walked home.

Original: وملي شافو جماعات الناس داكشي اللي جرا، خافو وعطاو العز لله اللي عطى للناس سلطة بحال هادي. يسوع كيختار متى
Original Translation: When the crowd saw this, they were filled with wonder. They praised God for giving that kind of authority to men. Jesus Chooses Matthew
Translated Sentence: When the crowds saw this, they were filled with awe; and they praised God, who had given such authority to men.

Original: وملي كان يسوع غادي من تم، شاف واحد الراجل سميته متى ݣالس فدار الضريبة. وهو يݣول ليه: «تبعني». وناض تبعه.
Original Translation: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man named Matthew. He was sitting at the tax collector's booth.  "Follow me," Jesus told him. Matthew got up and followed him.
Translated Sentence: As Jesus went on from there, he saw a man sitting at the tax collector's booth. "Follow me, " he told him, and he got up and followed him.

Original: ومن بعد ݣلس يسوع للماكلة فدار متى، وجاو عنده بزاف ديال مالين الضريبة والمدنبين وݣلسو معاه ومع تلامده. لوقا
Original Translation: Later Jesus was having dinner at Matthew's house. Many tax collectors and "sinners" came. They ate with Jesus and his disciples.
Translated Sentence: While Jesus was having dinner at Matthew's house, many tax collectors and "sinners " came and ate with him and his disciples.

Original: وملي شافوه الفريسيين، ݣالو لتلامده: «علاش المعلم ديالكم كياكل مع مالين الضريبة والمدنبين؟».
Original Translation: The Pharisees saw this. So they asked the disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and 'sinners'?"
Translated Sentence: When the Pharisees saw this, they asked his disciples, "Why does your teacher eat with tax collectors and' sinners '?"

Original: وملي سمعهم يسوع جاوبهم وݣال: «راه المرضى اللي محتاجين للطبيب، ماشي اللي بصحتهم.
Original Translation: Jesus heard that. So he said, "Those who are healthy don't need a doctor. Sick people do.
Translated Sentence: On hearing this, Jesus said, "It is not the healthy who need a doctor, but the sick.

Original: إيوا سيرو تعلمو المعنى ديال هاد الكلام: أنا راه بغيت الرحمة ماشي الدبيحة، حيت راني ما جيتش نعيط على اللي متاقيين الله، ولكن على المدنبين». السؤال على الصيام
Original Translation: Go and learn what this means, 'I want mercy and not sacrifice.' (Hosea 6:6) I have not come to get those who think they are right with God to follow me. I have come to get sinners to follow me." Jesus Is Asked About Fasting
Translated Sentence: "Go and learn what this means: 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice.' For I have not come to call the righteous, but sinners".

Original: ومن بعد جاو تلامد يوحنا المعمدان لعند يسوع وسولوه: «علاش حنا والفريسيين كنصومو بزاف، وتلامدك نت ما كيصوموش؟».
Original Translation: One day John's disciples came. They said to Jesus, "We and the Pharisees go without eating. Why don't your disciples go without eating?"
Translated Sentence: Then John's disciples came and asked Jesus, "How is it that we and the Pharisees fast, but your disciples do not fast?"

Original: وجاوبهم يسوع وݣال ليهم: «واش يقدرو المعروضين للعرس يحزنو والعريس معاهم؟ راه غادي يجي الوقت اللي غيتخاد العريس من بيناتهم وفديك الساعة غيصومو.
Original Translation: Jesus answered, "How can the guests of the groom be sad while he is with them? The time will come when the groom will be taken away from them. Then they will fast.
Translated Sentence: Jesus answered, "Can the guests of the bridegroom mourn while he is with them? The time will come when the bridegroom will be taken from them; then they will fast.

Original: حتى واحد ما كيرقع لباس قديم بطرف ديال التوب جديد، علاحقاش الرقعة غادي تكمش وتزيد التشريݣة تكبر.
Original Translation: "People don't sew a patch of new cloth on old clothes. The new piece will pull away from the old. That will make the tear worse.
Translated Sentence: Even if you don't put a new top on an old dress, the patch will shrink and the tear will grow.

Original: وحتى واحد ما كيدير الخمر الجديد فݣربات ديال الجلد قدام، حيت إلا تدار فيهم غيتفرݣعو وهكا غيضيع الخمر ويتشرݣو الݣربات. ولكن كنديرو الخمر الجديد فݣربات ديال الجلد جداد، باش ما يضيع لا خمر ولا ݣربات». بنت الرئيس والمراة اللي مسات حوايج يسوع
Original Translation: "People don't pour new wine into old wineskins. If they do, the skins will burst. The wine will run out, and the wineskins will be destroyed. No, everyone pours new wine into new wineskins. Then both are saved." A Dead Girl and a Suffering Woman
Translated Sentence: And no one pours new wine into old wineskins. If he does, the wine will burst the skins, the wine will run out and the wineskins will be ruined. No, he pours new wine into new wineskins, so that neither the wine nor the skins will be ruined".

Original: وملي كان كيݣول ليهم هادشي، جا عنده واحد الرئيس وسجد ليه وݣال: «بنتي يالاه ماتت، ولكن أجي حط يدك عليها وغتحيا».
Original Translation: While Jesus was saying this, a ruler came. He got down on his knees in front of Jesus. He said, "My daughter has just died. But come and place your hand on her. Then she will live again."
Translated Sentence: While Jesus was saying this, a ruler came and knelt before him and said, "My daughter is dead, but come and put your hand on her, and she will live".

Original: وناض يسوع تبعه هو وتلامده.
Original Translation: Jesus got up and went with him. So did his disciples.
Translated Sentence: Jesus got up and followed him, and so did his disciples.

Original: وكانت تم واحد المراة مريضة، طناشر عام وهي كتدوز بالدم، قربات ورا يسوع ومسات جلايله،
Original Translation: Just then a woman came up behind Jesus. She had a sickness that made her bleed. It had lasted for 12 years. She touched the edge of his clothes.
Translated Sentence: Now a woman who had been subject to bleeding for twelve years came up behind him.

Original: حيت ݣالت فخاطرها: «إلا مسيت غير حوايجه نتشافى».
Original Translation: She thought, "I only need to touch his clothes. Then I will be healed."
Translated Sentence: because she thought, "If I only touch his clothes, I will be healed".

Original: وهو يتلفت يسوع وشافها وݣال: «تيقي آ بنتي، راه إيمانك شفاك». وفديك الساعة تشافات المراة.
Original Translation: Jesus turned and saw her. "Dear woman, don't give up hope," he said. "Your faith has healed you." The woman was healed at that very moment.
Translated Sentence: Jesus turned and saw her. "Take heart, daughter, " he said". Your faith has healed you. " And she was healed at that very moment.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع لدار الرئيس وشاف اللي كينوحو بالليرة والجماعة د الناس دايرين الصداع،
Original Translation: When Jesus entered the ruler's house, he saw the flute players there. And he saw the noisy crowd.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came to the ruler's house and saw the people roaring and wailing,

Original: ݣال ليهم: «خرجو من هنا! البنت ما ماتتش، راها غير ناعسة!»، وهم يضحكو عليه.
Original Translation: He said, "Go away. The girl is not dead. She is sleeping." But they laughed at him.
Translated Sentence: he said, "Go away. The girl is not dead but asleep. " But they laughed at him.

Original: وملي خرجهم يسوع برا، دخل وشد البنت من يدها وهي تنوض.
Original Translation: After the crowd had been sent outside, Jesus went in. He took the girl by the hand, and she got up.
Translated Sentence: After he had put the crowd outside, he went in and took the girl by the hand, and she got up.

Original: وداعت الخبار فديك الجوايه كلها. يسوع كيشافي جوج د العميين
Original Translation: News about what Jesus had done spread all over that area. Jesus Heals Two Blind Men
Translated Sentence: The news spread throughout the whole area. Jesus healed two blind men.

Original: وملي كان يسوع دايز من تم، تبعوه جوج د العميين كيغوتو وكيݣولو: «رحمنا آ بن داود!».
Original Translation: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him. They called out, "Have mercy on us, Son of David!"
Translated Sentence: As Jesus went on from there, two blind men followed him, calling out, "Have mercy on us, Son of David!"

Original: وملي دخل للدار، قربو لعنده العميين. وهو يسولهم يسوع: «واش كتآمنو بلي أنا قادر نشفيكم؟»، وجاوبوه: «إيه آ سيدي!».
Original Translation: When Jesus went indoors, the blind men came to him. He asked them, "Do you believe that I can do this?"  "Yes, Lord," they replied.
Translated Sentence: When he had gone indoors, the blind men came to him, and he asked them, "Do you believe that I can do this? "" Yes, Lord, " they replied.

Original: وديك الساعة مس يسوع عينيهم وݣال: «على قد إيمانكم غادي يكون ليكم داكشي اللي بغيتو».
Original Translation: Then he touched their eyes. He said, "It will happen to you just as you believed."
Translated Sentence: Then he touched their eyes and said, "According to your faith let it be done to you ";

Original: وهم يتحلو ليهم عينيهم، ونهاهم يسوع وݣال: «عنداكم تݣولوها لشي حد!».
Original Translation: They could now see again. Jesus strongly warned them, "Be sure that no one knows about this."
Translated Sentence: Then he closed their eyes and cautioned them, "Don't tell anyone".

Original: ولكن هم خرجو وبداو كيديعو الخبار فديك الجوايه كلها. زيزون كيتشافى
Original Translation: But they went out and spread the news. They talked about him all over that area.
Translated Sentence: But they went out and started spreading the news all over the place.

Original: وما جاو فين يخرجو العميين، حتى جابو ليه واحد الراجل زيزون ومسكون بالجنون.
Original Translation: While they were going out, another man was brought to Jesus. A demon controlled him, and he could not speak.
Translated Sentence: When they could not bring the blind man out, they brought a man who had been demon - possessed to Jesus.

Original: وملي خرج يسوع الجن، هضر الزيزون. وهم يتعجبو الجماعات د الناس وݣالو: «عمرنا ما شفنا بحال هادشي فإسرائيل!».
Original Translation: When the demon was driven out, the man spoke.  The crowd was amazed. They said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel."
Translated Sentence: After Jesus had been cast out, he went to the region of Sidon. The crowd was amazed and said, "Nothing like this has ever been seen in Israel".

Original: أما الفريسيين ݣالو: «راه كيخرج الجنون برئيس الجنون!». متى 10‏:25؛ 12‏:24؛ مرقس 3‏:22؛ لوقا 11‏:15 المحنة ديال يسوع
Original Translation: But the Pharisees said, "He drives out demons by the power of the prince of demons." There Are Only a Few Workers
Translated Sentence: But the Pharisees said, "He drives out demons by the ruler of the demons".

Original: وكان يسوع كيمشي لݣاع المدون والدواور كيعلم فديور الصلاة ديالهم وكيخبر بالبشارة ديال مملكة الله، وكيشافي كل علة وكل مرض. متى
Original Translation: Jesus went through all the towns and villages. He taught in their synagogues. He preached the good news of the kingdom. And he healed every illness and sickness.
Translated Sentence: Jesus went about all the villages and towns, teaching in the synagogues, preaching the good news of the kingdom, and healing every disease and sickness.

Original: وملي شاف الجماعات د الناس، حن عليهم حيت كانو معدبين ومشتتين بحال الغنم اللي ما عندها سراح. مرقس
Original Translation: When he saw the crowds, he felt deep concern for them. They were beaten down and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.
Translated Sentence: When he saw the crowds, he had compassion on them, because they were harassed and helpless, like sheep without a shepherd.

Original: وهو يݣول لتلامده: «الحصاد كتير، ولكن الحصادا قلال. لوقا
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "The harvest is huge. But there are only a few workers.
Translated Sentence: Then he said to his disciples, "The harvest is plentiful, but the workers are few.

Original: إيوا طلبو من مول الحصاد باش يصيفط الحصادا للحصاد دياله».
Original Translation: So ask the Lord of the harvest to send workers out into his harvest field."
Translated Sentence: They asked the harvest manager to send the crops to their harvest.

Original: الفصل العاشر يسوع كيصيفط تلامده الطناش
Original Translation: Jesus Sends Out the Twelve Disciples
Translated Sentence: Chapter 10 Jesus Sends Out His Twelve Disciples

Original: ومن بعد عيط يسوع على تلامده الطناش وعطاهم السلطة باش يخرجو الجنون ويشافيو الناس من كل علة ومن كل مرض.
Original Translation: Jesus called for his 12 disciples to come to him. He gave them authority to drive out evil spirits and to heal every illness and sickness.
Translated Sentence: Calling his twelve disciples to him, Jesus gave them authority to drive out demons and to heal every disease and sickness.

Original: وهادو هم السميات ديال الرسل الطناش: اللول فيهم سمعان المكني بطرس وخوه أندراوس، ويعقوب بن زبدي ويوحنا خوه،
Original Translation: Here are the names of the 12 apostles. First are Simon Peter and his brother Andrew. Then come James, son of Zebedee, and his brother John.
Translated Sentence: The names of the twelve apostles are as follows: first, Simon (called Zealot) and his brother Andrew; James son of Zebedee, and his brother John;

Original: وفيلبس وبرتولماوس، وتوما، ومتى مول الضريبة، ويعقوب بن حلفى وتداوس،
Original Translation: Next are Philip and Bartholomew, and also Thomas and Matthew the tax collector. Two more are James, son of Alphaeus, and Thaddaeus.
Translated Sentence: Philip, Bartholomew, Thomas the tax collector, James son of Alphaeus and Judas;

Original: وسمعان الوطني، ويهودا الإسخريوطي اللي غيخون يسوع.
Original Translation: The last are Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot. Judas is the one who was later going to hand Jesus over to his enemies.
Translated Sentence: Simon the Zealot and Judas Iscariot, who betrayed him.

Original: وصيفط يسوع هاد الطناش ووصاهم وݣال: «ما تمشيوش لعند الشعوب اللي ماشي يهود وما تدخلوش لمدون السامريين،
Original Translation: Jesus sent these 12 out with the following orders. "Do not go among those who aren't Jews," he said. "Do not enter any town of the Samaritans.
Translated Sentence: These twelve Jesus sent out with the following instructions: "Do not go among the Gentiles or enter any town of the Samaritans.

Original: ولكن سيرو لعند الخرفان الموضرين اللي من شعب إسرائيل،
Original Translation: Instead, go to the people of Israel. They are like sheep that have become lost.
Translated Sentence: Go instead to the lost sheep of Israel.

Original: وفطريقكم خبرو الناس بلي الوقت ديال مملكة السماوات راه قرب.
Original Translation: As you go, preach this message, 'The kingdom of heaven is near.'
Translated Sentence: As you go, preach that the kingdom of heaven is near.

Original: شفيو المرضى، وحييو الموتى، وردو المجدامين طاهرين، وخرجو الجنون. خديتو بلاش إيوا عطيو بلاش.
Original Translation: Heal those who are sick. Bring those who are dead back to life. Make those who have skin diseases 'clean' again. Drive out demons. You have received freely, so give freely.
Translated Sentence: Heal the sick, raise the dead, cleanse the lame, drive out demons. You have received free, give free.

Original: ما تديو فجيوبكم لا دهب، لا فضة، لا نحاس،
Original Translation: "Do not take along any gold, silver or copper in your belts.
Translated Sentence: Do not take gold, silver or copper into your purses.

Original: لا رزمة، لا جوج لبسات، لا صباط، لا عكاز، علاحقاش الخدام كيستاهل ماكلته. 1كورنتوس 9‏:14؛ 1تيموتاوس 5‏:18
Original Translation: Do not take a bag for the journey. Do not take extra clothes or sandals or walking sticks. A worker should be given what he needs.
Translated Sentence: take no bag, no extra tunic, no sandals or a staff; for the worker is not worth his keep.

Original: والمدينة ولا الدوار اللي دخلتو ليهم، سولو على شي حد يستاهل يضايفكم، وبقاو عنده حتى تمشيو بحالكم.
Original Translation: "When you enter a town or village, look for someone who is willing to welcome you. Stay at that person's house until you leave.
Translated Sentence: "Whatever town or village you enter, search for someone worthy of you and stay at his house until you leave.

Original: وإلا دخلتو لشي دار، سلمو على ماليها.
Original Translation: As you enter the home, greet those who live there.
Translated Sentence: If you enter a house, say hello to her.

Original: وإلا كانو مالين الدار يستاهلو سلامكم، سلامكم يوصل ليهم. وإلا ما كانوش يستاهلوه، سلامكم يرجع ليكم.
Original Translation: If that home welcomes you, give it your blessing of peace. If it does not, don't bless it.
Translated Sentence: If the house is deserving, your peace will rest on it; if it is not, it will return to you.

Original: وإلا ما قبلوكمش مالين شي دار ولا شي مدينة ولا ما سمعوش لكلامكم، خرجو من تم وسوسو الغبرة اللي فرجليكم. الاعمال
Original Translation: "Some people may not welcome you or listen to your words. If they don't, shake the dust off your feet when you leave that home or town.
Translated Sentence: If anyone will not welcome you or listen to you, shake the dust off your feet when you leave that house or town.

Original: نݣول ليكم الحق: راه حالة أرض سدوم وعمورة فيوم الحساب غادي تكون خف من حالة ديك المدينة». لوقا 10‏:4‏-12 التعدو اللي جاي
Original Translation: What I'm about to tell you is true. On judgment day it will be easier for Sodom and Gomorrah than for that town.
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, it will be more bearable for Sodom and Gomorrah on the day of judgment than for that town.

Original: «هاني كنصيفطكم بحال الخرفان بين الدياب، إيوا كونو على بال بحال اللفاعي، وضريفين بحال الحمام. لوقا
Original Translation: "I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. So be as wise as snakes and as harmless as doves.
Translated Sentence: "I am sending you out like sheep among wolves. Therefore be as shrewd as wolves and as innocent as doves.

Original: وردو بالكم من الناس، حيت غادي يديوكم للمحاكم، وفديور الصلاة ديالهم غيضربوكم، مرقس
Original Translation: "Watch out! Men will hand you over to the local courts. They will whip you in their synagogues.
Translated Sentence: "Be on your guard against men; for they will hand you over to the magistrates and flog you with whips on your heads".

Original: وغيجروكم قدام الحكام والملوك على قبلي، باش تشهدو لي قدامهم وقدام الشعوب اللي ماشي يهود.
Original Translation: You will be brought to governors and kings because of me. You will be witnesses to them and to those who aren't Jews.
Translated Sentence: On my account you will be brought before governors and kings as witnesses to them and to the Gentiles.

Original: وملي يديوكم ما ترفدوش الهم لا كيفاش ولا آش غادي تݣولو، حيت ديك الساعة غادي يتعطاكم آش غتݣولو.
Original Translation: "But when they arrest you, don't worry about what you will say or how you will say it. At that time you will be given the right words to say.
Translated Sentence: Do not worry about what to say or how to say it; at that time you will be given what to say.

Original: علاحقاش ماشي نتم اللي غادي تهضرو، ولكن الروح ديال باكم اللي فالسما هو اللي غادي يعطيكم الكلام اللي تݣولوه.
Original Translation: It will not be you speaking. The Spirit of your Father will be speaking through you.
Translated Sentence: For it is not you speaking, but the Spirit of your Father speaking in you.

Original: الخو غيسلم خوه باش يتقتل، والبو غيسلم ولده باش يتقتل، والولاد غينوضو ضد والديهم وغيقتلوهم، مرقس
Original Translation: "Brothers will hand over brothers to be killed. Fathers will hand over their children. Children will rise up against their parents and have them put to death.
Translated Sentence: "Brother will betray brother to death, and a father his child. Children will rebel against their parents and have them put to death.

Original: وغيكرهوكم ݣاع الناس على ود الإسم ديالي. ولكن اللي بقى تابت حتى للخر غينجا. متى
Original Translation: Everyone will hate you because of me. But anyone who stands firm to the end will be saved.
Translated Sentence: And you will be hated by all because of my name. But the one who remains will be saved.

Original: ولكن ملي يتعداو عليكم فشي مدينة، هربو لوحدة خرى. راني نݣول ليكم الحق: ما تجيو فين تضورو على مدون إسرائيل كلهم حتى يجي ولد الإنسان».
Original Translation: "When people attack you in one place, escape to another. What I'm about to tell you is true. You will not finish going through the cities of Israel before the Son of Man comes.
Translated Sentence: When you are persecuted in one town, flee to another. I tell you the truth, you will not finish going through the towns of Israel before the Son of Man comes.

Original: «راه التلميد ماشي حسن من المعلم دياله، ولا الخدام حسن من سيده. لوقا
Original Translation: "A student is not better than his teacher. A servant is not better than his master.
Translated Sentence: "A student is not above his teacher, nor a servant above his master.

Original: بركا على التلميد إلا كان بحال المعلم دياله، والخدام بحال سيده. وإلا سماو مول الدار بعلزبول، إيوا شنو غيسميو مالين داره؟ متى 9‏:34؛ 12‏:24؛ مرقس 3‏:22؛ لوقا 11‏:15
Original Translation: It is enough for the student to be like his teacher. And it is enough for the servant to be like his master. If the head of the house has been called Beelzebub, what can the others who live there expect?
Translated Sentence: It is enough for a disciple to be like his teacher, and a servant like his master. If they call the owner of the house 'wicked,' how much more the master of his household!

Original: ما تخافوش منهم، علاحقاش ݣاع اللي مستور غادي يتعرى، وݣاع اللي مخبي غادي يبان. مرقس
Original Translation: "So don't be afraid of your enemies. Everything that is secret will be brought out into the open. Everything that is hidden will be uncovered.
Translated Sentence: "So do not be afraid of them. For everything that is uncovered will be disclosed, and everything that is concealed will be made known.

Original: وعلى داكشي، اللي ݣلت ليكم فالليل، ݣولوه فالنهار. وݣاع داكشي اللي سمعتوه فالسر، برحو بيه من فوق السطوح.
Original Translation: What I tell you in the dark, speak in the daylight. What is whispered in your ear, shout from the rooftops.
Translated Sentence: What I tell you in the dark, speak in the daylight; what is whispered in your ear, proclaim from the roofs.

Original: ما تخافوش من هادوك اللي كيقتلو الدات وما يقدروش يقتلو الروح، ولكن خافو من هاداك اللي قادر يهلك الروح والدات بجوجهم فجهنم.
Original Translation: Do not be afraid of those who kill the body but can't kill the soul. Instead, be afraid of the One who can destroy both soul and body in hell.
Translated Sentence: Do not be afraid of those who kill the body but cannot kill the soul. Rather, be afraid of the one who can destroy both soul and soul in hell.

Original: ياك جوج طيور كيتباعو بدرهم واحد! وليني ما غيطيح حتى واحد فيهم فالأرض من غير إلا بغا باكم اللي فالسما.
Original Translation: "Aren't two sparrows sold for only a penny? But not one of them falls to the ground without your Father knowing it.
Translated Sentence: Are not two sparrows sold for a penny? Yet not one of them will fall to the ground unless the will of him who is in heaven be done.

Original: أما نتم حتى شعر راسكم راه كله محسوب.
Original Translation: He even counts every hair on your head!
Translated Sentence: But even your hair is all counted.

Original: إيوا بلا ما تخافو، راكم حسن من بزاف د الطيور.
Original Translation: So don't be afraid. You are worth more than many sparrows.
Translated Sentence: Don't worry, you're better than most birds.

Original: اللي غيعترف بي قدام الناس، غنعترف بيه حتى أنا قدام با اللي فالسماوات.
Original Translation: "What about someone who says in front of others that he knows me? I will also say in front of my Father who is in heaven that I know him.
Translated Sentence: Therefore, whoever acknowledges me before men, I will also acknowledge before my Father in heaven.

Original: ولكن اللي غينكرني قدام الناس، حتى أنا غنكره قدام با اللي فالسماوات». 2تيموتاوس 2‏:12 ماشي الهنا ولكن السيف
Original Translation: But what about someone who says in front of others that he doesn't know me? I will say in front of my Father who is in heaven that I don't know him.
Translated Sentence: But whoever disowns me before men, I will disown him before my Father in heaven".

Original: «عنداك يحساب ليكم بلي جيت باش ندير الهنا على الأرض، راه ما جبتش الهنا ولكن جبت السيف.
Original Translation: "Do not think that I came to bring peace to the earth. I didn't come to bring peace. I came to bring a sword.
Translated Sentence: "Do you think I came to bring peace on earth? I did not come to bring peace, but peace.

Original: جيت باش نفرق بين الولد وباه، وبين البنت ومها، وبين العروسة وعݣوزتها.
Original Translation: I have come to turn " 'sons against their fathers.  Daughters will refuse to obey their mothers.  Daughters-in-law will be against their mothers-in-law.
Translated Sentence: I came to separate the son from his father, the daughter from her mother, and the bride from her mother-in-law.

Original: وغادي يوليو عديان بنادم هم مالين داره.
Original Translation: A man's enemies will be the members of his own family.' (Micah 7:6)
Translated Sentence: July is going to be a very busy month for me.

Original: اللي عزيز عليه باه ولا مه كتر مني، ما يستاهلنيش. واللي عزيز عليه ولده ولا بنته كتر مني، ما يستاهلنيش.
Original Translation: "Anyone who loves his father or mother more than me is not worthy of me. Anyone who loves his son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.
Translated Sentence: He who loves his father or mother more than me is not worthy of me. He who loves his son or daughter more than me is not worthy of me.

Original: واللي ما يهزش صليبه ويتبعني، ما يستاهلنيش. متى
Original Translation: And anyone who does not pick up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.
Translated Sentence: And he who does not take up his cross and follow me is not worthy of me.

Original: حيت اللي بغا ينجي حياته غادي يخسرها، واللي خسر حياته على قبلي غادي ينجيها». متى 16‏:25؛ مرقس 8‏:35؛ لوقا 9‏:24؛ 17‏:33؛ يوحنا 12‏:25 الأجر
Original Translation: If anyone finds his life, he will lose it. If anyone loses his life because of me, he will find it.
Translated Sentence: For whoever wants to save his life will lose it, but whoever loses his life for me will find it.

Original: «اللي رحب بيكم رحب بي، واللي رحب بي رحب بهاداك اللي صيفطني. لوقا
Original Translation: "Anyone who welcomes you welcomes me. And anyone who welcomes me welcomes the One who sent me.
Translated Sentence: "He who receives you receives me, and he who receives me receives the one who sent me.

Original: واللي رحب بشي نبي وهو عارفه نبي، غادي ياخد أجر بحال ديال النبي. واللي رحب بشي واحد متاقي الله وهو عارفه متاقي الله، غادي ياخد أجر بحال ديال اللي متاقي الله.
Original Translation: Suppose someone welcomes a prophet as a prophet. That one will receive a prophet's reward. And suppose someone welcomes a godly person as a godly person. That one will receive a godly person's reward.
Translated Sentence: Anyone who welcomes a prophet because he is a prophet will receive a prophet's reward, and anyone who welcomes a righteous man because he is a righteous man will receive a righteous man's reward.

Original: كل من كيعطي لواحد من هاد الصغار واخا غير كاس د الما بارد علاحقاش هو تلميد ديالي، نݣول ليكم الحق، راه ما غيضيعش فالأجر دياله».
Original Translation: Suppose someone gives even a cup of cold water to a little one who follows me. What I'm about to tell you is true. That one will certainly be rewarded."
Translated Sentence: And if anyone gives even a cup of cold water to one of these little ones because he is my disciple, I tell you the truth, he will certainly not lose his reward.

Original: الفصل حضاش يوحنا المعمدان كيصيفط تلامده ليسوع
Original Translation: Jesus and John the Baptist
Translated Sentence: Chapter X. John the Baptist sends his disciples to Jesus

Original: وملي كمل يسوع الوصيات اللي عطى لتلامده الطناش، مشى من تم باش يعلم ويخبر بالبشارة فالمدون ديال ليهود.
Original Translation: Jesus finished teaching his 12 disciples. Then he went on to teach and preach in the towns of Galilee.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus had finished instructing his twelve disciples, he went away from there and preached and taught in the towns of Judea.

Original: وملي سمع يوحنا وهو فالحبس على داكشي اللي كيدير المسيح، صيفط ليه تلامده باش يسوله.
Original Translation: John was in prison. When he heard what Christ was doing, he sent his disciples to him.
Translated Sentence: When John heard in prison what Christ was doing, he sent his disciples to him.

Original: وݣال ليه: «واش نت هو اللي جاي، ولا نتسناو واحد آخر؟».
Original Translation: They asked Jesus, "Are you the one who was supposed to come? Or should we look for someone else?"
Translated Sentence: to ask him, " Are you the one who was to come, or should we expect someone else? "

Original: وجاوبهم يسوع وݣال ليهم: «سيرو رجعو خبرو يوحنا بكل ما كتسمعو وكتشوفو:
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Go back to John. Report to him what you hear and see.
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Go back and report to John what you hear and see:

Original: العميين ولاو كيشوفو، والعرجين كيمشيو، والمجدامين ولاو طاهرين، والصمكين ولاو كيسمعو، والموتى حياو، والمساكين كيسمعو البشارة.
Original Translation: Blind people receive sight. Disabled people walk. Those who have skin diseases are healed. Deaf people hear. Those who are dead are raised to life. And the good news is preached to those who are poor.
Translated Sentence: The blind receive sight, the lame walk, the lame are cured, the deaf hear, the dead are raised, and the poor have the good news announced to them.

Original: وسعدات هاداك اللي ما غيشكش في».
Original Translation: Blessed are those who do not give up their faith because of me."
Translated Sentence: And those are the ones I'm not going to miss.

Original: وملي مشاو تلامد يوحنا بحالهم، بدا يسوع كيتكلم مع الجماعات د الناس على يوحنا وݣال: «آش خرجتو تشوفو فالصحرا؟ واش شي قصبة كتديها الريح وكتجيبها؟
Original Translation: As John's disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John. He said, "What did you go out into the desert to see? Tall grass waving in the wind?
Translated Sentence: As John's disciples were leaving, Jesus began to speak to the crowd about John: "What did you go out into the desert to see? A reed swayed by the wind?

Original: ولا آش خرجتو تشوفو؟ واش شي راجل لابس لباس رفيع؟ حيت اللي كيلبسو اللباس الرفيع، هادوك راهم ساكنين فقصور الملوك!
Original Translation: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No. People who wear fine clothes are in kings' palaces.
Translated Sentence: If not, what did you go out to see? A man dressed in fine clothes? No, those who wear fine clothes are in kings' palaces.

Original: ݣولو لي آش خرجتو تشوفو؟ واش شي نبي؟ نݣول ليكم إيه، راه نبي وكتر من نبي.
Original Translation: Then what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.
Translated Sentence: Then what did you go out to see? A prophet? Yes, I tell you, and more than a prophet.

Original: وراه هادا هو اللي ݣال عليه الله فكتابه: هاني غنصيفط الرسول ديالي قدامك، اللي غيوجد ليك الطريق.
Original Translation: He is the one written about in Scripture. It says, " 'I will send my messenger ahead of you.  He will prepare your way for you.' (Malachi 3:1)
Translated Sentence: This is the one about whom it is written: "' I will send my messenger ahead of you, who will prepare your way before you. '

Original: ونݣول ليكم الحق: ما بانش من بين اللي تزادو من العيالات شي واحد حسن من يوحنا المعمدان، ولكن الصغير ݣاع فمملكة السماوات راه خير منه.
Original Translation: "What I'm about to tell you is true. No one more important than John the Baptist has ever been born. But the least important person in the kingdom of heaven is more important than he is.
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, among those born of women there has not risen anyone greater than John the Baptist; yet he who is least in the kingdom of heaven is greater than he.

Original: ومن يام يوحنا المعمدان حتى لليوم ومملكة السماوات كتكبر بالقوة، والقويين كيديرو جهدهم باش يخطفوها. لوقا
Original Translation: Since the days of John the Baptist, the kingdom of heaven has been advancing with force. And forceful people are taking hold of it.
Translated Sentence: From the days of John the Baptist until now, the kingdom of heaven has been forcefully advancing, and forceful men lay hold of it.

Original: وݣاع الأنبيا وشرع موسى تنبأو حتى للوقت اللي جا فيه يوحنا المعمدان.
Original Translation: All the Prophets and the Law prophesied until John came.
Translated Sentence: For all the prophets and the Law prophesied until John.

Original: إلا كنتو كتيقو، راه يوحنا المعمدان هو إيليا اللي خاصه يجي. متى
Original Translation: If you are willing to accept it, John is the Elijah who was supposed to come.
Translated Sentence: And if you are willing to accept it, this is Elijah who was to come.

Original: إيوا اللي عنده شي ودنين، يسمع!
Original Translation: Those who have ears should listen.
Translated Sentence: Anyone with a couple of minutes, listen up!

Original: ولكن بآش غنشبه هاد الجيل؟ راه بحال شي ولاد ݣالسين فالسواق كيعيطو لبعضياتهم وكيݣولو:
Original Translation: "What can I compare today's people to? They are like children sitting in the market places and calling out to others. They say,
Translated Sentence: But what will this generation look like? It's like kids sitting in the marketplace calling out to each other,

Original: نفخنا ليكم فالليرة وما شطحتو،  وندبنا ليكم وما بكيتو!،
Original Translation: " 'We played the flute for you.  But you didn't dance.  We sang a funeral song.  But you didn't become sad.'
Translated Sentence: We blew for you and you didn 't break, we cried for you and you cried!

Original: راه جا يوحنا، وكان ما كياكل وما كيشرب، وݣالو: هادا راه ساكنه جن.
Original Translation: When John came, he didn't eat or drink as you do. And people say, 'He has a demon.'
Translated Sentence: For John came neither eating nor drinking, and they say, 'He has a demon.'

Original: وجا ولد الإنسان كياكل وكيشرب، وهم يݣولو: هادا وكال وسكايري ومصاحب غير مع مالين الضريبة والمدنبين!، ولكن حكمة الله كتبان صالحة من الغلة ديالها». يا ويل المدون اللي ما تابوش
Original Translation: But when the Son of Man came, he ate and drank as you do. And people say, 'This fellow is always eating and drinking far too much. He's a friend of tax collectors and "sinners." ' Those who act wisely prove that wisdom is right." Cities That Do Not Turn Away From Sin
Translated Sentence: The Son of Man came eating and drinking, and they say, 'Here is a glutton and a drunkard, a friend of tax collectors and" sinners. " "But wisdom is proved right by her actions".

Original: وديك الساعة، بدا يسوع كيلوم المدون اللي دار فيهم المعجزات كتر من المدون لخرين، حيت الناس ديالهم ما تابوش.
Original Translation: Jesus began to speak against the cities where he had done most of his miracles. The people there had not turned away from their sins. So he said,
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus began to denounce the cities in which he had done so many miracles, because they did not repent.

Original: «يا ويلك آ كورزين! ويا ويلك آ بيت صيدا! كون المعجزات اللي تدارو فيكم تدارو فصور وفصيدا، كون شحال هادي تابو ماليهم، وكون لبسو الخيش وݣلسو على الرماد # 11‏:21 لبسو الخيش وݣلسو على الرماد: باش يبينو التوبة ديالهم .
Original Translation: "How terrible it will be for you, Korazin! How terrible for you, Bethsaida! Suppose the miracles done in you had been done in Tyre and Sidon. They would have turned away from their sins long ago. They would have put on black clothes. They would have sat down in ashes.
Translated Sentence: "Woe to you, Korazin! Woe to you, Sidon! If the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Tyre and Sidon, they would have repented in sackcloth and ashes.

Original: ولكن نݣول ليكم: عاقبة مدون صور وصيدا فيوم الحساب غادي تكون خف من عاقبتكم.
Original Translation: But I tell you this. On judgment day it will be easier for Tyre and Sidon than for you.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for the tax collector and his slave on the day of judgment than for you.

Original: ونت آ كفرناحوم! واش غتهزي حتى للسما؟، راك غادي تخبطي حتى للهاوية. حيت كون تدارو فسدوم المعجزات اللي تدارو فيك، كون راه ݣاع ما فنات وكون بقات حتى لليوم.
Original Translation: "And what about you, Capernaum? Will you be lifted up to heaven? No! You will go down to the place of the dead. Suppose the miracles done in you had been done in Sodom. It would still be here today.
Translated Sentence: And you, Capernaum, will you be lifted up to the skies? No, you will go down to the depths. If the miracles that were performed in you had been performed in Sodom, it would have remained to this day.

Original: وعلى هادشي نݣول ليكم: عاقبة سدوم فيوم الحساب غادي تكون خف من عاقبتكم». متى 10‏:15؛ لوقا 10‏:12 أجيو لعندي ورتاحو
Original Translation: But I tell you this. On judgment day it will be easier for Sodom than for you." Rest for All Who Are Tired
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, it will be more bearable for Sodom on that day than for you".

Original: وفديك الساعة تكلم يسوع وݣال: «كنحمدك آ الآب، يا رب السما والأرض، حيت بينتي للدراري الصغار داكشي اللي خبيتيه على الحكما والفهما.
Original Translation: At that time Jesus said, "I praise you, Father. You are Lord of heaven and earth. You have hidden these things from the wise and educated. But you have shown them to little children.
Translated Sentence: At that time Jesus said, "I thank you, Father, Lord of heaven and earth, that you have hidden these things from the wise and learned, and revealed them to little children.

Original: إيه آ الآب، هكا كان مرادك.
Original Translation: Yes, Father. This is what you wanted.
Translated Sentence: Yes, Father, that is what you wanted.

Original: الآب عطاني كلشي، وحتى حد ما كيعرف شكون هو ولد الآب غير الآب، ولا شكون هو الآب غير ولد الآب وغير هاداك اللي ولد الآب بغا يوريه ليه. يوحنا 3‏:35؛ يوحنا 1‏:18؛ 10‏:15
Original Translation: "My Father has given all things to me. The Father is the only one who knows the Son. And the only ones who know the Father are the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to make him known.
Translated Sentence: "All things have been committed to me by my Father. No one knows who the Son is except the Father, and no one knows who the Father is except the Son and those to whom the Son chooses to reveal him".

Original: أجيو لعندي آ اللي عييتو كلكم واللي هازين الحمل التقيل وأنا غنعطيكم الراحة.
Original Translation: "Come to me, all of you who are tired and are carrying heavy loads. I will give you rest.
Translated Sentence: Come to me, all you weary and heavy-laden, and I will give you rest.

Original: هزو النير ديالي عليكم وتعلمو مني، حيت أنا ضريف ومتواضع، وراه غادي تلقاو الراحة لنفوسكم.
Original Translation: Become my servants and learn from me. I am gentle and free of pride. You will find rest for your souls.
Translated Sentence: Take my yoke upon you and learn from me, for I am gentle and humble in heart, and you will find refreshment for your souls.

Original: حيت النير ديالي ساهل والحمل ديالي خفيف».
Original Translation: Serving me is easy, and my load is light."
Translated Sentence: For my yoke is easy and my burden is light.

Original: الفصل طناش يسوع كيعلم على السبت
Original Translation: Jesus Is Lord of the Sabbath Day
Translated Sentence: Chapter Twelve Jesus teaches on the Sabbath

Original: وفديك ليام، فواحد السبت، داز يسوع بين الفدادن د الزرع، وكان فتلامده الجوع، وهم يبداو كيقطعو السبول وكياكلو.
Original Translation: One Sabbath day Jesus walked through the grainfields. His disciples were hungry. So they began to break off some heads of grain and eat them.
Translated Sentence: One Sabbath Jesus was going through the grainfields. His disciples were hungry, and they began to pick some heads of grain and eat.

Original: وملي شافوهم الفريسيين ݣالو ليه: «شوف تلامدك كيديرو شي حوايج ما خاصهمش يتدارو نهار السبت!».
Original Translation: The Pharisees saw this. They said to Jesus, "Look! It is against the Law to do this on the Sabbath. But your disciples are doing it anyway!"
Translated Sentence: When the Pharisees saw this, they said to him, "Look, your disciples are doing what is unlawful on the Sabbath".

Original: ورد عليهم: «واش ما قريتوش آش دار داود ملي جاه الجوع هو وهادوك اللي معاه؟
Original Translation: Jesus answered, "Haven't you read about what David did? He and his men were hungry.
Translated Sentence: He replied, "Have you never read what David did when he and his companions were hungry?

Original: وكيفاش دخل لبيت الله، وكلا الخبز اللي كيقدموه لله، اللي ما كانش خاص ياكله لا هو ولا هادوك اللي معاه من غير رجال الدين بوحدهم.
Original Translation: So he entered the house of God. He and his men ate the holy bread. Only priests were allowed to eat it.
Translated Sentence: He entered the house of God, and taking the consecrated bread, he and his companions ate what was not lawful for them to eat - except for the priests.

Original: واش ما قريتوش فالتوراة بلي رجال الدين وهم كيخدمو فبيت الله نهار السبت، كيتعداو على السبت، وواخا داكشي ما عليهم لوم؟
Original Translation: Haven't you read the Law? It tells how every Sabbath day the priests in the temple have to do their work on that day. But they are not considered guilty.
Translated Sentence: Or haven't you read in the Law that on the Sabbath the priests in the temple desecrate the day and yet are innocent?

Original: ولكن أنا نݣول ليكم: راه كاين هنا اللي هو كبر من بيت الله.
Original Translation: "I tell you that one who is more important than the temple is here.
Translated Sentence: I tell you that one greater than the temple is here.

Original: وكون فهمتو المعنى ديال الآية اللي كتݣول: بغيت الرحمة ماشي الدبيحة، كون ݣاع ما حكمتو على اللي ما عليهم لوم.
Original Translation: Scripture says, 'I want mercy and not sacrifice.' (Hosea 6:6) You don't know what those words mean. If you did, you would not bring charges against those who are not guilty.
Translated Sentence: If you had known what this means, 'I desire mercy, not sacrifice,' you would not have condemned the innocent.

Original: حيت ولد الإنسان هو الرب ديال السبت». يسوع كيشافي فنهار السبت
Original Translation: The Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath day."
Translated Sentence: For the Son of Man is Lord of the Sabbath.

Original: ومشى من تم وجا لدار الصلاة ديالهم،
Original Translation: Going on from that place, Jesus went into their synagogue.
Translated Sentence: And as they walked to their chapel,

Original: ولقا واحد الراجل يده مشلولة. وهم يسولوه وݣالو: «واش حلال الشفا نهار السبت؟» سولوه باش يلقاو عليه شي تهمة.
Original Translation: A man with a weak and twisted hand was there. The Pharisees were trying to find fault with Jesus. So they asked him, "Does the Law allow us to heal on the Sabbath day?"
Translated Sentence: and a man with a shriveled hand was there. Looking for a reason to accuse Jesus, they asked him, "Is it lawful to heal on the Sabbath?"

Original: وجاوبهم: «إلا شي واحد فيكم عنده خروف واحد وطاح ليه فحفرة نهار السبت، واش ما غيقبطوش ويهزه ويخرجه؟ لوقا
Original Translation: He said to them, "What if one of your sheep falls into a pit on the Sabbath? Won't you take hold of it and lift it out?
Translated Sentence: He said to them, "If any of you has a sheep and it falls into a pit on the Sabbath, will you not take hold of it and lift it out?

Original: إيوا راه قيمة بنادم كتر بزاف من الخروف! وهادشي علاش عمل الخير حلال نهار السبت».
Original Translation: A man is worth more than sheep! So the Law allows us to do good on the Sabbath day."
Translated Sentence: How much more valuable is a man than a sheep! Therefore it is lawful to do good on the Sabbath".

Original: وݣال يسوع للراجل اللي يده مشلولة: «مد يدك!» ومدها، وهي تولي صحيحة بحال اليد لخرى.
Original Translation: Then Jesus said to the man, "Stretch out your hand." So he stretched it out. It was as good as new, just as good as the other hand.
Translated Sentence: Then he said to the man, "Stretch out your hand. " He stretched it out and it was completely restored, just as sound as the other.

Original: وخرجو الفريسيين كيتافقو كيفاش يقتلوه. يسوع هو المختار من الله
Original Translation: But the Pharisees went out and planned how to kill Jesus. God's Chosen Servant
Translated Sentence: But the Pharisees went out and plotted how they might kill him.

Original: وملي ساق يسوع الخبار، مشى من تم وتبعوه جماعات كتار من الناس، وشفاهم كلهم.
Original Translation: Jesus knew all about the Pharisees' plans. So he left that place. Many followed him, and he healed all their sick people.
Translated Sentence: But as news of this spread, great crowds followed him, and he healed them all.

Original: ووصاهم باش ما يخبرو حد عليه.
Original Translation: But he warned them not to tell who he was.
Translated Sentence: He warned them not to tell anyone about it.

Original: باش يتحقق الكلام اللي ݣال النبي إشعيا:
Original Translation: This was to make what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah come true. It says,
Translated Sentence: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet Isaiah:

Original: «ها هو عبدي اللي ختاريت،  العزيز ديالي اللي بيه نفسي فرحات بزاف.  غادي نحط عليه روحي،  وغيخبر الشعوب بالحق.
Original Translation: "Here is my servant. I have chosen him.  He is the one I love. I am very pleased with him.  I will put my Spirit on him.  He will announce to the nations that everything will be made right.
Translated Sentence: "Here is my servant whom I have chosen, the one I love, in whom I delight; I will put my Spirit on him, and he will proclaim justice to the nations.

Original: ما غيتخاصم وما غيغوت،  حتى حد ما غيسمع صوته فالزناقي.
Original Translation: He will not argue or cry out.  No one will hear his voice in the streets.
Translated Sentence: He won't argue or argue, so no one will hear him in the hallway.

Original: قصبة مشقوقة ما غيهرس،  وفتيلة كتطلق الدخان ما غيطفي،  حتى يرد الحق هو اللي غالب.
Original Translation: He will not break a bent twig.  He will not put out a dimly burning flame.  He will make everything right.
Translated Sentence: A crackling reed will not burn, and a smoke-filled spark will not go out, until the truth is revealed.

Original: وفالإسم دياله غيديرو الشعوب رجاهم». يسوع وبعلزبول
Original Translation: The nations will put their hope in him." (Isaiah 42:1-4) Jesus and Beelzebub
Translated Sentence: And in his name the nations will be gathered together.

Original: وجابو شي ناس ليسوع واحد الراجل عمى وزيزون وساكنه جن، وهو يشافيه، وهكا ولى قادر يتكلم ويشوف.
Original Translation: A man controlled by demons was brought to Jesus. The man was blind and could not speak. Jesus healed him. Then the man could speak and see.
Translated Sentence: Then they brought to him a man who was blind and demon - possessed. Jesus healed him, so that he could both talk and see.

Original: وتعجبو الجماعات د الناس وݣالو: «ياكما هادا هو بن داود؟».
Original Translation: All the people were amazed. They said, "Could this be the Son of David?"
Translated Sentence: All the people were astonished and said, "Could this be the Son of David?"

Original: وملي سمعو الفريسيين هادشي ݣالو: «هادا راه ما كيخرج الجنون غير ببعلزبول رئيس الجنون». متى 9‏:34؛ 10‏:25
Original Translation: The Pharisees heard this. So they said, "This fellow drives out demons by the power of Beelzebub, the prince of demons."
Translated Sentence: But when the Pharisees heard this, they said, "This fellow drives out demons by Beelzebub, the prince of demons".

Original: وعرف يسوع فاش كيفكرو وݣال ليهم: «كل مملكة كتقسم كتخرب، وكل مدينة ولا عائلة كتقسم ما غتدومش.
Original Translation: Jesus knew what they were thinking. So he said to them, "Every kingdom that fights against itself will be destroyed. Every city or family that is divided against itself will not stand.
Translated Sentence: Jesus knew their thoughts and said to them, "Every kingdom divided against itself will be ruined, and every city or household divided against itself will not stand.

Original: إيوا إلا كان الشيطان كيخرج الشيطان، غادي يكون الشيطان تقسم وولى ضد راسه، وإلا تقسم وولى ضد راسه كيفاش غادي تبقى مملكته تابتة؟
Original Translation: If Satan drives out Satan, he fights against himself. Then how can his kingdom stand?
Translated Sentence: If Satan drives out Satan, he is divided against himself. If then he is divided against himself, how can his kingdom stand?

Original: وإلا كنت أنا ببعلزبول كنخرج الجنون، إيوا شكون هادا اللي ولادكم كيخرجوهم بيه؟ على هادشي راه ولادكم اللي غادي يحكمو عليكم.
Original Translation: You say I drive out demons by the power of Beelzebub. Then by whose power do your people drive them out? So then, they will be your judges.
Translated Sentence: And if I cast out demons by Beelzebul, by whom do your children cast them out? So they will be your judges.

Original: ولكن إلا كنت أنا بروح الله كنخرج الجنون، راه مملكة الله جات فوسط منكم.
Original Translation: But suppose I drive out demons by the Spirit of God. Then God's kingdom has come to you.
Translated Sentence: But if I drive out demons by the Spirit of God, then the kingdom of God has come to you.

Original: وكيفاش يقدر شي حد يدخل لدار شي واحد صحيح ويسرق ليه حوايجه بلا ما يكتفه فاللول، وعاد يسرق ليه داره؟
Original Translation: "Or think about this. How can you enter a strong man's house and just take what the man owns? You must first tie him up. Then you can rob his house.
Translated Sentence: How can someone break into someone's house and steal their belongings without first getting their hands on them, and then rob them again?

Original: اللي ماشي معاي راه ضدي، واللي ما كيجمعش معاي راه كيفرق. مرقس 9‏:40
Original Translation: "Anyone who is not with me is against me. Anyone who does not gather sheep with me scatters them.
Translated Sentence: "He who is not with me is against me, and he who does not gather with me scatters.

Original: داكشي علاش نݣول ليكم: كل دنب وكل كلام الكفر اللي كيتݣال غيتغفر للناس، ولكن كلام الكفر اللي كيتݣال على الروح القدس ما غيتغفرش.
Original Translation: So here is what I tell you. Every sin and every evil word spoken against God will be forgiven. But speaking evil things against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven.
Translated Sentence: "Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven.

Original: اللي ݣال شي كلمة ضد ولد الإنسان غيتغفر ليه، ولكن اللي ݣال شي كلمة ضد الروح القدس ما غاديش يتغفر ليه لا فهاد الدنيا ولا فلاخرة». لوقا 12‏:10 الشجرة وغلتها
Original Translation: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven. But anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven. A person like that won't be forgiven either now or in days to come.
Translated Sentence: Anyone who speaks a word against the Son of Man will be forgiven, but anyone who speaks against the Holy Spirit will not be forgiven, either in this age or in the age to come.

Original: «غرسو شجرة مزيانة وغتكون غلتها مزيانة، ولا غرسو شجرة خايبة وغتكون غلتها خايبة. راه من الغلة كتعرف الشجرة. متى
Original Translation: "If you make a tree good, its fruit will be good. If you make a tree bad, its fruit will be bad. You can tell a tree by its fruit.
Translated Sentence: "A good tree is good if its fruit is good, and a bad tree is bad if its fruit is bad; for a tree is recognized by its fruit.

Original: آ تريكة اللفاعي! كيفاش تقدرو تݣولو شي كلام مزيان ونتم ما مزيانينش؟ راه داكشي اللي كيخرج من القلب كيتكلم بيه الفم. متى
Original Translation: "You nest of poisonous snakes! How can you who are evil say anything good? Your mouths say everything that is in your hearts.
Translated Sentence: You brood of vipers! How can you speak good words when you are evil? For out of the overflow of the heart the mouth speaks.

Original: بنادم المزيان كيخرج الحوايج المزيانين من الكنز المزيان اللي فقلبه، وبنادم الخايب كيخرج الحوايج الخايبين من الكنز الخايب اللي فقلبه.
Original Translation: A good man says good things. These come from the good that is put away inside him. An evil man says evil things. These come from the evil that is put away inside him.
Translated Sentence: The good man brings out the good things from the good treasures in his heart, and the bad man brings out the bad things from the bad treasures in his heart.

Original: ونݣول ليكم: راه كل هضرة خاوية كيݣولوها الناس، غادي يتحاسبو عليها فيوم الحساب.
Original Translation: But here is what I tell you. On judgment day, people will have to account for every careless word they have spoken.
Translated Sentence: But I tell you that men will have to give account on the day of judgment for every careless word they have spoken.

Original: علاحقاش راه بكلامك غادي يتحكم عليك يا إما باري ويا إما مدنب». العلما د الشرع والفريسيين بغاو يشوفو شي علامة
Original Translation: By your words you will be found guilty or not guilty." The Miraculous Sign of Jonah
Translated Sentence: They will catch him by word of mouth and condemn him. The teachers of the law and the Pharisees asked Jesus to show them a miraculous sign.

Original: وديك الساعة ردو عليه شي وحدين من العلما د الشرع والفريسيين وݣالو: «آ سيدي، راه بغينا نشوفو منك شي علامة». متى
Original Translation: Some of the Pharisees and the teachers of the law came to Jesus. They said, "Teacher, we want to see a miraculous sign from you."
Translated Sentence: Then some of the Pharisees and teachers of the law said to him, "Teacher, we want to see a miraculous sign from you".

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «جيل قبيح وفاسد كيطلب علامة! وما غادي تعطاه حتى شي علامة من غير علامة النبي يونان. متى
Original Translation: He answered, "Evil and unfaithful people ask for a miraculous sign! But none will be given except the sign of the prophet Jonah.
Translated Sentence: He replied, "A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a miraculous sign! But none will be given it except the sign of the prophet Jonah.

Original: علاحقاش كما بقى يونان فكرش الحوتة تلت يام وتلت ليالي، هكا غادي يبقى ولد الإنسان فقلب الأرض تلت يام وتلت ليالي.
Original Translation: Jonah was in the stomach of a huge fish for three days and three nights. Something like that will happen to the Son of Man. He will spend three days and three nights in the grave.
Translated Sentence: For as Jonah was in the belly of the great fish three days and three nights, so the Son of Man will be in the heart of the earth three days and three nights.

Original: ناس نينوى غادي يتبعتو فيوم الحساب مع هاد الجيل ويشهدو عليه، علاحقاش هم تابو ملي نبههم يونان، وها هو دابا هنا واحد فضل من يونان.
Original Translation: "The men of Nineveh will stand up on judgment day with the people now living. And the Ninevites will prove that those people are guilty. The men of Nineveh turned away from their sins when Jonah preached to them. And now one who is more important than Jonah is here.
Translated Sentence: The men of Nineveh will stand up at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for they repented at the preaching of Jonah, and now one greater than Jonah is here.

Original: وملكة الجنوب غادية تبعت فيوم الحساب مع هاد الجيل وتشهد عليه، علاحقاش جات من أرض بعيدة باش تسمع حكمة سليمان، وها هو دابا هنا واحد فضل من سليمان.
Original Translation: "The Queen of the South will stand up on judgment day with the people now living. And she will prove that they are guilty. She came from very far away to listen to Solomon's wisdom. And now one who is more important than Solomon is here.
Translated Sentence: The Queen of the South will rise at the judgment with this generation and condemn it; for she came from the ends of the earth to hear the wisdom of Solomon, and now one greater than Solomon is here.

Original: راه ملي كيخرج الجن من بنادم كيمشي يضور فبلايص ما فيهمش الما، كيقلب على الراحة وما كيلقاهاش،
Original Translation: "What happens when an evil spirit comes out of a man? It goes through dry areas looking for a place to rest. But it doesn't find it.
Translated Sentence: When a demon is cast out of a person, he wanders about in a land without water, seeking rest and not finding it.

Original: وكيݣول: أرا نرجع لداري اللي خرجت منها، وكيرجع ليها وكيلقاها خاوية ومشطبة ومقادة.
Original Translation: Then it says, 'I will return to the house I left.' When it arrives there, it finds the house empty. The house has been swept clean and put in order.
Translated Sentence: He says, " I will go back to my house from which I came, and when I come back I will find it empty, swept and dirty. "

Original: وكيمشي وكيدي معاه سبعة ديال الجنون خرين شر منه. وملي كيدخلو كيسكنو تم، وكتولي حالة هاداك بنادم اللخرانية كفس من حالته اللولانية. هادشي اللي غادي يطرا لهاد الجيل اللي كيدير الشر حتى هو». خوت يسوع ومه
Original Translation: Then the evil spirit goes and takes with it seven other spirits more evil than itself. They go in and live there. That man is worse off than before. That is how it will be with the evil people of today." Jesus' Mother and Brothers
Translated Sentence: Then he goes and takes with him seven other spirits more wicked than himself, and they go in and live there. And just as it was with the first man, so it will be with this wicked generation".

Original: وملي كان كيتكلم مع الجماعات د الناس، جات مه وخوته ووقفو برا باغيين يتكلمو معاه.  [
Original Translation: While Jesus was still talking to the crowd, his mother and brothers stood outside. They wanted to speak to him.
Translated Sentence: While Jesus was still speaking to the crowd, his brothers and sisters came and stood outside, wanting to speak to him.

Original: وهو يݣول ليه واحد من الحاضرين: «ها مك وخوتك واقفين برا باغيين يتكلمو معاك».] # 12‏.47 هاد الآية ما كايناش فبزاف ديال المخطوطات القدام
Original Translation: Someone told him, "Your mother and brothers are standing outside. They want to speak to you."
Translated Sentence: And one of those present said to him, "Behold, your mother and your brothers are standing outside, wanting to speak with you".

Original: وهو يجاوبه يسوع وݣال ليه: «شكون هي مي؟ وشكون هم خوتي؟».
Original Translation: Jesus replied to him, "Who is my mother? And who are my brothers?"
Translated Sentence: "Who are these? " Jesus asked". My mother and my father".

Original: ونعت بيده لجهة تلامده وݣال: «ها هم مي وخوتي،
Original Translation: Jesus pointed to his disciples. He said, "Here is my mother! Here are my brothers!
Translated Sentence: Pointing to his disciples, he said, "These are my brothers and sisters.

Original: حيت هادوك اللي كيديرو مراد با اللي فالسما، هم خويا وختي ومي».
Original Translation: Anyone who does what my Father in heaven wants is my brother or sister or mother."
Translated Sentence: For those who seek the Father in heaven are my brothers and sisters.

Original: الفصل تلطاش المتال ديال الزارع
Original Translation: The Story of the Farmer
Translated Sentence: Chapter thirteen: The plantation

Original: وفداك النهار نيت، خرج يسوع من الدار وݣلس فجنب البحر.
Original Translation: That same day Jesus left the house and sat by the Sea of Galilee.
Translated Sentence: That same day Jesus went out of the house and sat by the lake.

Original: وتجمعو عليه بزاف د الجماعات د الناس، وبقوة الزحام طلع للفلوكة وݣلس فيها، ووقفو الجماعات د الناس كلهم على جنب البحر. لوقا 5‏:1‏-3
Original Translation: Large crowds gathered around him. So he got into a boat. He sat down in it. All the people stood on the shore.
Translated Sentence: Such large crowds gathered around him that he got into a boat and sat in it, while all the people were standing on the shore.

Original: وعاود ليهم بزاف د الحوايج بالمتول وݣال: «هادا واحد الراجل خرج باش يزرع،
Original Translation: Then he told them many things by using stories.  He said, "A farmer went out to plant his seed.
Translated Sentence: "A man went out to sow his seed.

Original: وملي كان كيزرع، طاحو شي حبات فالطريق وجاو الطيور وكلاوهم.
Original Translation: He scattered the seed on the ground. Some fell on a path. Birds came and ate it up.
Translated Sentence: As he was scattering the seed, some fell along the path, and the birds came and ate it up.

Original: وطاحو حبات خرين فواحد الأرض محجرة ما فيهاش تراب كتير، ودغيا نبتو حيت التراب ما كانش غارق،
Original Translation: Some seed fell on rocky places, where there wasn't much soil. The plants came up quickly, because the soil wasn't deep.
Translated Sentence: Others fell on rocky places, where there was little soil. They sprang up quickly, because the soil was shallow.

Original: وملي شرقات الشمس، تحرقو، وحيت ما كانش عندهم الجدر، يبسو.
Original Translation: When the sun came up, it burned the plants. They dried up because they had no roots.
Translated Sentence: When the sun comes up, they burn, and because they have no walls, they wear out.

Original: وطاحو حبات خرين فوسط الشوك، وملي كبر الشوك خنقهم.
Original Translation: Other seed fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and crowded out the plants.
Translated Sentence: They dropped some grains in the middle of the thorns, and the thorns choked them.

Original: وطاحو حبات خرين فأرض مزيانة وعطاو غلة، كاين فيهم اللي عطى مية، وكاين اللي عطى ستين، وكاين اللي عطى تلاتين.
Original Translation: Still other seed fell on good soil. It produced a crop 100, 60 or 30 times more than what was planted.
Translated Sentence: Still other seed fell on good soil and produced a crop, yielding a hundred, sixty or thirty times what was sown.

Original: إيوا اللي عنده شي ودنين، يسمع!». الغرض من المتول
Original Translation: Those who have ears should listen."
Translated Sentence: Whoever has a few minutes, listen!. The purpose of the tour is to get to know each other.

Original: وقربو لعنده تلامده وݣالو ليه: «علاش كتكلم مع الناس بالمتول؟»،
Original Translation: The disciples came to him. They asked, "Why do you use stories when you speak to the people?"
Translated Sentence: Then his disciples came to him and asked, "Why do you speak to the people in parables?"

Original: وهو يجاوبهم وݣال: «حيت نتم تعطاكم باش تفهمو أسرار مملكة السماوات، ولكن هادوك ما تعطاهمش باش يفهموهم.
Original Translation: He replied, "You have been given the chance to understand the secrets of the kingdom of heaven. It has not been given to outsiders.
Translated Sentence: He replied, "The knowledge of the secrets of the kingdom of heaven has been given to you, but not to them.

Original: حيت اللي عنده، غيتعطاه ويتزاد ليه كتر من القياس. واللي ما عندوش، حتى داكشي اللي عنده غادي يتخاد منه. متى
Original Translation: Everyone who has that kind of knowledge will be given more. In fact, they will have very much. If anyone doesn't have that kind of knowledge, even what little he has will be taken away from him.
Translated Sentence: For whoever has will be given more, and he will have an abundance. Whoever does not have, even what he has will be taken from him.

Original: وأنا كنتكلم معاهم بالمتول علاحقاش ملي كيشوفو ما كيشوفوش، وملي كيسمعو ما كيسمعوش وما كيفهموش.
Original Translation: Here is why I use stories when I speak to the people. I say, "They look, but they don't really see.  They listen, but they don't really hear or understand.
Translated Sentence: This is why I speak to them in parables: "Though seeing, they do not see; though hearing, they do not hear or understand".

Original: وهكا تحققات فيهم النبوة ديال إشعيا:  واخا تسمعو اللي سمعتو ما كتفهمو والو،  وواخا تشوفو اللي شفتو ما كيبان ليكم والو.
Original Translation: "In them the words of the prophet Isaiah come true. He said, " 'You will hear but never understand.  You will see but never know what you are seeing.
Translated Sentence: In them is fulfilled the prophecy of Isaiah: "' You will be ever hearing but never understanding; you will be ever seeing but never perceiving.

Original: حيت قلب هاد الشعب قساح،  السمع ديالهم قلال، وعينيهم تغمضو،  باش ما يشوفوش بعينيهم، وما يسمعوش بودنيهم،  وبقلبهم ما يفهموش، ويرجعو لي باش نشافيهم.
Original Translation: The hearts of these people have become stubborn.  They can barely hear with their ears.  They have closed their eyes.  Otherwise they might see with their eyes.  They might hear with their ears.  They might understand with their hearts.  They might turn to the Lord, and then he would heal them.' (Isaiah 6:9,10)
Translated Sentence: For this people's heart has become calloused; they hardly hear with their ears, and they have closed their eyes. Otherwise they might see with their eyes, hear with their ears, understand with their hearts and turn, and I would heal them. '

Original: ولكن نتم سعدات عينيكم حيت كيشوفو، وودنيكم حيت كيسمعو. لوقا
Original Translation: "But blessed are your eyes because they see. And blessed are your ears because they hear.
Translated Sentence: But blessed are your eyes because they see, and your ears because they hear.

Original: ونݣول ليكم الحق: راه بزاف ديال الأنبيا والصالحين تمناو يشوفو اللي كتشوفو نتم وما شافوهش، ويسمعو اللي كتسمعو نتم وما سمعوهش». المعنى د المتال ديال الزارع
Original Translation: What I'm about to tell you is true. Many prophets and godly people wanted to see what you see. But they didn't see it. They wanted to hear what you hear. But they didn't hear it.
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, many prophets and righteous men longed to see what you see but did not see it, and to hear what you hear but did not hear it.

Original: «إيوا سمعو نتم المعنى د المتال ديال الراجل اللي كيزرع:
Original Translation: "Listen! Here is the meaning of the story of the farmer.
Translated Sentence: "Listen to what the parable of the sower means.

Original: اللي كيسمع الكلام ديال مملكة الله وما كيفهموش، كيجي الشيطان وكيخطف داكشي اللي تزرع فقلبه، وهادا هو اللي كنشبهه بالزرع اللي طاح فالطريق.
Original Translation: People hear the message about the kingdom but do not understand it. Then the evil one comes. He steals what was planted in their hearts. Those people are like the seed planted on a path.
Translated Sentence: When anyone hears the message about the kingdom and does not understand it, the evil one comes and snatches away what was sown in his heart. This is the seed that was sown along the path.

Original: واللي تزرع فالأرض المحجرة، هادا هو اللي كيسمع كلام الله وكيقبله دغيا بالفرحة،
Original Translation: Others received the seed that fell on rocky places. They are those who hear the message and at once receive it with joy.
Translated Sentence: The one who received the seed that fell on rocky places is the man who hears the word and at once receives it with joy.

Original: ولكن كلمة الله ما شاداش مزيان فقلبه، وإيمانه كيبقى غير وقت قليل، وملي كيوقعو المشاكيل والتعدو، كيبعد دغيا على الإيمان.
Original Translation: But they have no roots. So they last only a short time. They quickly fall away from the faith when trouble or suffering comes because of the message.
Translated Sentence: But he has no root in him and is unfruitful; he stands only for a short time, and when trouble or persecution comes, he quickly falls away.

Original: واللي مزروع وسط الشوك، هو اللي كيسمع كلام الله ولكن هم الدنيا ومحبة الفلوس كيخنقو كلام الله فيه وما كيعطي غلة.
Original Translation: Others received the seed that fell among the thorns. They are those who hear the message. But then the worries of this life and the false promises of wealth crowd it out. They keep it from producing fruit.
