Translated Sentence: The one who received the seed that fell among the thorns is the man who hears the word, but the world's desires and the desire for money choke it, making it unfruitful.

Original: أما هاداك اللي مزروع فالأرض المزيانة، هو اللي كيسمع كلام الله وكيفهمه وهو اللي كيعطي الغلة، بعض الخطرات على مية مرة، وبعض الخطرات على ستين، وبعض الخطرات على تلاتين». المتال ديال الزوان وسط الݣمح
Original Translation: But still others received the seed that fell on good soil. They are those who hear the message and understand it. They produce a crop 100, 60 or 30 times more than the farmer planted." The Story of the Weeds
Translated Sentence: But the one who received the seed that fell on good soil is the man who hears the word and understands it. He produces a crop, yielding a hundred times as much, sixty times as much and thirty times as much".

Original: وعطاهم يسوع واحد المتال آخر وݣال: «كتشبه مملكة السماوات لواحد الراجل زرع زريعة مزيانة فالفدان دياله.
Original Translation: Jesus told the crowd another story. "Here is what the kingdom of heaven is like," he said. "A man planted good seed in his field.
Translated Sentence: He told them another parable: "The kingdom of heaven is like a man who sowed good seed in his field.

Original: وملي كانو الناس ناعسين، جا العدو دياله وزرع ليه الزوان وسط الݣمح ومشى بحاله.
Original Translation: But while everyone was sleeping, his enemy came. The enemy planted weeds among the wheat and then went away.
Translated Sentence: But while the people were sleeping, his enemy came and sowed weeds among the wheat and went away.

Original: وملي نبت الزرع وخرج السبول، بان معاه الزوان حتى هو.
Original Translation: The wheat began to grow and form grain. At the same time, weeds appeared.
Translated Sentence: When the plant grows and the urine comes out, it has a little bit of a leak.

Original: وهم يجيو الخداما ديال مول الدار وݣالو ليه: آ سيدي، واش ماشي الزريعة المزيانة هي اللي زرعتي فالفدان ديالك؟ إيوا منين جا هاد الزوان؟
Original Translation: "The owner's servants came to him. They said, 'Sir, didn't you plant good seed in your field? Then where did the weeds come from?'
Translated Sentence: "The owner's servants came and said to him,' Sir, didn't you sow good seed in your field? Where did this weed come from? '

Original: وهو يجاوبهم: شي عدو هادا اللي دار هادشي. وهم يݣولو ليه الخداما دياله: واش تبغي نمشيو نحيدوه؟
Original Translation: " 'An enemy did this,' he replied.  "The servants asked him, 'Do you want us to go and pull the weeds up?'
Translated Sentence: "' An enemy did this, 'he replied". The servants asked him, 'Do you want us to go and pull them up?'

Original: وجاوبهم وݣال: لا! باش ما يتݣلعش الݣمح مع الزوان.
Original Translation: " 'No,' the owner answered. 'While you are pulling up the weeds, you might pull up the wheat with them.
Translated Sentence: "' No, 'he answered,' because you may pull the wheat with the weeds.

Original: خليو الݣمح يكبر مع الزوان حتى يوصل وقت الحصاد، وديك الساعة نݣول للحصادا يجمعو الزوان هو اللول ويديروه حزمات باش يتحرق، أما الݣمح يجمعوه ويديوه لبيت الخزين ديالي». المتال ديال حبة الخردل والمتال د الخميرة
Original Translation: Let both grow together until the harvest. At that time I will tell the workers what to do. Here is what I will say to them. First collect the weeds. Tie them in bundles to be burned. Then gather the wheat. Bring it into my storeroom.' " The Stories of the Mustard Seed and the Yeast
Translated Sentence: Let the wheat grow with the chaff until harvest time, and then I tell the harvester to gather the chaff first and pack it to burn, but the wheat is collected and put into my storehouse.

Original: وعاود ݣال ليهم متال آخر: «كتشبه مملكة السماوات لواحد الحبة د الخردل خداها واحد الراجل وزرعها فالفدان دياله.
Original Translation: Jesus told the crowd another story. He said, "The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed. Someone took the seed and planted it in a field.
Translated Sentence: He told them another parable: "The kingdom of heaven is like a mustard seed, which a man took and planted in his field.

Original: وواخا هي الصغيرة فالحب كله، ملي كتكبر كتولي شجرة كبر من ݣاع الغرس، حتى طيور السما كيجيو باش يعششو فعروشها».
Original Translation: It is the smallest of all your seeds. But when it grows, it is the largest of all garden plants. It becomes a tree. Birds come and rest in its branches."
Translated Sentence: Though it is the smallest of all the garden plants, yet when it has grown, it is the largest of all the garden plants, so that the birds of the air come and perch in its branches".

Original: وزاد عطاهم متال آخر وݣال: «كتشبه مملكة السماوات لخميرة خداتها واحد المراة وخلطاتها مع تلاتة كيلو ديال الطحين حتى خمرات العجينة كلها». يسوع كيتكلم بالمتول
Original Translation: Jesus told them still another story. "The kingdom of heaven is like yeast," he said. "A woman mixed it into a large amount of flour. The yeast worked its way all through the dough."
Translated Sentence: He told them another parable: "The kingdom of heaven is like yeast that a woman took and mixed into a large amount of flour until it worked all through the dough".

Original: وهادشي كله ݣاله يسوع للجماعات د الناس بالمتول، وبلا متال ما كان كيݣول ليهم حتى حاجة،
Original Translation: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd by using stories. He did not say anything to them without telling a story.
Translated Sentence: Jesus spoke all these things to the crowd without figures of speech. He never said anything to them without figures of speech,

Original: باش يتحقق الكلام اللي ݣال النبي: «بالمتول نتكلم ونخبر بكل ما كان مخبي من النهار اللي تخلقات فيه الدنيا». المعنى د المتال ديال الزوان
Original Translation: So the words spoken by the prophet came true. He had said, "I will open my mouth and tell stories.  I will speak about things that were hidden since the world was made." (Psalm 78:2) Jesus Explains the Story of the Weeds
Translated Sentence: This was to fulfill what was spoken through the prophet: "I will open my mouth and declare hidden things from the creation of the world".

Original: وديك الساعة خلا يسوع الجماعات ديال الناس ورجع للدار، وهم يجيو لعنده تلامده وݣالو ليه: «فسر لينا المتال ديال الزوان اللي فالفدان!».
Original Translation: Then Jesus left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him. They said, "Explain to us the story of the weeds in the field."
Translated Sentence: Then he left the crowd and went into the house. His disciples came to him and asked, "Explain to us the parable of the weeds in the field".

Original: وجاوبهم وݣال: «اللي كيزرع الزريعة المزيانة هو ولد الإنسان،
Original Translation: He answered, "The one who planted the good seed is the Son of Man.
Translated Sentence: He answered, "The one who sows the good seed is the Son of Man.

Original: والفدان هو الدنيا، والݣمح المزيان هو ولاد مملكة الله، والزوان هو ولاد الشيطان،
Original Translation: The field is the world. The good seed stands for the people who belong to the kingdom. The weeds are the people who belong to the evil one.
Translated Sentence: The field is the world, the good wheat are the sons of the kingdom, and the weeds are the sons of the wicked one,

Original: والعدو اللي زرع الزوان هو إبليس، والحصاد هو آخر الزمان، والحصادا هم الملايكة.
Original Translation: The enemy who plants them is the devil. The harvest is judgment day. And the workers are angels.
Translated Sentence: The enemy who sowed the weeds is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the harvesters are angels.

Original: وكما كيتجمع الزوان ويتحرق بالعافية، هكا غيوقع فاللخر ديال الزمان:
Original Translation: "The weeds are pulled up and burned in the fire. That is how it will be on judgment day.
Translated Sentence: As the wood is collected and burned in a healthy manner, this will happen at the end of time:

Original: غادي يصيفط ولد الإنسان الملايكة دياله، وغادي يجمعو من مملكته ݣاع الأمور اللي كتسبب فالدنوب وݣاع هادوك اللي كيدنبو،
Original Translation: The Son of Man will send out his angels. They will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin. They will also get rid of all who do evil.
Translated Sentence: The Son of Man will send out his angels, and they will weed out of his kingdom everything that causes sin and all who do evil.

Original: ويرميوهم فزوبية د العافية، راه تم فين غادي يكون البكا وتغزاز السنان.
Original Translation: They will throw them into the blazing furnace. There people will sob and grind their teeth.
Translated Sentence: They throw them in the wellness area, where they will be weeping and gnashing their teeth.

Original: ولكن اللي كيطيعو الله غيضويو بحال الشمس فمملكة باهم. إيوا اللي عنده شي ودنين، يسمع!» المتال ديال الكنز والجوهرة والشبكة
Original Translation: Then God's people will shine like the sun in their Father's kingdom. Those who have ears should listen. The Stories of the Hidden Treasure and the Pearl
Translated Sentence: But the righteous will shine like the sun in the kingdom of heaven. He who has ears, let him hear. The metal of treasure, the jewel, and the net.

Original: «وكتشبه مملكة السماوات عاوتاني لواحد الكنز مدفون فواحد الفدان لقاه واحد الراجل وعاود دفنه، ومن كترة الفرحة دياله مشى باع كل ما كيملك وشرا داك الفدان.
Original Translation: "The kingdom of heaven is like treasure that was hidden in a field. When a man found it, he hid it again. He was very happy. So he went and sold everything he had. And he bought that field.
Translated Sentence: "The kingdom of heaven is like treasure hidden in a field. When a man found it, he went away in joy and sold all he had and bought that field.

Original: وكتشبه مملكة السماوات عاوتاني لواحد التاجر كان كيقلب على الجوهر الصافي،
Original Translation: "Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a trader who was looking for fine pearls.
Translated Sentence: "Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a merchant looking for fine pearls.

Original: وملي لقا واحد الجوهرة غالية بزاف، مشى باع كل ما كيملك وشراها».
Original Translation: He found one that was very valuable. So he went away and sold everything he had. And he bought that pearl. The Story of the Net
Translated Sentence: When he found one of great value, he went and sold everything he had and bought it.

Original: «وكتشبه مملكة السماوات عاوتاني لواحد الشبكة رماوها الصيادا فالبحر، وجمعات الحوت من كل نوع.
Original Translation: "Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net. It was let down into the lake. It caught all kinds of fish.
Translated Sentence: "Again, the kingdom of heaven is like a net that was let down into the sea and caught all kinds of fish.

Original: وملي عمرات، خرجوها الصيادا لجنب البحر وݣلسو وبداو كيعزلو، اللي مزيان داروه فالسلل واللي ما صالح لوالو رماوه.
Original Translation: When it was full, the fishermen pulled it up on the shore. Then they sat down and gathered the good fish into baskets. But they threw the bad fish away.
Translated Sentence: When the fishermen were done, they took it to the shore and sat down and began to isolate it, the good ones in the basket and the bad ones in the net.

Original: وهكا غادي يكون فاللخر ديال الزمان: غادي يجيو الملايكة ويعزلو المدنبين من بين اللي متاقيين الله،
Original Translation: This is how it will be on judgment day. The angels will come. They will separate the people who did what is wrong from those who did what is right.
Translated Sentence: This is how it will be at the end of the age. The angels will come and separate the wicked from the righteous

Original: ويرميو المدنبين فالزوبية د العافية، تم فين غادي يكون البكا وتغزاز السنان». الكنز الجديد والقديم
Original Translation: They will throw the evil people into the blazing furnace. There the evil ones will sob and grind their teeth.
Translated Sentence: The guilty are thrown into the wellness area, where they will be weeping and gnashing their teeth.

Original: وسول يسوع تلامده وݣال: «واش فهمتو هادشي كله؟» وجاوبوه: «إيه!»،
Original Translation: "Do you understand all these things?" Jesus asked.  "Yes," they replied.
Translated Sentence: "Have you understood all these things? " Jesus asked". Yes, " they replied.

Original: وهو يݣول ليهم: «إيوا راه على هادشي، كل واحد من العلما د الشرع عرف مملكة السماوات، كيشبه لشي مول الدار اللي كيخرج من الكنز دياله كل حاجة جديدة وقديمة». الناصرة ما قبلاتش يسوع
Original Translation: He said to them, "Every teacher of the law who has been taught about the kingdom of heaven is like the owner of a house. He brings new treasures out of his storeroom as well as old ones." A Prophet Without Honor
Translated Sentence: He said to them, "Therefore every teacher of the law who has been instructed about the kingdom of heaven is like a landowner who brings out of his treasure things both new and old".

Original: وملي كمل يسوع هاد المتول، مشى من تم.
Original Translation: Jesus finished telling these stories. Then he moved on from there.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus had finished these instructions, he went on from there.

Original: ورجع لمدينته الناصرة، كيعلم الناس فديور الصلاة حتى تعجبو وبداو كيسولو: «منين جاته هاد الحكمة وهاد المعجزات؟
Original Translation: He came to his hometown of Nazareth. There he began teaching the people in their synagogue. They were amazed.  "Where did this man get this wisdom? Where did he get this power to do miracles?" they asked.
Translated Sentence: He came to his hometown of Nazareth and taught the people in the synagogues, so that they were amazed and said, "Where did this man get this wisdom and these miraculous powers?

Original: واش ماشي هادا هو ولد النجار؟ واش ماشي مه هي اللي سميتها مريم، وخوته هم يعقوب ويوسف وسمعان ويهودا؟
Original Translation: "Isn't this the carpenter's son? Isn't his mother's name Mary? Aren't his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and Judas?
Translated Sentence: "Isn't this the carpenter's son? Isn't his name Mary, and aren't his brothers James, Joseph, Simon and Judas?

Original: واش ماشي ݣاع خواتاته ساكنين فمدينتنا؟ إيوا منين جاه هادشي كله؟»
Original Translation: Aren't all his sisters with us? Then where did this man get all these things?"
Translated Sentence: Don't all his friends live in our town? Where did all this come from?

Original: وما عجبهمش الحال، ولكن يسوع ݣال ليهم: «النبي كيتحترم فكل بلاصة من غير فبلاده، وفوسط عائلته» يوحنا 4‏:44 .
Original Translation: They were not pleased with him at all.  But Jesus said to them, "A prophet is not honored in his hometown. He doesn't receive any honor in his own home."
Translated Sentence: And this displeased them. Jesus said to them, "Only in his hometown and in his own house is a prophet without honor".

Original: وما دارش فديك البلاصة بزاف ديال المعجزات حيت ما عندهم إيمان.
Original Translation: He did only a few miracles there because they had no faith.
Translated Sentence: There are not many miracles in that place because they have no faith.

Original: الفصل ربعطاش الموت ديال يوحنا المعمدان
Original Translation: John the Baptist's Head Is Cut Off
Translated Sentence: Chapter fourteen: The Death of John the Baptist

Original: وفداك الوقت، سمع هيرودس الحاكم بخبار يسوع،
Original Translation: At that time Herod, the ruler of Galilee and Perea, heard reports about Jesus.
Translated Sentence: At that time Herod the tetrarch heard the reports about Jesus,

Original: وهو يݣول للخداما دياله: «هادا راه يوحنا المعمدان اللي تبعت من الموت، داكشي علاش المعجزات كيتدارو على يديه».
Original Translation: He said to his attendants, "This is John the Baptist. He has risen from the dead! That is why he has the power to do miracles."
Translated Sentence: and he said to his attendants, "This is John the Baptist; he has risen from the dead! That is why miraculous powers are at work in him".

Original: حيت هيرودس كان قبط يوحنا وكتفه ودخله للحبس على قبل هيروديا مراة خوه فيلبس. لوقا
Original Translation: Herod had arrested John. He had tied him up and put him in prison because of Herodias. She was the wife of Herod's brother Philip.
Translated Sentence: For Herod himself had arrested John, arrested him and put him in prison for the murder of Herodias, his sister Philip's wife.

Original: علاحقاش يوحنا كان كيݣول ليه: «ماشي حلال عليك باش تزوجها».
Original Translation: John had been saying to Herod, "It is against the Law for you to have her."
Translated Sentence: for John had been saying to him: "It is not lawful for you to have her".

Original: وكان باغي يقتله، ولكن خاف من الشعب حيت كانو كيآمنو بلي هو نبي.
Original Translation: Herod wanted to kill John. But he was afraid of the people, because they thought John was a prophet.
Translated Sentence: Herod wanted to kill him, but he was afraid of the people, because they held that he was a prophet.

Original: وفالحفلة د عيد الميلاد ديال هيرودس، شطحات بنت هيروديا فالحفلة، وعجبات هيرودس.
Original Translation: On Herod's birthday the daughter of Herodias danced for Herod and his guests. She pleased Herod very much.
Translated Sentence: At Herod's birthday party, Herodias' daughter danced at the party, and Herod was pleased.

Original: وهادشي علاش حلف حتى يعطيها داكشي اللي طلبات.
Original Translation: So he promised with an oath to give her anything she asked for.
Translated Sentence: And that is because he swore to give her what she asked for.

Original: وحيت وصاتها مها آش تدير، ݣالت لهيرودس: «جيب لي دابا راس يوحنا المعمدان فطبسيل!».
Original Translation: Her mother told her what to say. So the girl said to Herod, "Give me the head of John the Baptist on a big plate."
Translated Sentence: When the girl learned what he had done, she said, "Give me now the head of John the Baptist on a platter".

Original: وحزن الملك، ولكن على قبل الحلوف اللي حلف والناس اللي حاضرين آمر باش يتعطى ليها داكشي اللي بغات.
Original Translation: The king was very upset. But he thought of his promise and his dinner guests. So he told one of his men to give her what she asked for.
Translated Sentence: The king was grieved, but because of the oath he had sworn and the people present, he ordered that she be given what she wanted.

Original: وصيفط اللي يقطع راس يوحنا فالحبس،
Original Translation: Herod had John's head cut off in the prison.
Translated Sentence: And he sent the beheaded man to the prison,

Original: وجابوه فواحد الطبسيل وعطاوه للبنت، وداته لمها.
Original Translation: His head was brought in on a big plate and given to the girl. She then carried it to her mother.
Translated Sentence: They brought it in a tray and gave it to the girl, who gave it to her mother.

Original: وجاو تلامد يوحنا، وهزو الدات دياله ودفنوها، ومن بعد مشاو وخبرو يسوع. يسوع كيوكل خمسالاف واحد
Original Translation: John's disciples came and took his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus. Jesus Feeds the Five Thousand
Translated Sentence: John's disciples came and took his body and buried it. Then they went and told Jesus.

Original: وملي سمع يسوع هاد الأمور، مشى من تم فالفلوكة لواحد الموضع خالي بوحده. وملي عرفو الجماعات د الناس بلي هو غادي لتم، تبعوه من المدون على رجليهم.
Original Translation: Jesus heard what had happened to John. He wanted to be alone. So he went in a boat to a quiet place. The crowds heard about this. They followed him on foot from the towns.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus heard this, he withdrew by boat privately to a solitary place. Hearing of this, the crowds followed him on foot.

Original: وملي نزل من الفلوكة شاف جماعة كبيرة ديال الناس، وحن عليهم وشفى المرضى ديالهم.
Original Translation: When Jesus came ashore, he saw a large crowd. He felt deep concern for them. He healed their sick people.
Translated Sentence: When Jesus stepped out of the boat, he saw a large crowd, and he healed their sick.

Original: وملي جات العشية، قربو ليه تلامده وݣالو ليه: «راه مشى الحال وحنا فهاد الخلا، إيوا ݣول للجماعات د الناس يمشيو للدواور باش يشريو لراسهم الماكلة».
Original Translation: When it was almost evening, the disciples came to him. "There is nothing here," they said. "It's already getting late. Send the crowds away. They can go and buy some food in the villages."
Translated Sentence: As evening approached, his disciples came to him and said, "This is a remote place, and it's already getting late. Send the crowds away, so they can go to the villages and buy themselves some food".

Original: ولكن يسوع ݣال ليهم: «ما كاين لاش يمشيو، عطيوهم نتم ما ياكلو».
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "They don't need to go away. You give them something to eat."
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "They do not need to go away. You give them something to eat".

Original: وݣالو ليه: «راه ما عندنا هنا غير خمسة د الخبزات وجوج حوتات».
Original Translation: "We have only five loaves of bread and two fish," they answered.
Translated Sentence: "We have here only five loaves of bread and two fish, " they answered.

Original: وݣال ليهم: «أراوهم لي لهنا!».
Original Translation: "Bring them here to me," he said.
Translated Sentence: "Bring them here, " he said".

Original: وهو يآمر الجماعات د الناس باش يݣلسو على الربيع. وخدا هادوك الخمسة د الخبزات والجوج د الحوتات وهز عينيه للسما وشكر الله. وملي قطع الخبزات عطى لتلامده، والتلامد عطاو للجماعات ديال الناس.
Original Translation: Then Jesus directed the people to sit down on the grass. He took the five loaves and the two fish. He looked up to heaven and gave thanks. He broke the loaves into pieces. Then he gave them to the disciples. And the disciples gave them to the people.
Translated Sentence: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground. Then he took the five loaves and the two fish, looked up to heaven and gave thanks. Then he broke the loaves and gave them to the disciples, and the disciples gave them to the people.

Original: وكلاو كلهم حتى شبعو، ومن بعد جمعو طناشر ݣفة عامرة بالطروف د الخبز اللي شاطو.
Original Translation: All of them ate and were satisfied. The disciples picked up 12 baskets of leftover pieces.
Translated Sentence: They all ate and were satisfied, and the disciples picked up twelve basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

Original: وكانو هادوك اللي كلاو شي خمسالاف واحد، من غير العيالات والولاد. يسوع كيتمشى فوق الما
Original Translation: The number of men who ate was about 5,000. Women and children also ate. Jesus Walks on the Water
Translated Sentence: The number of those who ate was about five thousand, besides women and children. Jesus walked on the lake.

Original: وآمر يسوع تلامده باش يركبو ديك الساعة فالفلوكة ويسبقوه للجهة لخرى، على ما يصيفط الجماعات د الناس بحالهم.
Original Translation: Right away Jesus made the disciples get into the boat. He had them go on ahead of him to the other side of the Sea of Galilee. Then he sent the crowd away.
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus made his disciples get into the boat and go on ahead of him to the other side, while he dismissed the crowd.

Original: وملي صيفطهم، طلع للجبل بوحده باش يصلي. وبقى بوحده تم حتى جات العشية.
Original Translation: After he had sent them away, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone.
Translated Sentence: After he had dismissed them, he went up on a mountainside by himself to pray. When evening came, he was there alone,

Original: وبعدات الفلوكة ديال التلامد بزاف فوسط البحر وغلبوها الماج، علاحقاش كانت الريح مضاداها.
Original Translation: The boat was already a long way from land. It was being pounded by the waves because the wind was blowing against it.
Translated Sentence: The boat was caught in the middle of the sea and overwhelmed by the waves because of the headwind.

Original: وفالفجر، جا يسوع عند تلامده وهو كيتمشى فوق الما.
Original Translation: Early in the morning, Jesus went out to the disciples. He walked on the lake.
Translated Sentence: In the wee hours of the morning Jesus went to them, walking on the water.

Original: وملي شافوه التلامد كيتمشى فوق الما، تخلعو وݣالو: «هادا خيال شي جن»، وغوتو من كترة الخوف.
Original Translation: They saw him walking on the lake and were terrified. "It's a ghost!" they said. And they cried out in fear.
Translated Sentence: When the disciples saw him walking on the lake, they were terrified. "It's a ghost, " they said, and cried out in fear.

Original: وفديك الساعة، تكلم معاهم يسوع وݣال: «تشجعو، أنا هو، ما تخافوش!».
Original Translation: Right away Jesus called out to them, "Be brave! It is I. Don't be afraid."
Translated Sentence: At once Jesus spoke to them and said, "Take courage! It is I. Don't be afraid".

Original: وهو يݣول ليه بطرس: «آ سيدي، إلا كنت نت هو، آمرني باش نجي لعندك كنتمشى فوق الما».
Original Translation: "Lord, is it you?" Peter asked. "If it is, tell me to come to you on the water."
Translated Sentence: Peter answered, "Yes, Lord, if it is you, tell me to come to you on the water".

Original: وݣال ليه يسوع: «أجي!» وهو ينزل بطرس من الفلوكة ومشى فوق الما لجهة يسوع.
Original Translation: "Come," Jesus said.  So Peter got out of the boat. He walked on the water toward Jesus.
Translated Sentence: "Come, " he said. Then Peter got down out of the boat, walked on the water and came toward Jesus.

Original: ولكن ملي شاف الريح قوية تخلع وبدا كيغرق، وهو يغوت وݣال: «عتقني آ سيدي!»
Original Translation: But when Peter saw the wind, he was afraid. He began to sink. He cried out, "Lord! Save me!"
Translated Sentence: But when he saw that the wind was strong, and he began to sink, he cried out, "Lord, save me!"

Original: ودغيا مد يسوع يده وقبطه وݣال ليه: «آ قليل الإيمان، علاش شكيتي؟».
Original Translation: Right away Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. "Your faith is so small!" he said. "Why did you doubt me?"
Translated Sentence: Immediately Jesus reached out his hand and caught him. "You of little faith, " he said", why did you doubt?"

Original: وملي طلعو للفلوكة، تهدنات الريح.
Original Translation: When they climbed into the boat, the wind died down.
Translated Sentence: When they boarded the boat, the wind died down.

Original: وهادوك اللي فالفلوكة سجدو ليه وݣالو: «فالحقيقة، نت ولد الله». يسوع كيشافي بزاف د الناس مراض فجنيسارت
Original Translation: Then those in the boat worshiped Jesus. They said, "You really are the Son of God!"
Translated Sentence: Those in the boat worshiped him, saying, "Truly you are the Son of God".

Original: وملي قطع يسوع وتلامده للجهة لخرى د البحر، وصلو لبلاد جنيسارت.
Original Translation: They crossed over the lake and landed at Gennesaret.
Translated Sentence: When they had crossed over, they landed at Gennesaret.

Original: وعرفوه مالين ديك البلاد، وديعو خباره فدوك الجوايه كلهم، وجابو ليه ݣاع المرضى ديالهم.
Original Translation: The men who lived there recognized Jesus. So they sent a message all over the nearby countryside. People brought all their sick to Jesus.
Translated Sentence: When the people in that region heard about him, they spread the news all over the country, and people brought all their sick to him.

Original: وطلبوه باش يمسو واخا غير جلايله. وكان ݣاع اللي كيمسه كيتشافى.
Original Translation: They begged him to let those who were sick just touch the edge of his clothes. And all who touched him were healed.
Translated Sentence: and begged him to let them touch only the edge of his cloak, and all who touched him were healed.

Original: الفصل خمسطاش المناقشات على العادة ديال الشيوخ
Original Translation: What Makes People "Unclean"?
Translated Sentence: Chapter fifteen Discussions on the custom of the elders

Original: ومن بعد، جاو لعند يسوع شي وحدين من الفريسيين والعلما د الشرع من أورشليم، وهم يسولوه:
Original Translation: Some Pharisees and some teachers of the law came from Jerusalem to see Jesus. They asked,
Translated Sentence: Then some Pharisees and teachers of the law came to Jesus from Jerusalem and asked,

Original: «علاش تلامدك ما كيتبعوش العادة ديال الشيوخ؟ حيت ما كيغسلوش يديهم قبل ما ياكلو».
Original Translation: "Why don't your disciples obey what the elders teach? Your disciples don't wash their hands before they eat!"
Translated Sentence: "Why don't your disciples follow the tradition of the elders? They don't wash their hands before eating.

Original: ولكن هو جاوبهم وݣال: «وعلاش حتى نتم كتعصاو الوصية د الله باش تبعو العادة ديالكم؟
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "And why don't you obey God's command? You would rather follow your own teachings!
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "And why do you break the command of God for the sake of your tradition?

Original: حيت الله كيݣول: تهلى فباك ومك، واللي سب باه ولا مه خاصه يتقتل.
Original Translation: God said, 'Honor your father and mother.' (Exodus 20:12; Deuteronomy 5:16) He also said, 'If anyone calls down a curse on his father or mother, he will be put to death.' (Exodus 21:17; Leviticus 20:9)
Translated Sentence: For God says, 'You shall not kill your father and mother; you shall surely kill the righteous and the wicked.'

Original: ولكن نتم كتݣولو: اللي ݣال لباه ولا مه: داكشي اللي خاصني نعاونكم بيه راه عطيته هدية لله،
Original Translation: But you allow people to say to their parents, 'Any help you might have received from us is a gift set apart for God.'
Translated Sentence: But you say that if a man says to his father or mother: 'Whatever help you might otherwise have received from me is a gift devoted to God,'

Original: ما بقاش واجب عليه يتهلى فباه. وهكا لغيتو كلام الله باش تبعو العادة ديالكم.
Original Translation: So they do not need to honor their parents with their gift. You make the word of God useless in order to follow your own teachings.
Translated Sentence: He is no longer worthy of your trust. So you have abolished the word of God to keep your tradition.

Original: آ المنافقين! راه إشعيا كان عنده الحق ملي تنبأ عليكم وݣال:
Original Translation: "You pretenders! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you. He said,
Translated Sentence: Hypocrites! Isaiah was right when he prophesied about you:

Original: ناس هاد الشعب كيحمدوني غير بفمهم،  ولكن قلبهم بعيد علي.
Original Translation: " 'These people honor me by what they say.  But their hearts are far away from me.
Translated Sentence: These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are far from me.

Original: وبلا فايدة كيعبدوني،  حيت كيعلمو التعاليم اللي هي غير وصيات د الناس». الأمور اللي كينجسو بنادم
Original Translation: Their worship doesn't mean anything to me.  They teach nothing but human rules.' " (Isaiah 29:13)
Translated Sentence: They worship me in vain; their teachings are but rules taught by men. '"

Original: وعيط على الجماعة د الناس وݣال ليهم: «سمعو وفهمو:
Original Translation: Jesus called the crowd to him. He said, "Listen and understand.
Translated Sentence: Jesus called the crowd back to him and said, "Listen and understand.

Original: ماشي داكشي اللي كيدخل للفم هو اللي كينجس بنادم، ولكن داكشي اللي كيخرج من الفم هو اللي كينجسه».
Original Translation: What goes into your mouth does not make you 'unclean.' It's what comes out of your mouth that makes you 'unclean.' "
Translated Sentence: It is not what goes into the mouth that defiles a person, but what comes out of the mouth that defiles him.

Original: ومن بعد جاو عنده التلامد وݣالو ليه: «واش عرفتي بلي الفريسيين تقلقو ملي سمعو كلامك؟».
Original Translation: Then the disciples came to him. They asked, "Do you know that the Pharisees were angry when they heard this?"
Translated Sentence: Then the disciples came to him and asked, "Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this?"

Original: وجاوبهم وݣال: «ݣاع الغرس اللي ما غرسوش با اللي فالسما غيتݣلع.
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "There are plants that my Father in heaven has not planted. They will be pulled up by the roots.
Translated Sentence: He replied, "Every plant that does not sow good seed will be pulled up by the roots.

Original: خليوهم! هادوك راهم عميين كيݣودو عميين وإلا كان العمى كيݣود العمى، راهم غادي يطيحو بجوج فحفرة». لوقا
Original Translation: Leave them. The Pharisees are blind guides. If a blind person leads another who is blind, both of them will fall into a pit."
Translated Sentence: Leave them alone! They are blind guides. If a blind man leads a blind man, both will fall into a pit".

Original: وݣال ليه بطرس: «بين لينا المعنى ديال هاد المتال!».
Original Translation: Peter said, "Explain this to us."
Translated Sentence: Peter said, "Explain the parable to us".

Original: وهو يرد عليه: «واش حتى نتم مازال ݣاع ما فهمتو؟
Original Translation: "Don't you understand yet?" Jesus asked them.
Translated Sentence: He replies: " Why don't you understand everything yet?"

Original: واش ما كتعرفوش بلي ݣاع الحاجة اللي كتدخل لفم بنادم كتمشي لكرشه، ومن تم كتخرج لبرا؟
Original Translation: "Don't you see? Everything that enters the mouth goes into the stomach. Then it goes out of the body.
Translated Sentence: Don 't you know that everything that goes into a person's mouth goes into his toilet and then out?

Original: أما داكشي اللي كيخرج من الفم، راه كيخرج من القلب وهو اللي كينجس بنادم. متى
Original Translation: But the things that come out of the mouth come from the heart. Those are the things that make you 'unclean.'
Translated Sentence: But what comes out of the mouth comes from the heart, and that is what makes a man's body 'unclean.'

Original: علاحقاش من القلب كتخرج الأفكار الخايبة: بحال القتيلة، والفساد ديال المزوجين وديال اللي ما مزوجينش، والسرقة، وشهادة الزور، والسبان.
Original Translation: Evil thoughts come out of the heart. So do murder, adultery, and other sexual sins. And so do stealing, false witness, and telling lies about others.
Translated Sentence: It is the heart that brings out bad thoughts: murder, corruption of married and unmarried couples, theft, perjury, and spying.

Original: وهادشي هو اللي كينجس بنادم، ولكن الماكلة بيدين ما مغسولينش ما كتنجسش بنادم». الإيمان ديال المراة الكنعانية
Original Translation: Those are the things that make you 'unclean.' But eating without washing your hands does not make you 'unclean.' " The Faith of a Woman From Canaan
Translated Sentence: These are the things that make a man 'unclean'; but eating with unwashed hands does not make a man 'unclean.' " - The Canaanite Woman's Faith

Original: وخرج يسوع من تم ومشى لجوايه صور وصيدا.
Original Translation: Jesus left Galilee and went to the area of Tyre and Sidon.
Translated Sentence: Jesus left that place and went to the vicinity of Tyre and Sidon.

Original: وهي تجي عنده واحد المراة كنعانية من هادوك الجوايه، وغوتات وݣالت: «رحمني آ سيدي آ بن داود! راه بنتي ساكنها جن كيعدبها بزاف».
Original Translation: A woman from Canaan lived near Tyre and Sidon. She came to him and cried out, "Lord! Son of David! Have mercy on me! A demon controls my daughter. She is suffering terribly."
Translated Sentence: A Canaanite woman from that vicinity came to him, crying out, "Lord, Son of David, have mercy on me! My daughter is suffering terribly from demon - possession".

Original: ولكن ما جاوبها حتى بكلمة. وقربو ليه تلامده وطلبوه وݣالو: «صيفطها بحالها، علاحقاش تابعانا وكتغوت!».
Original Translation: Jesus did not say a word. So his disciples came to him. They begged him, "Send her away. She keeps crying out after us."
Translated Sentence: Jesus did not say a word to her. So his disciples came to him and urged him, "Send her away, for she keeps crying out after us".

Original: وجاوبهم يسوع وݣال: «ما صيفطني الله غير للخرفان الموضرين ديال شعب إسرائيل».
Original Translation: Jesus answered, "I was sent only to the people of Israel. They are like lost sheep."
Translated Sentence: He answered, "I was sent only to the lost sheep of Israel".

Original: ولكن جات ديك المراة وسجدات ليه وݣالت: «عاوني آ سيدي!»
Original Translation: Then the woman fell to her knees in front of him. "Lord! Help me!" she said.
Translated Sentence: Then the woman came and knelt before him. "Lord, help me! " she said.

Original: وجاوبها وݣال: «ماشي معقول يتخاد خبز الولاد ويترمى للكلاب»
Original Translation: He replied, "It is not right to take the children's bread and throw it to their dogs."
Translated Sentence: He replied, "It is not right to take the children's bread and toss it to their dogs".

Original: وݣالت ليه المراة: «إيه آ سيدي! ولكن راه حتى الكلاب كياكلو من الفراتت اللي كيطيحو من الميادي ديال ماليهم».
Original Translation: "Yes, Lord," she said. "But even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their owners' table."
Translated Sentence: "Yes, Lord, " she said", but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from the children's table".

Original: وجاوبها يسوع وݣال: «إيمانك كبير آ هاد المراة! غادي يكون ليك داكشي اللي بغيتي». وديك الساعة تشافات ليها بنتها. بزاف د الناس كيتشافاو
Original Translation: Then Jesus answered, "Woman, you have great faith! You will be given what you are asking for." And her daughter was healed at that very moment. Jesus Feeds the Four Thousand
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus answered, "Woman, you have great faith! Your request is granted. " And at that very moment her daughter was healed.

Original: ومن بعد، مشى يسوع من تم لجنب البحر ديال الجليل، وطلع للجبل وݣلس تم.
Original Translation: Jesus left there. He walked along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a mountainside and sat down.
Translated Sentence: Jesus left there and went along the Sea of Galilee. Then he went up on a mountainside and sat down.

Original: وجاو لعنده جماعات كتار د الناس ومعاهم عرجين وعميين وزحافا وزيازن وناس خرين كتار، وحطوهم عند رجليه وشفاهم.
Original Translation: Large crowds came to him. They brought blind people and those who could not walk. They also brought disabled people, those who could not speak, and many others. They laid them at his feet, and he healed them.
Translated Sentence: Great crowds came to him, bringing the lame, the blind, the crippled, the paralyzed and many others, and laid them at his feet; and he healed them.

Original: وتعجبو الجماعات د الناس حيت شافو الزيازن كيتكلمو، والعرجين كيتشافاو، والزحافا كيمشيو، والعميين كيشوفو، وعطاو العز لإلاه إسرائيل. يسوع كيوكل ربعالاف واحد
Original Translation: The people were amazed. Those who could not speak were speaking. The disabled were made well. Those not able to walk were walking. Those who were blind could see. So the people praised the God of Israel.
Translated Sentence: The crowd was amazed when they saw the mute speaking, the lame receiving health, the lame walking and the blind seeing. And they praised the God of Israel.

Original: وعيط يسوع على تلامده وݣال ليهم: «بقاو في هاد الناس، علاحقاش تلت يام هادي وهم معاي، وما عندهم ما ياكلو. وما بغيتش نصيفطهم جيعانين باش ما يسخفوش فالطريق».
Original Translation: Then Jesus called for his disciples to come to him. He said, "I feel deep concern for these people. They have already been with me three days. They don't have anything to eat. I don't want to send them away hungry. If I do, they will become too weak on their way home."
Translated Sentence: Jesus called his disciples to him and said, "Forgive the people; they have already been with me three days and have nothing to eat. I do not want to send them away hungry, or they may collapse on the way".

Original: وهم يݣولو ليه تلامده: «منين غادي نجيبو فهاد الخلا الخبز اللي يشبع جماعة كبيرة بحال هادي؟»،
Original Translation: His disciples answered him. "There is nothing here," they said. "Where could we get enough bread to feed this large crowd?"
Translated Sentence: "Where could we get enough bread to feed such a crowd? " his disciples asked.

Original: وݣال ليهم يسوع: «شحال من خبزة عندكم؟»، وجاوبوه: «سبعة د الخبزات وشي حوتات صغار».
Original Translation: "How many loaves do you have?" Jesus asked.  "Seven," they replied, "and a few small fish."
Translated Sentence: "How many loaves do you have? " Jesus asked". Seven, " they replied, "and a few small fish".

Original: وآمر يسوع الجماعة د الناس باش يݣلسو للأرض،
Original Translation: Jesus told the crowd to sit down on the ground.
Translated Sentence: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

Original: وخدا هادوك سبعة د الخبزات والحوتات، وشكر الله وقطعهم وعطى لتلامده، وتلامده عطاو للجماعات د الناس.
Original Translation: He took the seven loaves and the fish and gave thanks. Then he broke them and gave them to the disciples. And the disciples passed them out to the people.
Translated Sentence: Then he took the seven loaves and the fish, and when he had given thanks, he broke them and gave them to the disciples, and they in turn to the people.

Original: وكلاو كلهم حتى شبعو، وهزو سبعة د الݣفات عامرين بالطروف د الخبز اللي شاطو.
Original Translation: All of them ate and were satisfied. After that, the disciples picked up seven baskets of leftover pieces.
Translated Sentence: They all ate and were satisfied. Afterward the disciples picked up seven basketfuls of broken pieces that were left over.

Original: وكانو الناس اللي كلاو ربعالاف واحد من غير العيالات والولاد.
Original Translation: The number of men who ate was 4,000. Women and children also ate.
Translated Sentence: The number of people who ate was one in four, not including families and children.

Original: وملي صيفط يسوع الجماعات د الناس، ركب فالفلوكة وجا لجوايه بلاد مجدان.
Original Translation: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat. He went to the area near Magadan.
Translated Sentence: After Jesus had sent the crowd away, he got into the boat and went to the vicinity of Magadan.

Original: الفصل سطاش علامات الزمان
Original Translation: Jesus Is Asked for a Miraculous Sign
Translated Sentence: Chapter sixteen time signs

Original: وجاو لعند يسوع شي وحدين من الفريسيين والصدوقيين باش يجربوه، وطلبو منه يبين ليهم شي علامة من السما. متى
Original Translation: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to put Jesus to the test. They asked him to show them a miraculous sign from heaven.
Translated Sentence: The Pharisees and Sadducees came to Jesus and tested him by asking him to show them a sign from heaven.

Original: ولكن هو جاوبهم وݣال: «ملي كتغرب الشمس كتݣولو: الجو غيكون صافي، علاحقاش السما حمرا.
Original Translation: He replied, "In the evening you look at the sky. You say, 'It will be good weather. The sky is red.'
Translated Sentence: But he answered, "When evening comes, you say,' It will be fair weather, for the sky is red, '

Original: وفالصباح بكري كتݣولو: اليوم غادي تكون الشتا، علاحقاش السما حمرا ومضببة. كتعرفو تفسرو حالة الجو، ولكن علامات الزمان ما كتقدروش تفسروهم!
Original Translation: And in the morning you say, 'Today it will be stormy. The sky is red and cloudy.' You know the meaning of what you see in the sky. But you can't understand the signs of what is happening right now.
Translated Sentence: And in the morning you say, 'It will be stormy today, for the sky is red and overcast.' You know how to interpret the appearance of the weather, but you cannot interpret the signs of the times.

Original: جيل قبيح وفاسد كيطلب علامة، وما غادي تعطاه حتى شي علامة من غير علامة يونان». ومن بعد خلاهم يسوع ومشى. متى 12‏:39؛ لوقا 11‏:29 خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين
Original Translation: An evil and unfaithful people look for a miraculous sign. But none will be given to them except the sign of Jonah."  Then Jesus left them and went away. The Yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees
Translated Sentence: A wicked and adulterous generation asks for a miraculous sign, but none will be given it except the sign of Jonah. " Jesus then left them and went away.

Original: وملي وصلو التلامد للجهة لخرى من البحر، نساو ياخدو معاهم الخبز.
Original Translation: The disciples crossed over to the other side of the lake. They had forgotten to take bread.
Translated Sentence: When the disciples went across the lake, they forgot to take bread.

Original: وݣال ليهم يسوع: «ردو البال، حضيو راسكم من خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين!». لوقا
Original Translation: "Be careful," Jesus said to them. "Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."
Translated Sentence: "Be careful, " Jesus said to them". Watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees".

Original: وهم يݣولو مع راسهم: «كيݣول لينا هاد الكلام علاحقاش ما خديناش معانا الخبز».
Original Translation: The disciples talked about this among themselves. They said, "He must be saying this because we didn't bring any bread."
Translated Sentence: They discussed this with one another and said, "It is because we have no bread".

Original: وعرف يسوع فاش كيفكرو وݣال ليهم: «علاش آ قلالين الإيمان كتݣولو فخاطركم: ما عندنا خبز؟
Original Translation: Jesus knew what they were saying. So he said, "Your faith is so small! Why are you talking to each other about having no bread?
Translated Sentence: Aware of their discussion, Jesus asked, "You of little faith, why are you talking among yourselves about having no bread?

Original: واش مازال ما فهمتو؟ واش ما عقلتوش على خمسة د الخبزات اللي تفرقو على خمسالاف واحد، وشحال من ݣفة جمعتو من الطروف د الخبز؟ متى
Original Translation: Don't you understand yet? Don't you remember the five loaves for the 5,000? Don't you remember how many baskets of pieces you gathered?
Translated Sentence: Do you still not understand? Don't you remember the five loaves I broke for the five thousand, and how many basketfuls you gathered?

Original: وما عقلتوش على سبعة د الخبزات اللي تفرقو على ربعالاف واحد وشحال من ݣفة جمعتو؟ متى
Original Translation: Don't you remember the seven loaves for the 4,000? Don't you remember how many baskets of pieces you gathered?
Translated Sentence: Didn't you think about the seven loaves of bread that were broken into four pieces and how many baskets you collected?

Original: كيفاش ما قدرتوش تفهمو بلي أنا ما كنتش كنقصد بكلامي ليكم الخبز؟ حضيو راسكم من خميرة الفريسيين والصدوقيين!».
Original Translation: How can you possibly not understand? I wasn't talking to you about bread. But watch out for the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees."
Translated Sentence: How is it you don't understand that I was not talking to you about bread? But be on your guard against the yeast of the Pharisees and Sadducees".

Original: وديك الساعة، عاد فهمو تلامده بلي ݣال ليهم يحضيو راسهم من تعليم الفريسيين والصدوقيين، ماشي من خميرة الخبز. بطرس كيشهد بلي يسوع هو المسيح
Original Translation: Then the disciples understood that Jesus was not telling them to watch out for the yeast used in bread. He was warning them against what the Pharisees and Sadducees taught. Peter Says That Jesus Is the Christ
Translated Sentence: Then they understood that he was not telling them to guard against the yeast used in bread, but against the teaching of the Pharisees and Sadducees.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع لجوايه قيصرية فيلبس، سول تلامده: «شكون هو ولد الإنسان فنضر الناس؟»
Original Translation: Jesus went to the area of Caesarea Philippi. There he asked his disciples, "Who do people say the Son of Man is?"
Translated Sentence: When Jesus came to the region of Caesarea Philippi, he asked his disciples, "Who do people say the Son of Man is?"

Original: وهم يجاوبوه: «شي منهم كيݣول: يوحنا المعمدان، وشي كيݣول: النبي إيليا، ووحدين خرين كيݣولو: النبي إرميا ولا شي واحد من الأنبيا». متى
Original Translation: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist. Others say Elijah. Still others say Jeremiah, or one of the prophets."
Translated Sentence: They replied, "Some say John the Baptist; others say Elijah; and still others, Jeremiah or one of the prophets".

Original: وسولهم: «ونتم شكون أنا فنضركم؟».
Original Translation: "But what about you?" he asked. "Who do you say I am?"
Translated Sentence: I asked them, " Who do you think I am looking for? "

Original: وجاوب سمعان بطرس وݣال: «نت هو المسيح ولد الله الحي!»، يوحنا
Original Translation: Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ. You are the Son of the living God."
Translated Sentence: Simon Peter answered, "You are the Christ, the Son of the living God".

Original: وݣال ليه يسوع: «سعداتك آ سمعان بن يونا! علاحقاش ماشي شي بنادم اللي وراك هاد الحقيقة، ولكن با اللي فالسماوات هو اللي وراها ليك.
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "Blessed are you, Simon, son of Jonah! No mere man showed this to you. My Father in heaven showed it to you.
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "Blessed are you, Simon son of Jonah, for this was not revealed to you by man, but by my Father in heaven.

Original: وأنا راني نݣول ليك: نت بطرس، وعلى هاد الصخرة غادي نبني كنيستي، وقوة الموت ما غتقدرش عليها.
Original Translation: Here is what I tell you. You are Peter. On this rock I will build my church. The gates of hell will not be strong enough to destroy it.
Translated Sentence: And I tell you that you are Peter, and on this rock I will build my church, and the gates of Hades will not overcome it.

Original: وغنعطيك سوارت مملكة السماوات، كل حاجة غتربطها فالأرض غادي تكون مربوطة فالسماوات، وكل حاجة غتحلها فالأرض غادي تكون محلولة فالسماوات». متى
Original Translation: I will give you the keys to the kingdom of heaven. What you lock on earth will be locked in heaven. What you unlock on earth will be unlocked in heaven."
Translated Sentence: "I will give you the keys of the kingdom of heaven. Whatever you bind on earth will be bound in heaven, and whatever you loose on earth will be loosed in heaven".

Original: ومن بعد وصى يسوع تلامده باش ما يݣولو لحتى شي حد بلي هو المسيح. يسوع كيتنبأ بالموت والبعت دياله
Original Translation: Then Jesus warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ. Jesus Tells About His Coming Death
Translated Sentence: Then he warned his disciples not to tell anyone that he was the Christ.

Original: ومن ديك الساعة، بدا يسوع كيبين لتلامده بلي خاصه يمشي لأورشليم ويتعدب بزاف على يد الشيوخ والرؤسا د رجال الدين والعلما د الشرع، وخاصه يتقتل، وفاليوم التالت غيتبعت من الموت.
Original Translation: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples what would happen to him. He told them he must go to Jerusalem. There he must suffer many things from the elders, the chief priests and the teachers of the law. He must be killed and on the third day rise to life again.
Translated Sentence: From that time on Jesus began to explain to his disciples that he must go to Jerusalem and suffer many things at the hands of the elders, chief priests and teachers of the law, and that he must be killed and on the third day be raised to life.

Original: وجره بطرس للجنب وبدا كيخاصم عليه وكيݣول: «حاشا آ سيدي باش يطرا ليك هادشي!»،
Original Translation: Peter took Jesus to one side and began to scold him. "Never, Lord!" he said. "This will never happen to you!"
Translated Sentence: Peter took him aside and began to rebuke him. "Never, Lord! " he said". This shall never happen to you!"

Original: وهو يتلفت وݣال لبطرس: «بعد مني آ هاد الشيطان! نت راك سباب عترة لي، علاحقاش كتفكر فأمور الناس ماشي فأمور الله».
Original Translation: Jesus turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! You are standing in my way. You do not have in mind the things of God. Instead, you are thinking about human things."
Translated Sentence: But he turned and said to Peter, "Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, because you do not have in mind the things of God, but the things of men".

Original: وهو يݣول يسوع لتلامده: «إلا بغا شي واحد يتبعني، خاصه يسمح فراسه ويهز الصليب دياله ويتبعني، متى
Original Translation: Then Jesus spoke to his disciples. He said, "If anyone wants to follow me, he must say no to himself. He must pick up his cross and follow me.
Translated Sentence: Then Jesus said to his disciples, "If anyone would come after me, he must deny himself and take up his cross and follow me.

Original: علاحقاش اللي بغا ينجي حياته غيضيعها، ولكن اللي ضيع حياته على قبلي غيلقاها. متى
Original Translation: If he wants to save his life, he will lose it. But if he loses his life for me, he will find it.
Translated Sentence: I will follow him who wants to save his life, but he who lost his life before me will find it.

Original: آش من نفع عند بنادم إلا ربح الدنيا كلها وضيع حياته؟ ولا آش غادي يعطي بنادم فعوض حياته؟
Original Translation: "What good is it if someone gains the whole world but loses his soul? Or what can anyone trade for his soul?
Translated Sentence: What good is it for a man to gain the whole world, yet forfeit his soul? Or what can a man give in exchange for his soul?

Original: راه غادي يجي ولد الإنسان مع الملايكة دياله فعز باه وغيجازي كل واحد على حساب الأعمال دياله. متى
Original Translation: The Son of Man is going to come in his Father's glory. His angels will come with him. And he will reward everyone in keeping with what they have done.
Translated Sentence: For the Son of Man will come with his angels, and then he will reward each person according to what he has done.

Original: ونݣول ليكم الحق: راه كاين فالحاضرين هنا اللي ما غيموتو حتى يشوفو ولد الإنسان جاي فمملكته».
Original Translation: "What I'm about to tell you is true. Some who are standing here will not die before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom."
Translated Sentence: I tell you the truth, some who are standing here will not taste death before they see the Son of Man coming in his kingdom".

Original: الفصل سبعطاش يسوع كيبان فالعز دياله
Original Translation: Jesus' Appearance Is Changed
Translated Sentence: Chapter Seventeen Jesus appears in his glory

Original: ومن بعد ست يام، دا يسوع بطرس ويعقوب وخوه يوحنا، وطلعهم بوحدهم لواحد الجبل عالي.
Original Translation: After six days Jesus took Peter, James, and John the brother of James with him. He led them up a high mountain. They were all alone.
Translated Sentence: After six days Jesus took Peter, James and his brother John and led them up a high mountain by themselves.

Original: وتبدل الشكل دياله قدامهم، وضوا وجهه كالشمس، وحوايجه ولاو بويض كيلمعو كالنور.
Original Translation: There in front of them his appearance was changed. His face shone like the sun. His clothes became as white as the light.
Translated Sentence: And he was transfigured before them, and his face shone as the sun, and his garments and his feet shone as the light.

Original: وهو يبان ليهم موسى وإيليا كيتكلمو مع يسوع.
Original Translation: Just then Moses and Elijah appeared in front of them. Moses and Elijah were talking with Jesus.
Translated Sentence: And there appeared before them Moses and Elijah, who were talking with Jesus.

Original: وݣال بطرس ليسوع: «شحال مزيان نبقاو هنا آ سيدي. إلا بغيتي، نصايب هنا تلاتة د النوايل، وحدة ليك ووحدة لموسى ووحدة لإيليا».
Original Translation: Peter said to Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters. One will be for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah."
Translated Sentence: Peter said to Jesus, "Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you wish, I will put up three shelters - one for you, one for Moses and one for Elijah".

Original: وفالوقت فاش كان كيتكلم ضللات عليهم واحد السحابة مضوية، وتكلم صوت من السحابة وݣال: «هادا هو ولدي العزيز اللي بيه فرحت بزاف، سمعو ليه!». 2بطرس 1‏:17‏،18
Original Translation: While Peter was still speaking, a bright cloud surrounded them. A voice from the cloud said, "This is my Son, and I love him. I am very pleased with him. Listen to him!"
Translated Sentence: While he was speaking a bright cloud enveloped them, and a voice from the cloud said, "This is my Son, whom I love; with him I am well pleased. Listen to him!"

Original: وملي سمعو التلامد هادشي، طاحو على وجوههم وخافو بزاف.
Original Translation: When the disciples heard this, they were terrified. They fell with their faces to the ground.
Translated Sentence: When the disciples heard this, they fell facedown to the ground, terrified.

Original: وقرب يسوع لعندهم ومسهم وݣال ليهم: «نوضو، ما تخافوش!».
Original Translation: But Jesus came and touched them. "Get up," he said. "Don't be afraid."
Translated Sentence: But Jesus came and touched them. "Get up, " he said". Don't be afraid".

Original: وهزو عينيهم وشافو غير يسوع بوحده.
Original Translation: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.
Translated Sentence: When they looked up, they saw no one except Jesus.

Original: وفالوقت فاش كانو نازلين من الجبل، وصاهم يسوع وݣال: «ما تݣولو لحتى شي حد هادشي اللي شفتو حتى يتبعت ولد الإنسان من الموت».
Original Translation: They came down the mountain. On the way down, Jesus told them what to do. "Don't tell anyone what you have seen," he said. "Wait until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead."
Translated Sentence: As they were coming down the mountain, Jesus gave them this command: "Don't tell anyone what you have seen, until the Son of Man has been raised from the dead".

Original: وسولوه تلامده: «إيوا علاش كيݣولو العلما د الشرع بلي فاللول خاص النبي إيليا يجي؟».
Original Translation: The disciples asked him, "Why do the teachers of the law say that Elijah has to come first?"
Translated Sentence: The disciples asked him, "Why then do the teachers of the law say that Elijah must come first?"

Original: وجاوبهم وݣال: «فالحقيقة، إيليا غيجي هو اللول وغيصلح كلشي،
Original Translation: Jesus replied, "That's right. Elijah is supposed to come and make all things new again.
Translated Sentence: Jesus replied, "To be sure, Elijah does come and restore all things.

Original: ولكن نݣول ليكم: راه جا إيليا وما عرفوهش، ودارو بيه ما بغاو، وهكا ولد الإنسان حتى هو غادي يتعدب على يديهم». متى
Original Translation: But I tell you, Elijah has already come. People didn't recognize him. They have done to him everything they wanted to do. In the same way, they are going to make the Son of Man suffer."
Translated Sentence: But I tell you, Elijah has already come, and they did not recognize him, but have done to him everything they wished. In the same way the Son of Man will be mistreated by them".

Original: وديك الساعة فهمو التلامد بلي كان كيتكلم ليهم على يوحنا المعمدان. يسوع كيشافي ولد مسكون
Original Translation: Then the disciples understood that Jesus was talking to them about John the Baptist. Jesus Heals a Boy Who Had a Demon
Translated Sentence: Then the disciples understood that he was telling them about John the Baptist.

Original: وملي وصل يسوع والتلامد دياله لعند الجماعة د الناس، جا لعنده واحد الراجل وسجد ليه،
Original Translation: When they came near the crowd, a man approached Jesus. He got on his knees in front of him.
Translated Sentence: When they came to the crowd, a man came up and knelt before him.

Original: وݣال: «رحم ولدي آ سيدي، علاحقاش فيه لرياح وكيتعدب بزاف، وبزاف د المرات كيطيح فالعافية وفالما.
Original Translation: "Lord," he said, "have mercy on my son. He shakes wildly and suffers a great deal. He often falls into the fire or into the water.
Translated Sentence: "Lord, have mercy on my son, " he said". He has seizures and is suffering greatly. He often falls into a pit and burns.

Original: وجبته لتلامدك وما قدروش يشافيوه».
Original Translation: I brought him to your disciples. But they couldn't heal him."
Translated Sentence: I ate it for your students and they couldn't fix it.

Original: وجاوب يسوع وݣال: «آ هاد الجيل اللي ما عنده إيمان! حتى لإمتى غنبقى معاكم؟ حتى لإمتى غنتحملكم؟ جيبو لي الولد لهنا!».
Original Translation: "You unbelieving and evil people!" Jesus replied. "How long do I have to stay with you? How long do I have to put up with you? Bring the boy here to me."
Translated Sentence: "O unbelieving generation, " Jesus replied", how long shall I stay with you? How long shall I put up with you? Bring the boy here to me".

Original: ونهض يسوع فالجن، وهو يخرج من الولد، وتشافى ديك الساعة.
Original Translation: Jesus ordered the demon to leave the boy, and it came out of him. He was healed at that very moment.
Translated Sentence: Jesus grinned and let the demon out of the boy, and he was cured at that very moment.

Original: وقربو التلامد ليسوع وسولوه غير بينهم وبينه وݣالو: «علاش ما قدرناش حنا نخرجو الجن؟».
Original Translation: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private. They asked, "Why couldn't we drive out the demon?"
Translated Sentence: Then the disciples came to Jesus in private and asked, "Why couldn't we drive it out?"

Original: وݣال ليهم: «بسباب قلة إيمانكم! ونݣول ليكم الحق: إلا كان عندكم إيمان قد حبة الخردل، غادي تݣولو لهاد الجبل: تحول من هنا لهيه، وغادي يتحول. وحتى شي حاجة ما غتكون محال عندكم. [
Original Translation: He replied, "Because your faith is much too small. What I'm about to tell you is true. If you have faith as small as a mustard seed, it is enough. You can say to this mountain, 'Move from here to there.' And it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you."
Translated Sentence: "Because you have so little faith, " he replied". I tell you the truth, if you have faith as small as a mustard seed, you can say to this mountain,' Move from here to there 'and it will move. Nothing will be impossible for you".

Original: وهاد النوع د الجنون ما كيخرج غير بالصلاة والصيام».] # 17‏.21 هاد الآية ما كايناش فبزاف ديال المخطوطات القدام متى 21‏:21؛ مرقس 11‏:23؛ 1كورنتوس 13‏:2 يسوع كيتنبأ مرة خرى بالموت والبعت دياله
Translated Sentence: This kind of demon does not go out except by prayer and fasting.] # 17.21 This verse is not found in most ancient manuscripts Matthew 21:21; Mark 11:23; 1 Corinthians 13:2 Jesus again foretells his death and resurrection

Original: وكانو التلامد مجموعين فبلاد الجليل، وهو يݣول ليهم يسوع: «ولد الإنسان غيتسلم لليدين د الناس،
Original Translation: They came together in Galilee. Then Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is going to be handed over to men.
Translated Sentence: When they came together in Galilee, Jesus said to them, "The Son of Man is going to be betrayed into the hands of men.

Original: وغيقتلوه، وفالنهار التالت غيتبعت». وحزنو التلامد بزاف. يسوع كيخلص الضريبة ديال بيت الله
Original Translation: They will kill him. On the third day he will rise from the dead."  Then the disciples were filled with deep sadness. Jesus Pays the Temple Tax
Translated Sentence: They will kill him, and on the third day he will be raised to life. " And the disciples were filled with grief.

Original: وملي رجع يسوع وتلامده لكفرناحوم، جاو مالين الضريبة ديال بيت الله عند بطرس وسولوه: «واش ما كيخلصش المعلم ديالكم الضريبة ديال بيت الله؟».
Original Translation: Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum. There the tax collectors came to Peter. They asked him, "Doesn't your teacher pay the temple tax?"
Translated Sentence: When Jesus and his disciples arrived in Capernaum, the collectors of the two - drachma tax came to Peter and asked, "Does your teacher pay the temple tax?"

Original: وجاوبهم: «إيه، راه كيخلصها». وملي دخل للدار سبقه يسوع وݣال ليه: «آش بان ليك آ سمعان؟ من عند من كياخدو ملوك الأرض الضريبة ولا الجزية؟ واش من ولادهم ولا من البراني؟».
Original Translation: "Yes, he does," he replied.  When Peter came into the house, Jesus spoke first. "What do you think, Simon?" he asked. "Who do the kings of the earth collect taxes and fees from? Do they collect from their own sons or from others?"
Translated Sentence: "Yes, he does, " he replied. When he entered the house, Jesus was the first to speak". What do you think, Simon? " he asked. "From whom do the kings of the earth collect duty and taxes - from their own children or from others?"

Original: وجاوبه بطرس: «من البراني». وهو يݣول يسوع: «على هادشي ولادهم راهم معفيين من الضريبة.
Original Translation: "From others," Peter answered.  "Then the sons don't have to pay," Jesus said to him.
Translated Sentence: "From others, " Peter replied". Then the sons are exempt, " Jesus replied.

Original: ولكن باش ما نتسببوش ليهم فشي مشكل، سير للبحر ورمي الصنارة، والحوتة اللولى اللي غتشدها، حل ليها فمها، وغادي تلقا فيه ربعة ديال الدراهم، خدها وسير خلص عليك وعلي».
Original Translation: "But we don't want to make them angry. So go to the lake and throw out your fishing line. Take the first fish you catch. Open its mouth. There you will find the exact coin you need. Take it and give it to them for my tax and yours."
Translated Sentence: But to avoid any trouble, go to the sea and throw a hook, and the first fish you catch, open its mouth, and you will find four drachmas. Take it and pay for yourself and for me.
